The shampoo lathers up nicely and leaves my hair feeling clean, but not stripped and the conditioner leaves it really soft and manageable.  The scent is mild and very pleasant.  We first got a sample of Luseta shampoo and have stuck with the brand since then because of the difference it made on my hair.  It was dry and damaged from a summer in the sun and felt brittle to the touch, but it really softened up after using their products.Product provided for evaluation.

These are nice compression underwear.  I hover between a 38/40 in jeans and the l/xl size fits me well. I like that they are comfortable and not constricting. They breathe well and keep my thighs from rubbing on rides or when working out.Product provided for evaluation.

This WineCubby is pretty straight forward...it works exactly like it says it will in the description. It is handy when I go somewhere where I want to conceal my drink or I want to drink, but don't want to bring a glass bottle with me.  If you drink wine out of a bottle at the beach...you still have to haul back the bottle and corkscrew.  But with this you just fold it up and put in your pack.Product provided for evaluation.

I've been using this at work (Carpenter) and it's a great work light.  It's super bright, that's the most important aspect of it for me.  I also like how solidly built it is, and that it's portable and I don't have to use a cord for it.  The battery lasts a long time and when it runs out I like that I can just charge it again with my truck if I need to.The one change I would make, I don't like that the red and blue emergency light and pattern too closely mimics police and I think that should be reserved for actual police. I love the feature and it works great, but I would change it the colors on it.Product provided for evaluation of it's performance.

This did not work for me as intended at all.  I bought two different pieces of fresh ginger root to grate and all it did was turn them to mush. I use it now to make ginger tea, I really like it for that but it did not work for me as an actual grater.  To make ginger tea I "grate" (which actually means mush and juice with this thing) a piece of ginger and then take my cup of hot water and pour a little in it and mix with the ginger juice and then pour that back in my tea cup.  Clean up is easy that way too.

I enjoyed reading this book even more than I thought I would.  I worried that it would be dry and too technical, but it wasn't at all to me, it was very interesting and written in a way that the everyday person could read and understand.I like to read end-of-the-world and disaster preparedness books so some of the stuff I've seen covered before, but rarely in such a well-researched, even way.  Reading about the preparations the Mormons take was completely new to me and interesting.One of the best books I've read on the subject and definitely leaves you thinking.

This has many uses (bbq's, potato salad potluck, beach trips), but my favorite so far has been for camping.  I made a hot meal at home and then stored it in this and after getting to the campground we had a warm meal the first night there. Extra tips to keep it hot as possible...preheat with boiling water and in cold climates find something to sit it in that insulates the outside walls too.It is built solid and made of 18/8 stainless steel so it shouldn't rust and it's BPA-free.  The lid fits very securely, no leak issues with it.  Lifetime Warranty.

I thought this was a really good book. The story was interesting and the characters well-written and the writing style had substance. When I finished it, the first thing I did was look up what other books the author had written.  I don't always like stories that alternate between the characters in telling it, but it definitely worked in this book. I'm glad that I didn't read some of the reviews before I read the book because I think some tell way too much about the nature of different characters or events that unfold in the book and for me I loved not knowing anything and just seeing where the story went myself. The author did an excellent job of keeping me guessing until the end. I felt the ending was a little rushed, but at least it wasn't vague and it had a conclusion.

Since I can't really open it up to examine the quality of the contents inside and make sure they are all there and still keep it looking the way it does, this is more of a novelty item than a survival item.  But it looks cool and it's fun to give as a gift.
Great hat, nice quality look and feel to it.

I bought this to give as a gift and the actual backpack is great, but I wish the little white pouch that you pack it in wasn't so cheap looking.  It has writing all over the back of it in many languages and it's just unnecessary and cheapens the look of it.  I would much prefer it if the pouch was just white on back.  Other than that, I was very happy with it.  It is lightweight and convenient.

This is an awesome growler. Two features that I love on it that I don't have on my other growler are the wide handle and the large mouth.  The wide handle is nice because I have large hands and it makes it easier to hold and to pour.  The wide mouth is nice because I use growlers for ice water for work (construction) during the day and I can fit larger ice chunks in with the wide mouth on this. Then on my way home from work there is a store that serves various beers on tap so if I want beer I stop by there and get some.  It's also nice if you are going to a bbq or picnic and want to take a few beers with you but just the one container.I like that there is no plastic that comes in contact with my drinks and how insulated it is, it really keeps drinks cold.

We replaced our current Y Connector with this brass one because the old one was leaking.  It works great and we've had no leak issues at all.The handles are easy to turn.It is a solid connector and it's convenient to have.  We use it by our shop to run one hose to the garden area and the other to the driveway area.Connector provided for evaluation.

I like this apron, it's stylish and functional and has a comfortable fit and provides good coverage.  I'm 6'1, around 240 with a beer gut and it comes down to my lower thigh.  My wife is 5'6" and it comes down to her knees.It is 100% cotton and feels like a medium weight to me (not too thin or too thick.)The seams are straight and tight and the straps are reinforced.  I like the easy adjust neck strap on it and that it's easy to wash.

I'm 6'1" and hover around 240 and this apron gives me great coverage. It is wide and wraps around me so my sides are covered well and it comes down to my knees.  My wife is 5'6" and it comes down to her shins.  The material is heavy-duty 100% cotton and feels durable and is flexible.  The seems are straight and tight and the straps are reinforced. I like the easy adjust neck strap and how easy it is to wash.  Great apron.

This has to be one of the best done cookbooks that I've ever seen.  It really is a beautiful book and extremely informative and well-organized.The recipe layout is perfect...it gives you the ingredient list and directions in a nicely spaced format and then on the side of the page it gives serving size, helpful tips and variations that you might try.The pictures are gorgeous, full-color and very clear. In addition to the recipes and plentiful cooking information, there are also many pages of facts and details on various game, so it feels like a mini-encyclopedia within a cookbook.

This hand lotion works very well.  It absorbs easily and my hands are super soft after using it.  The scent is mild and pleasant enough, but it's not my preference. If they have this in a vanilla base, I'll buy it because it works really well.  I've been using it on my feet as much as my hands because it works great for foot rubs and softening up my heels too.

I think this bread basket is cute.  If you like the picture, you'll like it in person because it looks exactly the same.  It is made of thick, 100% cotton and is very sturdy.I have a 7 1/4 inch Fiesta salad plate that fits perfectly in the bottom of it...so I put that in first and then place my dinner rolls or muffins on top of it and the plate gives it a little extra support and also makes carrying it to the table a little easier.  It works just fine without the plate though too.Machine washable. Made in India.

I've been using exercise bands to rehab and build strength after a knee injury and I have several different sets of them.These Flexise bands are thinner than I'm used to so I worried that they would snap, but I've put them to a rigorous testing and they hold up strong.What feature I like about these that aren't on any of my other sets is that right on them it says their strength so you don't have to remember which is which or consult a guide.I also like how small and convenient the storage bag is for them, that is a plus too.  Because of that, they would be easy to pack with me when traveling.  I like that they stand behind them with a 100% Lifetime Guarantee too.Sample provided for evaluation.

This is a pretty cool Bluetooth headset.  I'm using a Samsung Galaxy S5 and it was easy to pair with it.  I think the sound quality is good, calls are sharp and music comes through clear without background noise or interference.  It's easily the lightest and most comfortable fit that I've had with a headset, I hardly notice it's there.I wish it was water resistant.  The manual says to avoid exposing your product to rain, moisture and other liquids to protect against damage.  The technology is out there and I'd think that would be a feature when you get into this price range on a Bluetooth headset.There is no volume control or mute on the device.  That doesn't matter to me, but it might be a feature others would miss.

This is a very basic travel guide for Route 66 and not one that I'd find all that helpful if I was taking the trip.  It has small font and is pretty scant on information.  Good color pictures and nuggets of interest scattered about, but for me, that was about all it had going for it and there wasn't enough substance to it to make it one I'd recommend.

I really liked this author's The Life We Bury, to the point he was the first author I followed on here, so when I saw his next book was out I was excited to read it and even put it at the top of my reading pile when it came.  But the difference between the two books was day and night for me and I struggled to read this one and finally gave up. The Life We Bury felt fresh and original with characters I was drawn to, the characters in this book felt unoriginal, no real depth to them and like ones I've read about a hundred times before. I was losing interest in the story because of that and then a line a female character gave a male character was so unrealistic and cheesy and it was the point I gave up on the book.  It felt like a scene out of your standard action movie where the female is one dimensional, there just as eye candy and unrealistic.The premise of the story was actually pretty interesting, but the characters bogged it down for me.

I've always used the classic Ace elastic Bandage with the old school small metal clips and I hate those clips.  I really like the new style clip! It is strong and stays in place and there are no little prongs that poke into you like on the older metal ones. I didn't see it on the product page, but if I had the option to I'd buy another clip so that I could place one on each end instead of just one in the middle.  That would give even more support, but even just having the one clip works so much better for me than the traditional ones. I didn't think the instructions were that great and to me they seemed to over complicate it and I can see why people might be confused by them. It took me less than a minute of fiddling with it to figure out how to snap it into place, it's very simple.The bandage wrap works well and I prefer the black over the standard color. I strained my wrist this weekend and got to try it out and it provided a lot of support and the clip kept it very securely in place, no movement on it at all.

Just adults here racing and we've been having a blast with this racing system, it is a lot of fun!  It's crazy how far technology has come. We've been playing with it for almost two weeks now and I still get that excited feeling thinking about it.I love that there are no lanes and that if you get off the track you can just drive back on and you are back in the race. I appreciate that you can set the experience level (novice, expert, custom) and that game play mode options included a practice mode.  That was helpful at first when learning the controls and how to race.  I like how comfortable the handset is and how easy the controls are to use while racing and that you can choose the amount of laps in a race.  You can also set your language (English, French, Russian, Japanese, Spanish, Arabic, Italian and German) and there are 5 sound levels to choose from.  Feels like race day fun when you can set the hazards and things like tire wear to give it added realism.It's a fun way to relax after a long day. We even do a quick 10 lap race to see who is going to do a chore, loser does it.  One of the guys who played it said we should set the track up around the Christmas tree like you do with train tracks as a kid.All you need besides what's in the box is a small cross head screwdriver and 6 AA batteries and 6 AAA batteries and a space big enough to set up the track.  The manual says for best results, use high quality branded Alkaline or Lithium batteries.  It would have been a nice surprise if batteries were included.

I've been testing this Amprobe 210 clamp meter out this week and seeing how it compares to my Klein (model CL2000).  Overall in performance, they are pretty similar and matched up. The Amprobe is less bulky and lighter weight and has a more comfortable grip. The back lit screen is larger on it.  My Klein has a couple features on it that I prefer, like the work light behind the clamp and the built-in probe holders on the back and side of the clamp unit.  I also prefer the blue back lighting on the Klein over the yellow/orange of the Amprobe, it is easier to read for me.Pros+ Consistent reliability, accurate to the point+ Quick response+ Comfortable, ergonomic+ Lightweight, compact+ True RMS+ Non-contact voltage detectionCons- no work light under the clamp- no alligator clips included- back light could be brighter- no built-in storage for probes

I've been using an older Jackson welding helmet in my shop that is similar to this model and it's seen a lot of use and is still holding up and in pretty good shape.  This model has a few nice upgrades to it...the headband is more comfortable, the adjustment knobs are nicer and the overall fit is more comfortable.  I really like the wide viewing area and the extended throat protection on it.  It's a basic fixed shade welding helmet, but it is durably constructed and has a comfortable fit.

These are awesome reusable shopping totes. I've tried so many different kinds and brands and these are my favorite.  You can pack a lot of stuff into them and they are so convenient to use!  They fold up flat so they fit compactly in the car and in the grocery cart.  The bottom insert is attached and you fold it down before adding groceries to the bags.  They are high quality bags and very durable.I've used other sets by the same company and my other favorites are the summer set Earthwise Summer Reusable Shopping Bag Totes(4 Pack).  These are what I use for groceries, beach trips, etc.

These are very cute and good for light scrubbing jobs.  I've used it on my coffee cups and non-stick pans and it's done a good job.  They did not come with any care instructions at all so I just guessed and I wash it with my with whites (hot water) and then I air dry it.  It has the little hanger on it and that works well for that.  Because of how cute they were, I haven't used one of the set...I just use it as decoration in the kitchen.  The other one is the one I'm using and washing.  It has held up so far okay.  After a couple of washes the eye started to unravel, but it still looks like a fish and functions well.

I am a huge history buff and recently became intrigued about the Dakota Apartments after it came up during a discussing between myself and some of my friends; I absolutely knew that I had to find out more after someone mentioned a few of the notable residents that lived there - mainly actors that I have always admired since I was very young. I initially bought this book to find out more about the place where some of my favorite celebrities resided in, but I am left more than impressed and intrigued by the rich and deep history that Dakota Apartments has behind it. I have to give a lot of credit towards the author for being able to capture and express such a diverse history into a format that is easy to read and also incredibly insightful at the same time.There's plenty of photos and illustrations that do a great job of complimenting the straightforward, clear writing style that the author uses to express the information. I admire this book because there's a relaxed tone that overlaps the writing, which does an excellent job of keeping the read from feeling `chore-like' without sacrificing the quality of the information and facts that I love to read about.Overall, I am extremely satisfied with The Dakota Scrapbook: Exterior, and it's not hard for me to tell that the information is backed by countless hours of research and well-refined editing, leaving this book in a tier of quality much higher than most others out there. For these reasons, I can't give this book any less than the 5 stars that it deserves. I will definitely be keeping an eye out for more by `The Cardinals'.

First of all, I feel that I should point out that I have read quite a few friendship/relationship-related books in my time, but I can definitely say that 'The Relationship Triangle' is by far not only one of the most insightful and and educational books on the topic, but also one of the most pleasurable to read due to the relaxed and almost conversational tone that blends perfectly with the writing style. The author has found that perfect medium of keeping the book informative - while also preventing it from feeling like a chore to read; this is something that I can't say for many nonfiction reads that I come across, and it's ultimately a huge part of why I enjoyed this book so much.The author offers some great advice regarding life skills in general for any kind of interpersonal relationships; this isn't a book solely dedicated for relationships between partners - it instead offers great info that can be applied to literally any kind of friendship or relationship and everything is expressed in a concise and straightforward manner and writing style that makes the best use of almost every single page in the book.Overall, I am more than impressed with the content and I know for a fact that I will be applying much of what I have learned essentially in my everyday daily life - what I admire most about this book is that it is full of actual PRACTICAL information that I found could be applied literally right away, I can definitely say that a large majority of the book really struck a chord with me on a personal level and almost the entirety of the read made a lot of sense to me. Although I am left satisfied with the read, I do wish that the book was longer - as I simply think that the author truly has a knack for giving relationship advice. For this reason, I am giving this book 4 stars, but I ultimately still consider The Relationship Triangle more than a worthwhile read, and I will definitely be recommending it to others.

The book offers a contemporary twist and perspective to what is easily one of my favorite poems, 'The Hound of Heaven', which I would also say is arguably one of the most classical & 'must-read' type poems to ever exist - and also one that I recommend to many of my literature-loving friends. Although I still prefer the original, I am glad that the author has included the modern adaption - as I think many people should be able to experience the message that Francis Thompson offers to literary world, and the classic version may be quite hard to grasp for some people, especially the younger generation (which was definitely the case for me the first few times I read it, many years ago).Of course, I already am a huge fan of the poem - so I won't base my ultimate verdict about this book on that. Instead I am giving this book 5 stars due to the effort that the authors have made to share the poem to a more contemporary, modern audience and also especially in regards to the professional and clear formatting and illustrations.I hope as many people as possible will get a chance to read through this book because, in my opinion, The Hound of Heaven is a timeless classic that should not be overlooked by anyone for any reason whatsoever. Overall, I give this book a 9/10 - and I will be looking out for more modern adaptions by the authors.

I began this book completely ignorant to basically everything related to the current state of affairs regarding how veterans are treated by the current administration. I can now thankfully say that "Something From Eddie" has really opened my eyes and I feel much more competent in regards to the current condition of the system, and also how veterans are so poorly treated. Eddie's story is not only a powerful and and emotional read, but also an influential one that I can definitely say has left me with a changed perspective.What I admire about this book is that it's extremely professional and sophisticated, yet also easy to understand and read due to the relaxed and conversational tone of the writing style. The author has found that perfect blend of keeping it informative while also preventing it from feeling a 'chore like' read in any way whatsoever.In summary, I am more than happy that I decided to give Something From Eddie a chance, and it has not only left me impressed - but also with an author name to keep an eye on; I will definitely be looking out for more releases by Pam Baker. I hope as many people as possible will get a chance to read this book, as I'm sure that it will leave even the most critical readers out there with some thought-provoking insight.

I have read many science-fiction/dystopian related books in my time and I would say that I'm at the point where I can tell very early on whether a book in the genre is going to be a 'hit' or a 'miss' for me personally. With that being said, it literally was only within the first chapter or so when I had realized that I stumbled upon a genuine 'hidden gem' of the kindle - and having just finished the read earlier today, I can definitely say that I am more than satisfied and very glad that I gave it a chance.What I admire about 'Hunters of the Last Dungeon' is the unique blend of influences from different genres that are evident in different scenes throughout the read - there's definitely a prominent sci-fi & fantasy feel throughout the entire book, but there's also parts where the book felt almost like a thriller due to a suspenseful and captivating vibe that stays throughout the book essentially from start to finish; there were many scenes where I found myself guessing what was going to happen next, but the author would throw in a very unexpected twist that would usually be completely the opposite of what I was expecting. I think the unique blend of genres that the author offers in "Hunters of the Last Dungeon" is a huge part of what kept this book such an enticing read for me, as I simply couldn't resist finding out how the story was going to play out; I'm trying hard to not throw in any spoilers, but I will say that the ending definitely was executed much differently that what I was expecting!

Meine Shne lieben Herman, den liebenswrdigen Waldoger. Ich bin total verrckt nach Ascardia, der Piratenkatze (ich liebe Katzen!). Das Buch steigert sich zum Ende und hat fr einen ersten Teil einer Buchreihe einen guten Cliffhanger zum nchsten Band. Die Illustrationen und Zeichnungen haben meine Kinder begeistert und mitgerissen, wir konnten uns ein schnes Bild von den Charakteren machen.Jedenfalls ein sehr gelungener Start der Saga mit vielen positiven, negativen, erfreulichen, aber auch traurigen berraschungen. Ich kann dieses Buch nur weiterempfehlen - ob fr jung oder Alt - bin echt begeistert, schon allein wegen der Wortwahl, die meinen Shnen zustzlich helfen besseres Deutsch zu erlernen.Ich werde das Buch sicher noch ein zweites und drittes Mal lesen. Ich hoffe, der zweite Teil folgt bald!

"Gas at 1.25 Per Gallon" is by far not only one of the most insightful and thought-provoking reads that I have come across all year, but also one of the most enjoyable to read due to the author's easy-to-understand, conversational tone that overlaps the writing style - the author has found that perfect medium of keeping the information professional, yet it's still concise and straightforward to the point that it doesn't feel like a 'chore-like' read in any way.. The main aspect of this book that I admire the most is definitely how the author offers a completely unbiased & objective look at the current economic mess - there's no heavy political-party influence, and it's not hard to tell that Bob Rice is truly more than competent and educated on the topics that he chose to incorporate into this book.The even offers some great points of how we can all collectively move forward, and although I was slightly skeptical about the premise at first, I can now definitely say that most of the book is built on a solid foundation of research and it truly makes a lot of sense to me. "Gas at 1.25 Per Gallon" has really 'struck a chord' with me on not only a professional, but also a personal level - and for that, I can't give this any less than the 5 stars that it deserves. I highly recommend it!

'Wilder Than The Rest; Book Six' is an absolute MUST read for any romance fan out there whom may be looking for a refreshingly different and new read- especially those that love a historically-accurate twist combined with a great blend of Western influence. I would say that Shirleen Davis has essentially mastered the craft, every literary device is pulled off excellently at the right time and the characters are believable and clearly well-thought-out to the point that I found myself thinking about them long after I had initially finished the read.. The style of the writing drew me in at a quick and smooth pace, giving me clues as to what will happen next... Then it would suddenly catch me off-guard with a twist or turn that the author would throw in - there's definitely a huge susepense/thriller element to Shirleen Davis' writing, and it's one of the main reasons of why I admire this author so much. Ultimately, this read is the definition of what a good romance should be like, and I would recommend this to literally any kind of fans of the genre.

The Big Wide Calm is by far one of the best YA/Coming-of-age related reads that I have had the pleasure of reading so far this year (and I am an avid fan of the genre, it's definitely my favorite and it's quite rare to not see a similar kindle ebook in my hands these days).I think I'm at the point where I can tell early on whether a book is going to be a 'hit' or 'miss' for me personally, based on a few simple things that I look out for from the beginning. Thus, I knew within the first few chapters that I had started reading an absolute top quality work, and I was essentially hooked from start to finish. I originally was recommended this book by a friend and although I was slightly skeptical about her praise at first, I now am aware of what all the fuss is about and, ultimately, I consider this more than a worthwhile read.It's not hard to tell that the author has read plenty of YA novels in his time and truly has a passion for the genre, the literary devices are pulled off flawlessly and I think this is the type of read that even the most critical readers out there could appreciate and respect. I'd give The Big Wide Calm a strong 9/10 - there were a few minor parts that could have been elaborated on more, but the overall read is well-refined to such a high standard that I feel this is really a 5 star book in the end.

I absolutely love it, I finished the book a few hours ago and I am left more than inspired from the author's words; the advice is easy to understand and read due to the relaxed nature of the author's writing style, yet it's incredibly professional and beyond insightful essentially from front to back. I found myself connecting on a personal level to most of what the author says and I knew instantly how the advice can be applied to my own life - the overall content of the book is very relatable and I feel that the author is not only offering information from a professional, objective perspective, but also a personal one - which I think is a huge part of why this book has proven to be so meaningful for me, it's not hard to tell that the writer is truly competent and understands what she has chosen to incorporate into the book. One of the main chapters that really stood out to me is the one about "A Few Ground Rules", this was a prominent part of the book for me because I was glad to see that the author, Ariana Alessandro, focuses on an approach that relies staying independent and not undermining oneself for any kind of man out there.Overall, I am more than happy with the book - I do wish that it was longer, but I am still definitely excited to see what else Ariana Alessandro can offer readers.

The absolute definition of the perfect relationship-advice/dating book. The writing is professional and concise, yet easy to understand and pleasurable to read due to the author's smooth, conversational writing tone that follows the writing from start to finish.What I admire about this book, and the author, is that she shares information from a professional and personal perspective - you're going to learn objective-based, general information from this, but also advice from real experiences in a realistic setting. This book isn't magically going to fix any relationship out there, but if there's any tool that can help in any way- my bets would be on Fall in Love Again.

With science-fiction being my favorite genre, I have naturally always been a huge fan of any kind of dystopian or apocalyptic scenario in a plot. With that being said, I am confident enough in my reading that I can say I can read and can interpret whether a book is going to be bad, good, or exceptional - all within the first few chapters. I knew early on that Nine Meals was going to be one of those exceptional 'hidden gems' that we, as post-apocalyptic fans are always searching for, and it has gone way above and beyond my initial expectations.The first thing that stood out to me is the pure originality and uniqueness of the plot, setting, and circumstance. The author didn't need to 'borrow' (steal) any archetype or proven mainstream elements to make his story; instead, he crafted a highly admirable book that I am sure even the most critical fans out there will be able to enjoy. I give this book a strong 9.5/10 and I will surely be giving it a re-read in the near future.

I must have gone through close to a dozen 'self-help' books before encountering this one, and let me just say right now - the quality of One Minute to Success warrants that I delete every-other related book off my Kindle right now - yes, it's that effective. It's refreshingly great to find an author that seems to truly have a passion for helping readers, as opposed to just trying to create a quick buck with recycled, repacked information. What I read in this book I hadn't seen anywhere else before, and the author's determined, inspiring writing style keeps you motivated throughout the entire read and long after. I highly recommend it!

I must admit that I bought this book half-heartedly expecting a few laughs and a load of nonsense. What I quickly realized, as I delved into the book, is that the author's definition of 'hypnosis' in this book is different than what many of us quickly come to suspect of it (and, of course, the related stigma). By talking about hypnosis in this other aspect, the author touches upon other topics such as building rapport and subtle things during a conversation that leaves you being the more dominant counterpart.I won't ramble too much in this review, but I highly suggest this book for any ignorant (as I was) to hypnosis in anyway. There's no pseudo-science or wild claims, and everything that the author mentions seems to have a solid foundation behind it.

Easily one of the best boxed sets that I have ever read! I got hooked on the first Sacred Breath book a few weeks ago, and they're the only books that I have been reading (when I get the time) since that day. My only problem with this is that I can't decide which I prefer.. I'm leaning towards book 1 or 2, but the author seems to have the ability to 'not lose momentum' - so book 3 and 4 definitely keep on par with the first two;  there's noticeable improvements in the writing style that come out at you, as you progress from book to book, and they all blend and flow smoothly and perfectly together. Overall, definitely worth checking out for anyone looking for something refreshingly different and also well-written at the same time.

I have suffered from social anxiety since my early teens (many, many years ago) and have never found even the slightest form of relief. I have tried mental exercises, many different medications, and even hypnosis. I was skeptical that this book would help me even the slightest, but decided to give it a gamble anyway - it has turned out to be one of the best decisions that I have made all year. I am not going to exaggerate and say that I am now completely anxiety-free, but I have picked up some really good anxiety coping and managing techniques from this book and it's now time for me to take control of my life again.. I highly recommend this to any anxiety sufferers, no matter how serious and debilitating your condition yours may be

I love it! The author writes with such vivid detail that it's hard not to find yourself immersed right into the story. It's overall well-written and the characters all seem quite dynamic, almost even 'life-like' - though, it's what they do with each other that really makes this book worth the read. If you're looking for a quick, sensual read then you definitely have to check this out, it excels when it comes to sexiness. I am only giving it 4 stars because I think that it could have been much longer. Other than that, it's worth checking out if you're an erotica fan.

Swimming with Asian Sharks is an absolutely top quality book in every sense. The information is professional, straightforward, and most importantly, practical - the information learned from this book can literally be applied right away to a wide variety of professions and fields.I really love how the author incorporates real-life examples into the book, I found the story of his aunt risking everything to move from China to Hong Kong (before it was a part of China) to be very inspiring and it set a very determined attitude and vibe to the book that stayed throughout the read.What I admire most about this book, though, is that Danny Hui has made it easy-to-read and easy to understand without sacrificing pure advice; a conversational, smooth tone is present from start to finish that keeps the read from feeling 'chorelike' or bland whatsoever. I highly recommend this book for anyone serious about business, whether they're at the bottom or already a business 'shark', I'm sure they could learn something valuable from this ultimately great read.

I bought this for my son and I couldn't possibly be any more satisfied with his response to it; he loves it because it's fun and I love it because it's educational - such a perfect blend in my opinion and, as a parent, you really can't ask for much more than that. He's only been playing with it for a few days but has already picked up a few things and keeps surprising me with what he has learned. I highly recommend this app for any parent out there! It truly is perfect.

Club 51 Earthbound Aliens is great! I bought this to read with my little brother and we both loved it.'Earthbound Aliens' has everything that any successful children's book should have; a creative, witty environment perfect for kids, weird characters with funny dialogue, and an exciting plot. There's really nothing else that could make this book any better, I highly recommend it!

Absolutely amazing! I started using this with my child a little over a week ago, and I have already noticed some significant results. Usually my son gets bored FAST with most apps that I introduce with him, thankfully, this isn't the case with this one and he seems to be enjoying it more than ever. The layout is very colorful and child-friendly, but the real value lies in how well it teaches - all of the games are very practical and clearly thought-out. For an app developer to make a game that is educational AND fun at the same time is quite a feat, and so this gets 2 thumps up from me!

I initially became intrigued about this book from the description.. I had no idea that it was going to play out in the way that it did, though! The story starts at a smooth pace that gradually gains momentum as the author introduces some new influential characters and a few twists and turns here and there.. By the time you're in the middle of the book -it's too late ! You're already hooked and there's no looking back. The plot is executed near flawlessly. The overall vibe of the book feels really unique to me, it seems to have a blend of many elements that you would usually find in very different genres. There's definitely a strong paranormal influence, but also some romance and a vibe of suspense that keep it enthralling and exciting all the way until the end. Overall, a great read and I highly would recommend it - I will be suggesting the read to a few close friends of mine ASAP

I couldn't have possibly found this book at a better moment in my life. I woke up one day this week and absolutely KNEW that I had to change my lifestyle and body, and Stay Fit for Life is the definition of the perfect resource/tool that is capable of helping me do so. The information is clear and straightforward, and it's all based on proven, time-tested research with a solid foundation behind it.I admire how the author covers both the physical and mental side to losing weight; even the things we consider to not be in our control (for example: genetics effecting how we lose weight) can still be worked around, and Stay Fit for Life offers the right information to do so. I highly recommend this book for anyone that is 100% SERIOUS about improving their health and going out there and making their dream body a reality. If you plan on reading this and set it aside like all of the other diet books (I used to to this exact thing) then don't even bother reading it; Stay Fit for Life is designed for the people who are ready to change and make a difference for once, and I am sure it will help many readers out there.

I love this book! Awesome epic fantasy action. Baleron is our hero, and hes cursed, but hes not going to let that stop him from kicking bad guy butt, is he? No!The novel is paced faced, with lots of twists and turns. The writing is tight and atmospheric. The setting is very Lord of the Rings-ish, but without the cutesy elements. No hobbits or bumbling dwarves here. But there are elves, and orc-like bad buys, a Dark Lord whos sweeping the world in shadow.Its dark fantasy and not for people who dont like a little bloodshed and adult situations. But for those that do this is your book. Classic adventure sword and sorcery, with an epic scope, and AN AMAZING DRAGON. Seriously, the best dragon thats come down the pike in a long time.Cant wait to see what happens next!

I bought this for my son and it has proven to be a great investment, as he seems to truly get immersed into it every time he plays with it. He's having fun while learning at the same time, which is seriously the best combination that you can find out there when it comes to kids apps. As a father, I am left satisfied and very impressed that something as simple as an app on my Kindle can bring a smile to my boy's face, clearly showing that he's having fun, while also educating him at the same time. I really couldn't ask for more, so this app gets a strong 5 stars from me!

Trolls be gone! This book is exceedingly well-written and well-plotted, with an amazingly fleshed-out world and terrific characters. The plot is fresh and original.Part One was awesome, and Part Two is even better. Things are really at their direst, the war has heated up, and the main characters are all bouncing off each other nicely. Raugst in particular emerges as a terrific character. He began the story evil, but his love for Niara and her awful sacrifice have made him free of the yoke of the dark powers. He is his own man now, but will he use that freedom to help the good guys or the bad?Meanwhile Giorn is trying to rebound from what happened to him at the end of Part One, trying to heal and rallying supporters to his cause in an effort to oust Raugst. Poor guy! He suffered a lot during Part One, but now is the time for him to kick some ass. Hes such a likeable hero we want him to succeed even though we sense that toppling Raugst at this critical time might be bad. Then again . . .This is where Niara comes in, trying to be a bridge between the two men. She tries to teach Raugst how to be human, and on the side of the light, while trying to make Giorn see that Raugst has changed.During all this, the dark lords armies have driven north and are about to overwhelm the good guys, and when they arrive . . . well, its pretty awesome. Dramatic and tragic, but full of action and adventure. The War of the Moonstone truly is epic fantasy done right, dark and juicy and cool. I heartily recommend it.

What I really admire about this book is that the information can be applied to a wide variety of businesses, regardless of their size. There's some advice clearly aimed at quite larger companies, yet I, as a small business owner, have gotten more than my money's worth with the entirety of Decoded, and am ultimately left beyond impressed. What I have learned from this book will surely influence many of my future business decisions in a positive way and my only wish is that I would have had this resource available to me many years ago.The book's premise focuses on a different approach than what most are accustomed to; it's an adaptable and flexible one that focuses on keeping up with contemporary changes and taking advantage of great opportunities that newer, data-based technology offers; it may seem slightly daunting at first, but the author does a great job of expressing everything in a straightforward and concise manner that is easy to understand without sacrificing quality. It's not hard to tell that the author (and coauthors) are truly competent when it comes to business management, and I doubt there are many sources out there that are as helpful as Decoded.I found the real life case studies to be great examples of what the Decoded perspective is all about, it helped me understand the concepts in a realistic and practical setting due to the wide variety of companies discussed; there's a reason why certain major companies stand out and continue to be successful and Decoded does a great job of showing how and why they do it.In summary, Decoded is an absolute must read for anyone involved in business - no matter what field a company specializes in, or how big it is, I am sure that it can benefit from Decoded in some form or another. Decoded gets a strong 5 stars from me and I would strongly consider it a "must read".

An absolute gem of a book in every sense. I was expecting a sort of "you get what you pay for" deal due to the small price, but I am instead left thoroughly impressed by the amount of professionalism and pure advice that Herbal Remedies offers.The author is clearly competent and knowledgeable on the topic and I can tell that it's not re-written, recycled advice (which I seem to be coming across a lot lately). Most of it is definitely new for me and I haven't come across it before, but I have a lot of faith in the book and it seems to be backed by a lot of science. I am not going to exaggerate and say that the info has changed my life drastically, but many of the remedies definitely seem like they could make a difference and I am very excited to start, as the author provides a very strong and convincing premise. I will definitely be checking out more books by Gigi Ann Louis as soon as I have some free time, if they're even half as good as Herbal Remedies, then I am sure I will be more than satisfied.

An absolutely top quality book in every aspect of the word. To say that I am left satisfied would be a severe understatement; the content has turned out to be way above and beyond my initial expectations and it has already been proven to be worth the time investment of reading it.I found the tips about self-publishing to be especially helpful, I had suspicions, mainly due to sites such as Amazon, that relying on a publisher (or middle man) would be a waste of time until I had already proven myself; I think the Theresa Ragan case study is a great example of this and a good way to become informed so that traditional publishers can't easily take advantage of the author.Overall, it's a fantastic read and the clear, straightforward writing style does a great job of cutting out all of the filler and instead focusing on the reader in the most efficient way possible. It's professional, a worthy investment, and definitely a 'must read' for any aspiring authors.

It didn't take me very long to find myself hooked right into The Book of Occult, to the point that I found myself reading it whenever I had a chance. It took awhile for me to finish (it's long; a great bonus for me) but having just finished a few hours ago, I am definitely happy that I gave it a chance. The author does a very admirable job of capturing the environment, vibe, and characters and expressing them in a vivid and visually rich manner - the overall read is a smooth and there's rarely any flaws.The Book of Occult has everything that defines a great book, yet with the author's own unique twist that does a great job of keeping fresh and captivating. There seems to be a blend of influences from different genres but definitely a prominent thriller/suspense vibe; this is executed in a great fashion by giving the reader clues as to what is going to happen next, yet always managing to play out differently to keep it captivating.In summary, I am very satisfied and I will definitely be recommending this to some close friends of mine. It may not be for everyone and might be a 'hit or miss' for most people, but if you're like myself and you respect and admire an author that isn't afraid to be different - then I would suggest checking this book out.

I bought this for my partner who has been a coin collector for years. He absolutely loved it and, even though I never really shared his passion to the extent that he does, I even found myself enjoying the read when I gave it a brief look over and actually ended up reading it before I showed it to him. I really had no idea that something as seemingly simple as an error on a coin could make it worth MUCH more than what it originally was made to represent.It's not hard to tell that the author is truly knowledgeable and competent on the subject and I found the pictures that are incorporated into the book to really help me understand and be able to know how to spot these subtle differences for myself. I bought this book for an avid coin fan but I think I may have enjoyed it just as much myself. I will never look at old change the same way again!

I have always been interested in the paranormal to the point that I can say I have literally read dozens of books on the subject. What originally intrigued me about this book is the emphasis on using photography as as medium to capture paranormal activity; I found this appealing because I haven't came across this before and so it wasn't long after discovering the book when I found myself indulging in it. To say I am happy with my decision to give it a chance would be an understatement.I have read quite a few similar books where the author clearly over-exaggerates and makes up things to try to give the book substance, Marvelous Afterlife is different for me because the author gives it to the reader in a straightforward, no-nonsense manner without a strong bias so that the reader can make up their own conclusions based on the information. I really admire the smooth delivery the writing uses, as it makes the read not only insightful and thought-provoking - but also an ultimately enjoyable and entertaining read. Definitely an overall great read from an admirable author.

I only just started getting interested in astrology a few months ago, but I can definitely say that I have read quite a few books on the subject already. Lisa Lazuli's horoscope book has been the best so far and it has been better than all of the others combined for me personally. What I like about this book is that the information is not only insightful and full of advice, but it is also practical; I feel like it would be good for beginners but I'm sure even the more astrology-competent readers out there could learn quite a lot. The only thing that would have made this perfect for me is if it had a section on health, I came across something similar before and I found it to be a great addition to the book.I especially admire the conversational tone that is used throughout the book to express the content, this makes the read a smooth, enjoyable one, as opposed to feeling 'chore-like' like some others that I have came across prior. Overall, I am very happy and I am left with an author to keep an eye on.

I must admit that I didn't really know what to expect at first with Beyond The Difference, mainly based on the uniqueness of the plot and the characters themselves. I think this is one story where it could have drastically went either way, depending on the author, but I think Veronica Heaston has executed it near flawlessly.With this being said and having just finished the read, I can definitely say that I am more than happy that I gave the book a chance. I really admire the protagonist, Luna, and I especially love the attraction between her and Elliot considering the fact that they have such different physical features. I loved reading as their bond grew and the hot, steamy scenes really made this book more than satisfying and worthwhile read for me. I highly recommend it!

This is a really great book with plenty of advice that covers a wide variety of home improvements; the best part is that it offers actual practical advice and I knew right away how I could incorporate some of the things I was learning into my home as soon as I read about them. My favorite section is Chapter 7: "Transform Your Bathroom into a Spa" and it has already helped me make my bathroom look MUCH better.What I really admire about this book, and which I haven't seen in any others, is that the author focuses on feeling better about yourself through your home, it's not just about bettering the actual house but also the people that live there - a unique and different approach but also definitely an effective one.

I love how each story is completely unique and original in it's own right, each author brings something different to the table and it keeps the overall flow of the book fresh and intriguing from start to finish. I loved almost every story but my favorites would definitely have to be The Scoundrel's Wife, Avon Calling!, and Raiden's River - there's something about the author's writing styles that are used to express these stories that sets the tone for the rest of the book in a very positive way. Avon Calling is one of my favorites because its premise is based upon balancing the normal day of a 1930's housewife and mother with her night time adventures as a kick-ass assassin or whatever she is! Great fun and definitely something that I haven't came across before.The only way that this could be improved is if the Kindle version was easier to navigate with by a clickable table of contents, so that it would be easier for me to find certain stories to reread. Overall, I would say this book is definitely worth the read and it has left me with a few author names in particular that I will be searching for in the future.

I have read quite a few investment related books in my time and I would say that I'm at the point where I can tell very early on whether a book is going to be a 'hit' or a 'miss' for me personally. With this being said, it was only within the first chapter that I knew I had stumbled upon one of those hidden gems in the kindle. The information is very professional and expressed in a straightforward, easy to understand manner - there's no complicated jargon that the average person can't understand.The author covers a lot of basics, so I think this would be a good reference for a beginner or someone who just wants to learn more about stocks; but there's also some more intermediate-advanced advice that I personally haven't seen elsewhere and which I found to make this book more than worth it's price for me personally. Overall, it's definitely a great investment in it's own right and I'm sure I will be giving it a reread soon.

The first thing that stood out to me about this book is the different approach that the book is based on compared to most other business related books.The author focuses on the inevitability of failure that comes with startups at one point or another, and how to move forward while learning from the experience. I feel that this is neglected in most business related books these days, as most authors want to focus on the seemingly easy part of a startup and to avoid telling to reader about the harsh realities that come with it. With this being said, I am glad that the author is not afraid to be straightforward and give it to the reader exactly how it is. It's insightful and and definitely an eye-opener but also written in a manner that is pleasurable to read as opposed to feeling like a 'chore', just how I like it. Definitely more than worthwhile read.

To put it simply, this is by far the best book about Boxers that I have ever came across. I have had mine for years and noticed quite a few differences between him and my other dogs so I found the book to be particularly helpful in explaining the little quirks and unique traits that have been apparent to me. I found the overall content to be very insightful in many areas and I am left more knowledgeable and appreciative of my dog than ever before.What I really admire about this book compared to the others I have read is the writing style, it's straightforward and I can tell that a lot of refining and consideration has gone into making sure that every page has been used to it's full potential.

The perfect blend of education and entertainment; my son loves it and I have noticed that he's already picked up some new words after using it. The interface and functionality is perfect for kids and I am sure I will be getting the full version very soon. I couldn't possibly be any more satisfied with the app and I will definitely be recommending it to other parents

I received this at a discounted price from the seller for review. And I can truly say that this is the most minimal iPhone 6 case I have ever seen. It looked so tiny when received. It arrived with a soft foam insert in it to hold its shape. I really thought it might not fit on my iPhone. It is a soft "jelly" like material and it stretched over the phone easily. After installation it was much better. It adds a soft grip feel and hugs the case tight. It doesn't protrude up past the screen at all so it will not protect the screen when the phone is set face down as in the stock photos. I would have a screen protector on for sure with this case. Even though it is thin and minimal, I find myself liking it. It is unlike any other that I have tested before. It will probably provide little drop protection especially at the corners, it will however keep the back and sides free of scratches. If you often find yourself carrying your phone without a case because you like the feel of the bare phone, you may like the case, and at the same time have a little protection.

I like the Symmetry Series because they are thin, protective and look good too. This is one of my favorite cases for the S6. It is simple, easy to clean and gives me that little extra protection that I know my phone will be ok from accidental drops. The rubber band feels great in hand and also gives a nice about of grip. I actually like it a little better than the MySymmetry Series because it feels slightly different in hand. I guess I could try to make an insert for the back panel that wouldn't slide around. It would be nice if they made a template. Anyways, 5 stars for a clean, elegant and functional design.I do think the price is a bit much even for a new product. $40 (at time of review) is a bit high compared to $15-$25 for the S5 version. Minus 1 star.

I like the Symmetry Series because they are thin, protective and look good too. This is one of my favorite cases for the S6. It is simple, easy to clean and gives me that little extra protection that I know my phone will be ok from accidental drops. The rubber band feels great in hand and also gives a nice about of grip. I actually like it a little better than the MySymmetry Series because it feels slightly different in hand. I guess I could try to make an insert for the back panel that wouldn't slide around. It would be nice if they made a template.Anyways, 5 stars for a clean, elegant and functional design. I do find the $10 more for it than the same case for the S5 to be a bit of a disappointment. It really is the same amount of material used in the case. I understand that you can charge more for a newer case, but really it is boarder line too expensive at $36 (at time of review).

I am testing this ZAGG Slim Book Case for iPad Mini 2/3 with an iPad Mini 1st generation. It seems to work fine despite the listing not including it as a compatible model.The hard plastic shell case holds the iPad mini securely and has enough of a front lip to lift the screen off a flat surface by about 1/16". The volume buttons and slide switch are all aligned with the case openings and easy to reach. I have found that once paired with the keyboard, I don't use them anymore, opting instead to use the keyboard's volume buttons. I like the case as a stand alone iPad case. I would however add a screen protector if you don't already have one. This will not only protect the screen but also make it a little more durable to hopefully prevent any scratching or cracking.The shell case is easy to dock to the keyboard. It magnetically aligns and holds securely. It is also easy to remove by lifting one side up and the other will follow. I find that the hinge holds the position of the iPad well. If you try to tilt it back too far you could risk breaking the hinge mechanism or the case around the hinge area. It has been designed to only tilt back about 10 degrees past vertical. I think if you open it too fast you may risk this type of damage. As you tilt the case back it also elevates the rear of the keyboard to put it at a slight angle which is nice for typing.The shell reversed turns the keyboard into a nice stand, I have found it very useful for iPad use in bed or reclining in a chair. Book mode is ok. I prefer to detach the shell case and use the iPad without the keyboard.This really turns the iPad into a cute little laptop in appearance. My kids love it. I find it adorable. It makes them feel so grown up. It doesn't even feel like the iPad anymore.The keyboard feels great. It is a little tight for adult hands but quite useable. It is perfect for smaller hands. It was easy to pair. Just hold down the bluetooth button till the power button beside it starts to blink blue. It should then pop up in your bluetooth device list. I am not sure if the keyboard will last 2 years before needing a charge. I find that hard to believe and I know it hasn't actually been tested yet.So far I am totally impressed with this. It is really a transformation. I like it much better than the other keyboard cases out there. None of which make it look so much like a macbook as this one. I have been using ZAGG products for many years and have always had a good experience with the company. I am going to give this 5 stars. If any problems are encountered in the future I will be sure to update.

I want thank Classic Accessories for sending out a unit for review from their new FadeSafe Line of Covers. I am putting it to the test.I became familiar with Classic Accessories every since I purchased my first grill cover in July of 2012 from them for $31.49. It is from their Veranda Series. Within the first year it turned from a nice beige with dark brown skirting to a faded mauve color. The fabric has never weakened or torn however, as some others have experienced with the Veranda Series. It is still in use today. My cover before that was a Charm Glo brand and it faded from black to gray and did weaken and tear in 1 year.I have been reviewing a lot of covers since then and many of them the Classic Accessories brand. They have been updating and improving their lineup over these past 3 years.The Ravenna Series brought in a UV resistant finish in a new gray color with larger re-inforced handles. I really like the look. It comes with the new colors at a similar price.The Sunbrella Line offers the best and longest life but at a much higher price point. I have several Sunbrella brand fabric awnings going on 5 years and they do last and resist fading. They come at a much higher price.So I am so far impressed with this FadeSafe Series. It has the same rugged and tough feel of the Ravena series, the Raven and Dark Shadow colors are pleasing to look at. The weight and feel of the cover is nice. The wind straps may be needed if you life in a place like Chicago, but I have found that I never need to use them because the weight of the cover keeps itself down. The mesh lined vents let airflow in which is a major concern if not done properly. These seem to be placed well and of the right size. Poor ones let water in and not much air. This creates an environment for mildew and mold, which can be a terrible thing if you have ever had that happen to your grill.I am very pleased initially with the cover. Of course time will tell the true story. I will be updating this review as time progresses. I have it placed on a Weber Genesis and out in the open where it will be exposed directly to sun and rain. It is not under a tree but sap does blow in the wind and I will also check to see how much staining occurs and how well it cleans up. Just from initial impressions I'm going to start out with 5 stars as it looks and feels very nice. This FadeSafe Series is about double the price of the Veranda and Ravenna series, but half that of the Sunbrella. I hope it holds up.... be back in a few months...

These old Swinglines will last forever and it is good to see that they still make them that way... Yes I do like the fancy red paint and one of my favorite NFL teams franchise on it. Get some good staples and this thing will make quick work of heavy duty stapling jobs. No problem with a 25 page document. It's heavy and durable and built like a tank. You won't be needing another stapler of this size for a long time so make sure you've got the right team. This one for the price gets you team spirit and a daily use office capable desktop stapler. 5 stars for build quality.

Infinity 3.0 continues where 1 & 2 left off. Disney, Marvel & now Star Wars. With Episode 7 due out in Movie Theaters soon, the timing is of course perfect. It is really nice to play as characters in settings that may be giving away parts of the movie before it is released. I will be real interested to see how much of it is accurate. Lightsabers are real fun to have in the Infinity World...I wish they could have fit all the game data on this disc so as to not need the older discs. We never use the 1.0 disc. Now that 3.0 is out we will probably never use the 2.0 disc. I just wish it integrated better so that you could go to all the previous playsets from the 3.0 disc.The previous 2 versions were 5 star reviews and I think this on is also. If your into Star Wars, I'm sure your going to love this like I do!

The Symmetry Series is one of my favorite for a sleek minimalist case that still provides protection. I like the bumper design as it sticks up above the screen enough but not too much. So setting my phone face down won't endanger it too often. I like to put it screen down if I'm outside and the sun is shining. Keeps it from getting too hot.I also like the feel of the Symmetry's edge band because it feels good in the hand while giving good grip. I have tested some other cases and the edge either felt sharp and too angular or was slippery.I like the button and charge ports on this case because they are large and easy to get too. Small ones make it frustrating to press the buttons. The clear area can get scratched but the inserts also help with making scratches less visible if you do get some. Over time the back will get less clear with micro scratches, but I usually only keep a case for around a year or so anyway.The inserts are my favorite part as I can feel like I have a new case anytime I want by changing them out. I like most of the OtterBox designs, but being able to print my own and with a little craft skills make my own insert is cool. I really can't think of anything that I don't like about the case. It is well made and of quality materials like most OtterBox cases are. Great case.

Gaiam TV is now becoming Gaia TV. I really like it for the $9.99 per month subscription, and consider it well worth it. You can find so many programs on here that are not really anywhere else. Beyond Belief, Wisdom Teachings, Cosmic Disclosure, Open Minds, and all the Original Shows, Movies, Yoga and Other Content. It is really Interesting Stuff. Love it.

I get these on subscribe and save for my kids. I keep them in the fridge along with other organic sodas and coconut waters. They usually go for these in the mornings and not everyday but perhaps 2-3 each a week. These are kind of expensive and I am glad that they aren't going too fast, but as far as a favorite drink this is definitely one they haven't gotten tired of even after a year of having it available. It always runs out before the next shipment. It is like a healthier and delicious chocolate milk / chocolate malt drink. I like the adult version of it and sometimes get it for myself to take with me to work.

I install TV's professionally and am always looking for great wall mounts. I wasn't sure what to expect for this $15 one. It seemed too inexpensive to be worthwhile. After being contacted by the seller to receive a free unit for review, I decided that it couldn't hurt. It arrived in 2 days via Prime Shipping and I opened the box. Here is what I found.Contents: wall mounting bracket, 2 TV arms, small bubble level vial, small package of assorted screws.- Screws - Usually with most wall mounts are a huge package of screws of varying sizes. I have hundreds of screws, spacers & washers left over from installs that I keep on reserve in case I need them. Nowadays I end up throwing away so many screws because I have too many. Having a smaller sized package of just the right sizes was refreshing. However, if this is your first TV mounting you may find that the correct screw size for you TV isn't included or already on the back of your TV. That may be frustrating. This mount is rated for 26" to 55" TV's. If your TV is larger than 40" I would check the back of your TV to make sure that it doesn't take the larger diameter screws that are commonly used for these sized TVs. You can still use this mount but you will need those larger screws which can be found at a big box store. Better yet would be to get a mount that includes them. Also if your tv doesn't have a flat surface for the mount then you may need longer screws and spacers to accommodate the depth difference. If so you may need more hardware.-Mounting Brackets - The wall mount and TV brackets are made from thick gauge steel and are very sturdy. I see no problem with them holding up a 55" TV. Just make sure to measure the hole spacings on the back of your TV. If they are wider than 18" or more than 16" vertically apart you will need a larger mount. The 18.5" wide wall mount gives you the opportunity to land on 2 studs. If you don't and are close to the center of the bracket you can just supplement the single stud with molly or drywall anchors to each side. If the stud is to one side of the bracket you will want to make sure you anchor the other side with molly anchors or better and/or try to angle long 3"-4" drywall screws into the stud that should just be outside the other side of the mount. Keep the weight of your TV in consideration. This should handle anything up to 60 lbs with no problem. If you hit two studs then the 110 lb weight rating shouldn't be a problem either.- Lock - To lock the TV on the wall bracket, you will first hook the top slots of the arms onto the top flange of the wall bracket. Then you lower the TV's bottom edge down till it sits flat to the wall. At this point you will need a long slender screwdriver. Preferably a philips with at least an 8" long shaft. This will allow you to go up from the bottom of the TV between it and the wall, to tighten the 2 set screws that lock the bottom of the TV bracket to the bottom flange of the wall mount. The length of the screwdriver needed will depend on the height of your TV. Once these are set you will not be able to lift the bottom edge of the TV up and out away from the wall. This will then keep the TV secure.Conclusion. This is a very useable mount. Don't let the price fool you. It is heavy duty and well made. It sits tight to the wall for a very sleek install. Do take into account that cables, power cords and such may stick out from the back of the TV and may have to be accounted for. I would also preinstall the cables as you will probably not be able to plug them in after mounting. I trust the strength of this mount enough to use it on jobs. It's that sturdy. 5 stars.** Note - It is not a tilting mount if  you are needing that. Hope this review wasn't too confusing and provided a little helpful information. Hope your install turns out great and without too many hitches!

The most minimal OtterBox case yet, still offers very good protection. I love the way it looks on the phone and how easy it is to carry around. The bumper provides a good edge grip and the clear rear panel and raised opening trim protect the back of the phone very well. It seems a bit pricey and I would think it would be in the mid $20 range. The clear part does scratch so that is something that you have to be careful with. Otherwise an excellent case.

This is a nice well made, soft and cleanable bumper for a small crib. The overall length is 126" with stitched corners to make it fit a 24" x 38" sized crib. It's 8.5" height seems just right. If found the 12 string ties to be enough for securing it well. The material is quality and it looks great. 5 Stars.

Ubervita really came onto my radar with their organic Turmeric Curcumin. I and many others with whom I shared the review bottle with, did find inflammation reduction benefits from day one. I have since purchased and take the Curcumin daily. Its effectiveness is superior to the many other Turmeric products I have take over the years. I specifically recommend Ubervita Turmeric Cucurmin now. Backaches, Muscle and Joint Pains all seem to be reduced by it. Now that I have a sample of the Cranberry, well its 2 for 2.Supplements are most always a subjective experience and hard to review. When you have had a back ache for weeks and taken and done everything under the sun to get relief and then find it with one product, it makes an impression. I find the Cranberry Extract to be the same way. You know when you have a UTI and you know when it's gone. It is a realizable and significant event. There are studies and research and I appreciate and learn from them. Then there is relief and actual experience for yourself. Your own research. This works for me. Here is another very useful and effective Ubervita product for me. It is really a better supplement.There are more active ingredients and in quantity too. They work well together too. Cranberry, Lingonberry, Uva Ursi, Dandelion, Chondroitin Sulfate, D-Mannose, Nattokinase are supplements that I have taken before, but never together in this mix and this easily. Quality ingredients too. The capsules smell very fresh and active.I highly recommend these and am sharing this review bottle with friends and family. Why not try them if you are having painful UTI's? Ubervita has a great customer service team and return policy. What do you have to lose, besides that fear of the restroom? ! I hope they work for you as well as they have for me!

I reviewed a pair of the Ringside IMF Tech Sparring Gloves and found them to be very nice for $80. What you will find for the extra $30 to upgrade to these  are more details and robustness.- The smell of leather upon opening the bag was evident. It isn't 100% leather but the full exterior shell is. I think it is where it needs to be. It gives a nice solid impact and feel. The stitching is very well done. It is double stitched and durable.- The velcro closure on these is larger and more significant. I really don't see it wearing out or losing holding power. You can also clean velcro and it will regain more holding power. Often threads, fibers or dirt can clog the "hooks" and they only need to be combed out.- 2" thick IMF Tech padding - I like this material. It lasts and holds up to many months of constant compression impact cycles. Less expensive gloves will wear out much quicker resulting in poor protection and hand ergonomics. Combined with the leather shell this gives a great feel when impacting during training.- I like the Quick Dry Oxford Nylon lining. Nothing is worse than smelly gloves and hands. I keep a small fan around that gently blows room air around the openings of the gloves after sessions. It keeps them odor neutral.- Attached thumb for safety. You can cut the strap that connects it if you really want to. I prefer it there.Here is the sizing chart:- 14 oz / M / R for Hand circumference of 7.25" to 8.5"- 16 oz / L for Hand circumference of 8.25" to 9.75"- 18 oz / 20 oz / XL for Hand circumference of 9.75" to 11"These are a worthy upgrade from the Sparring series if you are daily training and need something even more durable and robust. These hold the wrist well, but I find a little more tape around the wrists then getting the velcro tension right makes the feel perfect.

This is a nice entrant into the 2015 lineup of home theater projectors from Epson. I'm giving it five stars because it compares very favorably to the HT1075 Benq 3D projector that I have had as my main unit. LED and 4K are beginning to enter the market and I think the days for these bulb 1080P LCDs are limited, but for now this one has much too offer. It is plenty bright and the picture quality is amazingly good. The brightness does wash out the black levels and the whites also can suffer, with some calibration you can dial this beast in.Right out of the box the details and colors are amazing for animated and CG movies. I compared Penguins of Madagascar the Movie on both units and this Epson 2040 made my long standing sub $1000 favorite the Benq HT1075 look a little flat. The HT1075 seems to have better blacks and an overall better color spectrum, but the reflective shine on the octopus characters really pop on the 2040. You can see so much detail, it almost looks 4K. Hands down the image quality of the 2040 made a huge difference. Everyone preferred it to the HT1075. It made you feel much more in the movie.Then I moved on to Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory with Johnny Depp, and the that is where things got a little weird. The 2040 looked worse. Not necessarily poorer quality, but it changed the look of the movie from a soft matte with vibrant colors to a little more like a Soap Opera on TV. You could see every pimple, wrinkle and blemish on everyones faces. Even the motion of people walking and other movements looked odd too. I went into the menus to see what was happening. There are 4 color modes - Dynamic, Bright Cinema, Natural, Cinema. I switched from Bright Cinema to Cinema. This helped to improve the black and white levels. I then turned on the Auto Iris for when ever it is in Cinema Mode. I chose high speed versus normal. This auto iris feature adjusts brightness on the fly depending on the brightness level of the scene in what you are watching. I found it to be a good feature for movies. The other setting that I found to help with the weirdness was the Image Enhancement Setting > subsetting Detail Enhancement. Default is at 40 if you turn this down, the picture will look more cinematic. I set mine at 20.The split screen feature allows you to project HDMI 1 on the left and HDMI 2 on the right. This feature works great if you need it. Presentations that take full advantage of this can be very compelling! It is easy to set up from the menu system.The focus and zoom rings are very smooth to operate. They also stay put once dialed in.There are many advanced settings available for the 2040 and I wont go into them in this review, but you can tweak and make changes to everything. You can see the 2040s Owners Manual online at Epsons website. I really recommend that you do prior to purchase as you can learn a lot about a product from its Owners Manual.Some things that I do not like:- The Proprietary Epson Quick Cool Down Technology. If I were a presenter on the road I would use this a lot to be able to pack up and go. However in a Home Theater Environment you aught to be able to turn it off so that the fan will give a good cool down and extend bulb life.- No lens shift. Lens shift adjustment allows you to compensate for projector mounting limitations. If you cannot get the projector exactly in-line with the top edge or bottom edge of your screen you can lens shift vertically to compensate for it. With this projector you have to get the mount just right. The BenQ has it.- The remote is small which is great for presentations, but for home theater I would prefer a backlit with bigger buttons on it. When doing calibrations that really helps. - I am seeing some minor motion artifacts around fast moving objects or people in certain scenes with a contrasting background. It looks like a blurry halo around that object.The Epson 2045 is the same as the 2040 except that it adds a wireless network interface so that you can send images to it thru a wireless network and wireless screen mirroring thru a mobile device.Overall this is a fantastic projector and my new favorite sub $1000 one. Sorry BenQ. It has a fantastic clear and bright image that is sure to make most all home movie goers happy.
