These globe lights remind me like what you would find in a nature themed party or other type of affair. These globe lights are a bit more versatile than your usual string lights.  The cord itself is quite durable and seems like it will last multiple times and the outdoors easily. I personally have put mine in the patio to give it pretty good mood lighting. The light bulbs are not wired in series, so if one bulb fails, the rest of the lights still work. This is not like cheap christmas lights. Even after 5 hours or outdoor use, I was able to touch a bulb and it was only slightly warm. The efficiency of the bulbs are great! The fact that the bulbs are powered by batteries means that placement can be pretty much anywhere and you are not limited by outlets.The included small gift string lights have a very neat design that I think will compliment any festive decoration or christmas tree.  Even my niece loves them and they do not heat up like regular bulbs.Please note that I was provided a review sample.

These globe lights remind me like one of those old fashioned store display or snow globes. These globe lights are a bit more versatile than your usual string lights.  The cord itself is quite durable and seems like it will last multiple times and the outdoors easily. I personally have put mine in the patio to give it pretty good mood lighting. The light bulbs are not wired in series, so if one bulb fails, the rest of the lights still work. This is not like cheap christmas lights. Even after 5 hours or outdoor use, I was able to touch a bulb and it was only slightly warm. The efficiency of the bulbs are great! The fact that the bulbs are powered by batteries means that placement can be pretty much anywhere and you are not limited by outlets. Please note that I was provided a review sample.

The infinity scarf is essentially a scarf that is prelooped for your so that instead of dealing with a long scarf, you just have to slip this over your head and it looks like you wrapped your own scarf. The yarn is stitched together without any loose ends or visible imperfections. The yarn is quite soft against the skin and it really does warm you up and looks fashionable. Please note that I was provided a review sample.

There are many LED flashlights based on the CREE LEDs, but I would have to say that this is one of the better designs. First off, this flashlight is solidly built with machined aluminum which fits together perfectly. The rubber flushing fits nicely and everything is seated properly. The lense in mounted on a slidable focuser. One thing I've noticed with poorer quality flashlights is that the threads do not properly align sometimes cause striping after some use. There is no problem here!The reflector is a solid piece of metal and is a high surface area reflector. Using the focuser, you can go from a wide flood light to a very narrow long distance beam.Usage is very simple. Turn on the flashlight with a strong clicking depression. Change between the modes with a depression without click. The flashlight remembers the last mode it was in when it was turned off. Very useful as not all flashlights have this feature.In terms of light output it has a uniform field at the widest field. This light is EXTREMELY bright (so much so that the max brightness hurts my eyes when using it in such small quarters). The beam can be narrowed and the intensity much higher. I would likely use this for outdoors for the narrow beam. Please note that I tried to white balanced each picture since my phone does not allow me to control the white balance.The first picture is the flood light, the cone is about 60 degrees and the field is very homogenous. The second pic shows a lower intensity while field in case you need to conserve power.  The third picture shows the very narrow beam which is so bright, it actually hurt my eyes to look at it at this close of a range. It is functional for close up work, but if you want a brighter flood, I suggest getting a flashlight with a wider beam. This is definitely built with outdoor and long range in mind.On of hte best thing about htis flashlight is that it does not rely on any special battery.  A regular AA will power this flashlight nicely. Please note that I was provided a review sample.

This router/NAS/charger packs a punch and has a lot of functionality. First let me talk about the design. The router is made mostly of glossy plastic with smooth round edges. There is a USB (for external data source or charging), micro USB (for power), a SD slot, an ethernet port, and a single button. The router can be charged from a AC adapter with a micro USB or from a laptop with the micro USB. Essentially, you can use it anywhere.In terms of usage as a router. Here are the different scenarios for usage:Wifi repeater, convert a wired network into a wireless on, access point for a single MAC address, or sharing data using the USB port (think external drives or thumb drives) or SD card (compatible with iOS/androind/windows)Set up is very easy. Once connected, a captive screen will open or you can open any browser window to open the captive web configuration page (which you can see in my photos). There is a wizard that will help set up your device very quickly (which only needs to be done once). The router supports b/g/n on the 2.4 Ghz spectrum at a max speed of up to 150 mbs (this largely depends on the connecting device of course, mine shows 65 mbs). This isn't extremely fast, but it serves the purpose of streaming music/movies (1080p movies only using 10 mbs max anyways). The data access caps out at 150 mbs among all the devices connected. It is also pretty useful since my laptop only has one USB port to charge this device, it's nice to be able to daisy chain my usb drive, also.Some other benefits of this device are as follows:A) using one device to connect (the RAVPower router), but be able to connect multiple devices buy using it as an access hotspotB) Allow multiple devices to have a library of media or files without having to using up individual device space. I find this VERY useful for road trips and multiple people wanting to watch different things. It's much easier to have a single copy instead of copying over individual files to separate devices.The 3,000 mAh internal battery included allows for use for about 4-5 hours as a router (less if you use the storage) per charge. The device is capable of pass-through charging (aka charge itself and connected devices) and it does not heat up that much. Charging the device only takes about 3.5 hours to get it to max. There is not much heat production when it is charging or discharging, so I know it is pretty efficient. Even with charging itself and charging two tablets, the unit only got slightly warm. This is important since it means efficiency is high and there is not much energy wasted as heat.Idle drain seems to be minimal, but I will have to test it over a longer period of time.The included cable can be used to both charge the router and then flipped to charge your phone or tablet (except for apple products)Overall, a great product which I always bring around with my laptop. Please note that I was provided a review sample.

First off, the camera is an indoor camera which has a few extra features compared to other wireless IP cameras. There is a built in mic and speaker so that you can hear your recordings and also use the camera is video conferencing if needed. It also has motion sensing and can respond appropriately (sending you an email or start recording) or it my activate an external alarm/device (sold separately).Usage is very easy. You can connect to the camera through ethernet using the included Hootoo IP camera software to set up the WIFI connection and change any of the camera settings. Once the wifi connection is set up, you can dis connect the ethernet and place the camera anywhere within range of your router/modem. Please note that this camera uses 802.11b/g which is 2.4 ghz, so be sure to enable your 2.4 ghz band on dual or tri band routers.Connecting to the camera to view the video or control the direction is simple. The QR code on the bottom of the camera contains the UID of the camera so that the camera connection info can be obtained in the intranet or internet. The camera is protected with a username/password so unauthorized access is limited (unless you WANT to stream). There are 3 ways to control the camera, using the PC software, using the free hootoo IP cam (or other various free IP cam apps) on your phone, or using a web interface if you do not have the PC software. Please note that if you want to be able to set up this camera to be accessible through the internet, you will have to properly configure your router (this entails assigning a permanent IP to the camera and enabling port forwarding for the port that you choose for the web interface or video).The video quality is excellent, forgive my video, it does not do the camera justice because of third party encoding problems and bad lighting. The camera has low light LEDS which automatically turn on in the proper setting. There are many uses for this camera, you can stream video of your giant pandas, monitor the weather, use it as a baby monitor, or set it up to catch some ghosts. Please note I was provided a free sample for evaluation.

First off, when I felt this backpack and the material, I could immediately notice the thickness of the cloth and the straps.  Everything about this backpack looks and feels like it was meant to last.  For the main function as a laptop bag, it is able to fit my 15 laptop without problems.  The back is cushioned so you won't feel your laptop smacking your back repeatedly.  The leather straps for the pockets actually use a snap button to close (so you don't actually have to undo the buckle to get into them).  there is ample pocket space to carry a variety of items.  Two nice features I like is the leather bottom which is where I find previous backpacks were lacking as the bottom probably takes the most abuse.  The leather wrap for the carrying handle is also nice since I use that handle quite frequently.Overall, excellent backpack with a nice laptop sleeve. Used it to travel, go to the gym, and work. Great number of deep pockets that feel secure and would satisfy  anyone who likes to organize all their things just so. I got lots of compliments on the backpack! 5 stars

This set comes with two items, so i will try my best to describe them both.First off, the tote bag.  It is hard to tell in the pics, but the tote bag in seriously thick and quite well insulated.  The outside fabric is hardy and the inner aluminum is tough.  the zipper teeth are large and the metal metal handle big enough to easily grasp.  The srap is a thick fabric with a plastic length adjuster.  The attachment points are right over the center of mass, so it makes carrying very easy.  On the bottom edge is a button pocket for the wine tool.The tool is sturdy and is essentially pure steel. Unlike your usual bottle/cork openers that are aluminum or hollow ground, this feels like it is built to LAST. The hinges and springs are all solid metal. Sure it's a little bit hefty, but you can be sure that the durability is almost certain.Functionwise, usage is easy and self explanatory. The curved foil cutter pulls out easily enough and has serrations to cut the bottle foil easily.This type of cork opener relies on lever action. The spiral perpetrator flips out at 90 degrees (there is some hinge that keeps it in place) so that you do not have to find out the hard way that your twisting will be off angle. Once you screw into the cork a certain depth you are ready to use your lever action to pull out the cork. Once unique thing about this cork opener is that it has a two stage counter lever. The way I open my bottles is to screw down until the lip of the glass meets the metal edge of the spring loaded push metal. Once you Iever up the cork from the push metal all the way up, the cork opener lines up perfectly with the second metal piece up to the lip of the bottle.In the end, what this means is that you can quickly screw in the perpetrator and just lift twice in a row without have to screw in the cork opener a second time to find the right level for maximum lever force.Overall, this tool has a very professional look and is VERY solidly built.The complete set would make for an excellent gift or transporting wines to parties/picnics.  Please note that I was provided a review sample.

Great device for the on-the-go traveler. This external charger/battery is solidly built and feels quite rugged. The large capacity allows you to charge your device 4-5 times (about 200% for a tablet or 450% for my iphone 5s). The two different ports allows you to have full speed charging tablets or phones (just make sure you have an appropriate USB charging cable if your device uses more than 1 amps).Unfortunately, like the flash memory market, there are many manufacturers that flat out lie on the rated capacities on their devices. If it's too cheap to be true, then it probably is a counterfeit. That's why it's essential that you buy from a trusted manufacturer. Here is a link detailing some unscrupulous counterfeits. http://www.geek.com/news/buyer-beware-unbranded-battery-packs-may-be-full-of-sand-1544064/Having tested out this product out myself, I'm confident that the capacity is correct as advertised.The device is capable of pass-through charging (aka charge itself and connected devices) and it does not heat up that much. Charging the device only takes about 3.5 hours to get it to max. There is not much heat production when it is charging or discharging, so I know it is pretty efficient.The included cables are standard fare, which is fine. Please note you will need your own AC adapter (or you can use your computer to charge).The flashlight is quite bright, on par to a 300-400 lumen LED torch.  The huge battery also allows you to power the flashlight for a long time, too!  There are two mode, solid light and flash depending on what you need.Finally, the solar power function. Many people complain that it is a gimmick and that in real use, it is not useful at all. The way I see it is that if you use this device everyday or every other day, this will function exactly like an external battery (aka the solar function is not a negative, nor does it significantly increase the price). The solar function is actually VERY useful if you camp out for extended periods of time. Or if you are like me, I use this maybe once a week or every other week and I just place this on my window sill and just charge it right before I travel. That way when I don't use it frequently, I can pretty much charge it for free.Also, on a camping trip, this could charge itself during the day and be ready for use as a light at night.  Very convenient!Please note that I was provided a reviews sample.

These headphones are perfect for those late night marathons or gaming sessions when you don't want to bother the rest of the family/roomates!First of all, set up is super easy.  You connect the transmitter dongle to the RCA or 3.5mm stereo output on the TV or receiver and then set the audio output to that port.  The dongle automatically pairs with the headset immediately.  The volume controls are on the headset itself, so you don't have to fumble with remote to change the volume.In terms of comfort, the headphones are extremely light.  The tension between the headphones is not that strong either.  This makes it more comfortable, but less secure, so I don't recommend trying to work out with these on.  The range is easily 25 feet even through a wall or two.  I use rechargeable batteries for my set.  They last about 16 hours in the headset and well over 40-50 hours in the transmitter.  This likely depends on the volume level you like of course.Now finally for the sound quality.  This is quite good as long as you don't have a lot of interference at the 2.4 Ghz.  I've tried this at home where there is no interference and everything was crystal clear.  However, at my friend's apart where there are like 10 different wi-fi networks and any number of bluetooth devices, I noticed that there was a lot of background noises.  I know its interference because the same settings at home had no background noises.Overall, if you don't have much congestion in your area, I would highly recommend this!  Please note that I was provided a review sample.

The first thing I noticed when I pulled this out of the box was how solid it felt and the weight of it.  This stopper is almost pure metal!  This speaks clearly for the durability of the stopper and I have no doubts that it will last years of abuse and drops.  It has a nice circular brushed metal appearance.  Usage is extremely easy.  Once you slide this onto your bottle, one or two pumps (depending on how much wine is left in the bottle) and the airtight seal is in place.  Wines which I would have normally tossed out after a few days now keep for weeks with no perceptible change in taste.  This really saves on money for when I host parties and gatherings.  Removal of the stopper is just as easy as putting it in.  With a little twisting and wiggling, it is off in a few seconds.One of the things I worried about would be if the silicone/rubber would stain or impart a flavor into the wine as I don't have much space to store my wine upright.  I'm glad to find out that neither was an issue and that even on the side, the stopper does not leak.Overall, a simple device to prolong the life of your wines!  Please note that I was provided a review sample.

This compact LED lamp is a great desktop lamp but functions as so much more! First off, the lamp is a sleek and smooth design comprised of glossy plastic. The lighting element can flip in/out 180 degrees and rotate 180 degrees. The base of the lamp can either fold out to be a base or fold back in to align with the stemThe touch sensitive power button cycles between 3 brightness modes and is very responsive. I like the fact that the power button is dimly lit so that you can see it at night or when there is a sudden black out.  The fact that this lamp is battery powered and has a 180 degree neck allows it to function much more than a desk lamp. It also can be used as a flashlight when you need a portable light or during black outs.  By folding the base back into the stem, you can hold this like a light wand or place on the floor/counter and direct the light to where you need it.On the lowest brightness setting, I was able to get a good seven hours on battery power. This works really well if you need a temporary light which isas I just plug it back in after use and use it as a regular desk lamp.  The light temperature is a slightly warmish color which is good at reducing eye strain especially during reading.Please note that I was provided a review sample.

Wow, the first thing I noticed when I pulled this out of the box was how solidly it was made.  The whole device is pure metal which speaks loudly for its durability.  I have no doubt that this will withstand the abuse of multiple drops of crushes.  Usage is very easy, once it is charged, you can turn it on and flip the right side switch to either playback or record.  Once you record something, it can be played back on the built in speaker or using a headphone set.  Plugging the recorder into a computer mounts the recorder as a flashdrive and you can then copy over your recordings or even place music on the recorder.  With music on it, it functions exactly like a regular mp3 player, with a less user friendly experience though.The LCD on the front is easy to read and is backlit, so even during dark lectures, you should be able to see the settings.Now for the most important thing, sound quality.  This recorder has 3 different microphones on the top edge which is very useful if you aim it directly to the sound source.  You can also hold it straight up if you want to capture the surroundings, too.  At the highest quality, everything sounds crystal clear, some some background sounds becoming apparent.  This is not an issue with post processing.  I would prefer to capture everything the first time and edit stuff out than to miss something.The 8GB storage space is quite generous and is more than enough especially if you have a computer handy to transfer and organize recordings as needed.The recorder comes with some accessories.  It has a landline adapter to record landline calls (which I'm sorry I could not test), a 3.5mm to 3.5mm cable to record from other devices, and earbuds.  The earbuds are decent quality, so if you want to really appreciate the high quality settings, use a headphone set.Overall, very durable device with a lot of uses.  I personally use mine to record lectures and play them back while I am studying.  I can see this easily be used for nature watching, interviews, or even movie production with the right microphone.  Please note that I was provided a review sample.

Don't let the word mini fool you!  This is pretty much close to a full size humidifier that can regulate an entire room or a small apartment!This humidifier sure is nice to look at. It has a sleek modern look that will accentuate any desktop.First off, the whole device is pretty sturdy, only being comprised of two pieces. I like simplicity as it greatly reduces a part failure. The plastic is sturdy enough that I do not fear it will break even from a reasonable fall.The top pops off to reveal the humidifying mechanism. The top portion has a cap that you can remove to fill it with water.  There is a push valve and allows water to slowly drain into the humidifying heater. Anyways, function wise, it is a decent size so it does not take a while to get the humidity up of a room. There is no fear of overheating as the device will shut off if it does not detect any water.  The rate of humidification can be controlled with a twist control.  I like how the output spout can be directed which if you place this close to a wall or on your desk, you can direction where the main stream of mist goes.I found the benefits of humidifiers below:1) Being in the inland areas of California, it is actually closer to desert like conditions rather than sunny beach that everyone pictures. So increasing the humidity has really moistened my nasal passage A LOT. This is especially true at night or the morning when I wake up, I notice my sinuses and oral airways are dry to the point where it is uncomfortable for the first half hour I wake up. Having this humidifier run during the night has eliminated this problem all together.2) My sense of smell is FAR better now that humidity is up. I can really smell my dinner cooking and scents from candles far better when there is more humidity. Most people don't realize that your sense of smell is highly dependent on the ambient humidity. One of the reason why you can smell your shampoo and body wash so well while in the shower.3) My rates of epistaxis (bleeding from the nose) has drastically decreased. This may be a key point that some people will want to buy a humidifier. Dry nasal passages are easily irritated and damaged compared to moistened airways.4) Drastic reduction in dust motes (aka those floaty things you see in bright sun beams). Humidity increases the weight of floating dust which then falls to the ground where you can vacuum them up. This is a great way to clean up the air. As a side effect, allergies are also lest severe since the air is much cleaner.Overall, a very good electronic humidifier. A great side affect of increased humidity is that it removes scent particles in the air and also reduces smells.Please note that I was provided a review sample

These sporty wireless headphones are great because they are lightweight, have less length of wires to tangle, and have excellent quality.I love the rubber inserts that shape the wire to go over your ear. This allows the headphones to someone hug your ear for a more secure fit. Also the thick wires and reinforced connections is great as this has been the bane of my earbuds as twists would build up and the earbuds would break at the weak spot between the wire and earbud. The curve is changeable so it can be molded to fit your ear shape. I was able to run vigorously without the device slipping or falling out. I can probably do cartwheels without the device falling out (that is if I could do a cartwheel...)Set up is quite easy. The headphones are charged through a small microusb slot on the wire dongle. Once charged, I was easily about to pair it to my iPhone 5 . The device in minimal, so there a few buttons to control the function of the device to turn on and activate the pairing mode and volume controls for easy adjusting. The device is minimalistic and is barely noticeable during use.The microphone quality is decent with only a little bit increased background noise compared to using my phone.Sound quality is good as there is no bias to any frequency. I prefer a neutral sound so that I can change it using the equalizer in my player rather than to deal with biases.There are multiple ear cushions for whatever shape your ear canals. Also a double flange cushion is included for longer canals. A small microUSB cable is included for charging. Please note I was provided a review sample.

This is a great little travel pouch which has a lot of neat features.First off, the build of the pouch is great with no loose seams or strings.  The stitching is regular and complete.  The zippers have a small pocket which they tuck into so that they don't snag on anything.The majority of the pouch is made with a soft fabric.  The strap is a very soft elastic band which does not chaff your skin even after a lot of use.  The plastic clasp locks and unlocks quickly and easily.  The portion of the pouch adjacent to the skin is a soft mesh material which not only wicks sweat, but also allows the skin to breath.I've tested the RFID block capabilities by seeing if my cellphone NFC (a subset of RFID) works through the pouch and it was blocked.Also included is a very compact lock with a very sturdy locking mechanism!Don't let the size fool you, this is one tough lock. It is almost completely comprised of metal. The rotating code selector is easy enough to spin around, but has a nice click to each number. Setting/changing your code is very easy with the instructions labeled on the back. The bar is small enough to fit through he holes of pretty much any zipper, so you can probably use this with any luggage piece.  TSA compliance is important since they are known to cut through your locks to check your luggage if it is not TSA key compatible.Please note that I was provided a review sample.

4:47 MinsThis Btrek H10 headphones are sleek and absolutely worth the money! First off, this is a supra aural head phones (aka, this sit on your ear rather than larger over the ear heaphones which sit around your ear). Obviously, this means, don't wear earrings while using this. If you are the type that gets ear pain from using these types of headphones, I suggest either using ear phones or over the ear headphones. If you have small ears, these might work as over the ear headphones for you.  With that out of the way, for people who don't mine supra aural heaphones, this is tough to beat.The build quality is fantastic. The ear cushions are very soft and covered with pleather which is great for long sessions as the sweat/oil is not bothersome. The head band also has a nice cushion for the top of your head although I did not find that too important as this device is VERY light. Comfort wise, I've use this in long gaming sessions (3-4 hours) with no discomfort afterwards. Again, this is widely variable how sensitive and the shape of your ears.1) Usage is extremely easy. There is a 3.5 mm stereo in for direct connection (and a provided cable which is a nice touch). Set up requires pressing and holding the powerbutton for 6 seconds (2 just to turn on). The external light flashes red/blue when in pairing mode. The device shows up and pairing is easy (I've done it with my iphone/win 8.1 tablet, and android tablet). Once paired, the process does not need to be repeated and pairing is almost instant once you turn on the headphones. The neat effect is that the heaphones has a built in voice notification when they are turned on/off and paired.All the buttons work as expected in iOS/win 8.1/android and again, this depends in the app you use have the proper functions. I was able to pause/play, skip and back up songs and adjust volume with a click of a button. No set up other than pairing the device was required.A neat feature is that there are voice prompts telling you the status of the headphones such as the volume and when it is paired/attempting to pair.2) Power usage is great. I'm able to charge the headphones using the included micro USB cable in about 3 hours for more than 16 hours of usage (again this depends on your volume of course).3) Range is about 30 feet and can go through walls easily.4) Now the most important aspect, sound quality. First, one of the signs of a cheap bluetooth audio device is the amount of background static. I test this by pairing devices and then MAXING out the volume on the host device and the audio device. If there is any perceptable static, you know you have a poorly made device. I can confidently say there is absolutely no static with these headphones, even when I was pushing the range limit and trying my best to increase background interference (using 2.4 Ghz wifi, mice, etc). In gaming, the audio plays true without any delay. This is a problem on some lower end devices.The spectral range on these headphones is great. I can hear highs/lows on all my music similar to my logitech G930 (which only advantage is that it is 7.1). The bass is good, but I tend not to have very bassy music.  I would say it is more neutral than anything without any bias or muddling of any particular frequency.5) Microphone: this may be the only thing that is not as great as my logitech g930. The microphone is built into the side of the headphone which means there is a further distance from your mouth for it to pic up audio. I would not count this as a negative though as it was clearly a design choice to have these headphones more compact that your usual fold out microphone. What this means in practical use is that the microphone tends to pick up more background noise than your usual stick phone. This is not a huge deal unless you like to type and use the microphone at the same time. People can still hear your clearly, but the typing is noticeable. Again, I think it's a tradeoff for more compactness. If you don't anticipate a lot of microphone using while typing, it will not be a problem for you.Overall, these headphones are top quality, something I would expect from a premium brand. In fact, i would consider on par in terms of quality compared to my Logitech G930 (which is over twice as expensive) minus the surround sound functionality. Please note that I was provided a review sample.

5:37 MinsFirst off, if you are an avid music listener, you will be using your headphones for long periods of time. So the first thing you need to think about is ergonomics and comfort. Do NOT be fooled, there are no supra aural (or on-ear) headphones that should be realistically considered for extended use due to the fact that on-ear headphones compress and restrict blood flow to your ears and over the long term will inevitably cause ear pain. You MUST have a set that is circumaural (over-the-ear) if you even want to think about using something for more than 2 hours at a time. This Thor-X headphones are over the ear and apply gentle pressure over the skull in a wide diffuse area. Far more comfortable than your typical headphones. The cushions are very soft and gentle (and there are even replacements included as the cushions are usually what takes the brunt of everyday use). The next thing is weight. You can't have a lot of needless metal or electronics in the headset because weight over time means discomfort. This set has metal where it matters the most (the joints/extension) and the outer cups (where the headphones are likely to impact). No more and no less, adequate for what you need without being excessive. Finally, the cushioned headband is soft and gentle to your dome.Sound quality is the next most important factor (first for many of course). You need something that will accurately recreate your audio WITHOUT any frequency bias or muddling of frequencies. You DO NOT want something with "deep bass" or something silly like that because you want to hear the true and neutral tone so that you can accurate gauge the equalization and corrections needed to adjust said quality. If you have a faulty measuring device (in the case your headphones and ears), then your product is going to come out faulty and biased. I don't care if you love the bass! You can love the bass in your playback speakers, equalizers, devices or whatever, but if you are going to work with something, you have to work with the original sound first before you start mucking around. These headphones have a very neutral tone with NO frequency bias. I also did not hear rattling in lower frequencies unlike other cheaper headphones.Those are the two most important aspects of studio headphones. Everything else I talk about are my own personal preference and may differ from person to person.--Closed back, I prefer to not be an annoyance to anyone around me, it is also far easier to isolate noises with a closed back of course. Drawback is that if you are hot, you will sweat...--No in set amp. Given the large size of the drivers, impedance is high. Some headphones have built in amps to beef up the current to drive large drivers, but in the end that means more weight and more discomfort. If you are serious about your craft, you will have an external amp and I would prefer the extra amp weight to be on your table rather than on your head. They also have a nice benefit of not being so high in impedance that you can't actually use this in consumer devices though like other studio quality headphones.--Price. This is actually considered cheap for studio quality headphones (especially considering the competition). This is a low-end price for a surprisingly well preforming and comfortable mid-end headphones. In the end, you are getting much value for your buck here.--Extras: on wire-mic with controls.  Not necessary for studio work, but useful when you want to use the same head phones for travel.  The controls allow you to control your device and you are also able to make calls as needed.  Collapsible!  Very important for travel!  Also a carrying case to keep everything safe.Overall, I would say a very good value studio headphones which has comfort and true sound quality as top priorities. Please note that I was provided a review sample.

0:11 Mins This humidifier/diffuser sure is nice to look at. It has a sleek looking minimalist look.  The lighting is great and is perfect for mood lighting and with the correct scent and really change up the look/feel of your home.  Check out the video to see how quickly it diffuses the mist/scents!First off, the whole device is pretty sturdy, only being comprised of two pieces. I like simplicity as it greatly reduces a part failure. The plastic is sturdy enough that I do not fear it will break even from a reasonable fall.The top pops off to reveal the inner bowl and diffuser mechanism. This allows you to easily fill the humidifier. In fact, this has the simplest fill instructions ever. No need to avoid "that hole/opening" or to measure out a specific amount of water. Anyways, function wise, it is small so it takes a while to get the humidity up of a room, but it will over time. It is much more able to increase the local immediate humidity level rather than homes/rooms. There is no fear of overheating as the device will shut off if it does not detect any water or after 12 hours.I found the benefits of humidifiers below:1) Being in the inland areas of California, it is actually closer to desert like conditions rather than sunny beach that everyone pictures. So increasing the humidity has really moistened my nasal passage A LOT. This is especially true at night or the morning when I wake up, I notice my sinuses and oral airways are dry to the point where it is uncomfortable for the first half hour I wake up. Having this humidifier run during the night has eliminated this problem all together.2) My sense of smell is FAR better now that humidity is up. I can really smell my dinner cooking and scents from candles far better when there is more humidity. Most people don't realize that your sense of smell is highly dependent on the ambient humidity. One of the reason why you can smell your shampoo and body wash so well while in the shower.3) My rates of epistaxis (bleeding from the nose) has drastically decreased. This may be a key point that some people will want to buy a humidifier. Dry nasal passages are easily irritated and damaged compared to moistened airways.4) Drastic reduction in dust motes (aka those floaty things you see in bright sun beams). Humidity increases the weight of floating dust which then falls to the ground where you can vacuum them up. This is a great way to clean up the air. As a side effect, allergies are also lest severe since the air is much cleaner.Overall, a very good electronic humidifier. A great side affect of increased humidity is that it removes scent particles in the air and also reduces smells.Please note that I was provided a review sample

This LED desklamp provides ample lighting while being much more efficient than your typical desklamp.First off, I don't think I can ever return to using fluorescent or incandescent lighting again. Incandescent lights are inefficient. Fluorescent lights are efficient, but have a very cold feeling and limited light spectrum.LED lights are both efficient and have a wide variety of color temperatures which more closely resembles incandescent lights or nature sunlight. I find that the warmish light from this lamp has far less eye strain that fluorescent lights.The base is a matte plastic with touch control.  There is a single button, with no frills.  I prefer it to be simple myself.The range of three brightness is very good and this single lamp can be used for both mood lighting or actual desk work. The stem is very flexible and you can aim the light in any direction. Again, this can be use to light up artwork or be used as a work flood light if needed.The lighting elements are covered with an opaque light diffuser which gives the light a nice smooth flood. You won't see multiple shadows from the multiple LEDs of this lamp.One extra effect of LEDs is that they are instant on so there is no annoying flickering on like fluorescent lights either.The base of the desk lamp has a USB output which is useful for charging your phone or powering another USB device (think desktop humidifier/diffuser).Please note that I was provided a review sample.

This URpower oil diffuser sure is nice to look at. I can lose myself hours at a time just looking at the colors cycle while the scents of my oils waft in the air.First off, the whole device is pretty sturdy, only being comprised of two pieces. I like simplicity as it greatly reduces a part failure. The plastic is sturdy enough that I do not fear it will break even from a reasonable fall.The buttons at the base are prominent and easily pressable with a mechanical click. The power input is smartly located at the bottom (so that spilling water can't get into it). The base even has a small cutout for the power wire to run through. It's these little design features that makes you feel that everything was though through before releasing a product.Filling the diffuser is very easy. You just pop open the device with a twist and fill up close to the top and drop in a few drops of your oils. In fact, this has the simplest fill instructions ever. No need to avoid "that hole/opening" or to measure out a specific amount of water. Anyways, function wise, the light cycles smoothly through multiple colors. The diffusing is very good. I especially like the fact that multiple diffusing time are available. This is VERY useful as you can change how much scent you want using the strength and time. I tend to use a stronger concentration of oils and a short diffuser time setting as I would have to refill the diffuser less frequently. It also helps with humidity control if you are concerned about that.Overall, a very good electronic diffuser. I've used my oils with many different modes of diffusing and in the end, I think an electronic diffuser is the most convenient and the best scent dispersal method. Potpurri is nice, but has a VERY limited range unless you are willing to use a lot of oils and risk have too strong of a scent. Reed sticks rot over time and if you don't make the right strength oil concentration can be hit or miss. Candles with oils always have soot build up (and the risk of fire). In the end, I feel that if you are a fan of great home scents, it behooves you to get an electronic diffuser and your own oils. It also gives you the ability to mix up your own scent concoctions.  Please note that I was provided a review sample.

I've had the chance to try out many earphones, headsets, and speakers which are wired or wireless. These wireless earphones have a unique design which makes it perfect for high intensity activities.First off, the design. The earphones have an over the ear design with an adjustable earphone position and angling. I prefer the over-the-ear design as it offsets the weight of the earphones onto your earlobes instead of your ear canal. This means more comfort over the long term. It is also far more secure that just earbuds or inner lobe supports if you are involved in some heavy intensity work outs. The wire is generous in length, but has a cinch so that you can close down on extra wire length if you want to prevent the wires from getting in the way of your workout.  The ear buds are pure metal which speaks volume about the durability.  The wire has a clip so that you can secure any excess wire to your shirt.The quality: I've yet to destroy my hearing from listening to loud concerts, so I'm still able to appreciate a broad frequency range. These earphones do not have a specific frequency bias and would be described more as a neutral tone. I prefer this as you can use an equalizer to achieve the sound you want without having to have different presets that depend on which listening device you use. Some people do prefer a low frequency bassy bias, but I prefer to have my electronics handle that if possible. The earphones can put out a lot of bass if needed when I use my deep bass presets.Pairing is very easy and I was able to pair it with both my iphone and moto X. The call button is simple to use and functions easily on both phones. The function buttons work on all of my devices (win 8.1, iphone, and android). The buttons have been consolidated to minimize the profile of the control hub. A single press changes track and a long press changes audioCalls are on par with the speaker on my iphone 5. Because of the build of the microphone, background noises are more obvious, but people I've talked to say that my voice is clearly audible.A micro USB cable for charging is included. The battery on this device easily lasts 6-7 hours of normal music (~40 percent volume) with occasional bluetooth audio calls. Charging is extremely fast, taking only about 1.5 hours. Please note that i was provided a review sample.

Well, I wear a size 10.5 and these socks fit my feet perfectly. The heel patch actually lines up with my heel unlike the typical medium socks I would get at the department stores.I noticed that some socks are far thicker than other and it is actually recommended to wear shoes a half size larger than usual if you wear thicker socks. These socks are thinner than most and as such you can wear your typical shoes. The stitching is precise and regular and I did not notice any loose seams. There were no extra strings that were loose either. The spandex material makes the socks very flexible and form fitting which is great for active people as I found that pure cotton socks tended to bunch up in my arch over time.The rear edge has extra cushioning so the edge of your shoe does not rough up the back of your foot.One other benefit of the stretchy material is that there was pretty much no shrinking after washing, unlike pure cotton socks. i also prefer socks without conspicuous branding or logos as it seems silly that you want people looking at your socks, but that is just me. The low cut style avoids having the dreaded farmer's tan or how I like to call it white foot disease.The copper really works well as a deodorizer as I tested this after 3-4 hours of hiking and I noticed it is not as stanky as my usual cotton socks.Please note that I was provided a review sample.

I have pretty dry hair which sometimes feels stiff and easily get broken ends. I tried this hair oil and saw and felt results after a single use!First off, I use this after shampooing and massage a dime size amount into my hair/scalp and let it sit while I wash the rest of my body. By the time I rinse it off, it's been sitting in my hair for 5 minutes. There is no need for conditioner if you use this as it functions very well to give your hair body and moisture.The oil is pretty thick which makes it easy to work with to massage and get all of your hair. The scent is a fresh clean smell, but nothing that is too strong.After a single use, I was already feeling much smoother, slicker, and full hair. One of the things i was worried about was if there was going to be any residue from the oil, but this turned out not to be an issue. The effects even last through a couple of days of regular showering. I would say the optimal application schedule would be 5-7 days depending on how much your hair gets wet during the week.Please note that I was provided a review sample.

This alarm is very lightweight and easy to install.  There are included drywall adapters and metal screws for attachment. 0:16 Mins I think this headlight stands out over the other options because of the zooming functions and the included accessories.First off, the lighting element is deceptively small, but very powerful. The LED is comparable to the ones in my light torches. The housing is rugged rubber with some ridges for easy gripping/turning.When I'm hiking or camping in low light conditions, this is very useful! The headband is an elastic cloth which is easily adjustable and is comfortable. The weight of the light and batteries are not too burdensome that sometimes I forget that I'm even wearing it.As for actual usage. The light has multiple brightness levels which can be toggled. There is also an emergency strobe function for SOS situations. Batteries can be swapped out of the rear compartment quickly if needed. Battery life is very good as LED lights are efficient. I can get about 4-5 hours in a single battery set at max brightness.The biggest thing about this headlamp is the zooming function. If you want a very wide flood for close quarters like working in the basement or under a car, you can have that. If you want to light up a hiking trail, you can narrow the beam and see quite far. It eliminates the need of having to have two separate flashlights!Overall, very bright light. The fact that it uses typical consumer AAA batteries makes replacing and having back up batteries very easy!  Please note that I was provided a review sample.

This rugged bluetooth speaker from Kedsum is a sleek and rugged speaker with great audio output.The device is solidly built with a textured rubber housing and rounded edges. The buttons are a part of the housing which contributes to the waterproofing.Functionwise, this speaker has simple controls with an on/off switch and multifunctioning. There is no need to manually set it to pair as it is automatically started in this mode. Adding the speaker to your device is very easy (just check bluetooth devices and add it). Once paired, the pairing is automatic subsequently whenever you turn on the speaker. Switching paired devices is easy, you just have to turn off bluetooth or unpair from your device and the speaker will return to pairing mode. The buttons are minimalistic, but have full functionality to change the volume or pause your music. You can also use the connected device to adjust controls of course. Range is easily 30 feet, even with a wall in the way. The voice notifications for pairing and when paired are useful to quickly identify what mode it is in.Battery life is very good. I was able to get 8 hours at about 40% volume. I imagine it would be lower if you were outdoors at higher volumes of course. Charging it back up to full power only takes 3.5 hours (it comes with a micro-USB cable). The port for microUSB charging and 3.5 mm stereo is covered with a rubber piece for waterproofing. This speaker can easily resist splashes, but I would avoid submerging the speaker.Now the most important aspect, audio quality. The driver is about 1 inch in size. This is on par with your typical computer speakers. It is very comparable to a mid range computer speakers. Volume can go up very high. Again, you will not need it that high unless you are using this at an outdoor patio party though.Finally, one thing I always check on my bluetooth enabled devices is background noise when no audio is being sent. Cheap and poor quality speakers tend to have a baseline hissing or white noise. This speaker does now have that issue even at 100% volume. Also, a word of caution if you use this to pair to win 8.1. Windows will show two audio devices when you connect this. DO NOT use the one labeled hands-free. It causes windows to send out a very compressed audio signal and you'll get horrible quality.Please note that I was provided a review sample for an honest and unbiased review.

These gloves are perfect for those cold days when you need to use your phone but don't want to expose your hands!  First off, the stitching and fabric of the gloves is great. This caffeine free tea blend is perfect for a late evening drink to subdue that late night hunger without keeping you awake for hours! This means there is not that much difference in over steeping or using too hot water.Please note that I was provided a review sample.

Well, I'm not expert at jewelry, but you would have had to tell me it is cubic zircunium for me to know it's not a diamond. I have an older civic 1999 which is definitely not the leading edge of technology at this point. I did replace the radio with a sound system that supports auxiliary input. Anyways, this device is a bluetooth receiver which allows you to play audio/music from your mobile device without having to purchase an expensive bluetooth enabled stereo system. Installation is VERY easy, there is a small base with adhesive that you may attach to any location in your car that will then hold the receiver through magnetic attraction. Once the device is plugged in and the receiver stuck onto the dash (or any other suitable spot using the magnetic base), your phone/device will pair up to it immediately once it has been added.This is a very convenient device as multiple people, or even your passenger can use this device as needed and have both devices paired.The controls are intuitive and the button is large and easy to press. The rotating knob makes adjustments very easy as you do not have to fumble for buttons to control your device. The actual receiver is quite small and inconspicuous.The audio quality is great (which of course depend on your sound system), but I perceive the same quality as before when I plugged my phone directly into the auxiliary port. the included car port charger has a second USB in case you would like to charge your phone also which is another convenience. The carport charger has three USB ports, too! Please note that I was provided a review sample.

This is a very nice and solid ring for men!  The outer edge has a circumfrencial carbon fiber look while the inside edge and surface have a smooth rose gold. There is no seam felt between the carbon fiber and rose gold junctionPlease note that I was provided a review sample.

This is a very nice and solid ring for men!  The outer edge has a circumfrencial brushed metal look while the inside edge has a smooth rose gold.  There is a tungsten carbide etching on the inside of the ring.  The etching is smooth so that there is no scratching against your finger.  I could not see any imperfections in the metal of this ring.  I have to say that it has a very nice weight to it!Please note that I was provided a review sample.

These sporty wireless headphones are great because they are lightweight, have less length of wires to tangle, and have excellent quality. Set up is quite easy. The headphones are charged through a small microusb slot. Once charged (which is quick), I was easily about to pair it to my iPhone 5. The device in minimal, and the buttons are located on a small dongle which is better than controls on the actual earphones as it actually is annoying having to try and press the buttons on the earphones. The device is minimalistic and is barely noticeable during use.  The buttons for volume/track change worked on both operating systems, too. The earphones also come with a rubber insert that helps keep the earphones in your ear lobes. I was able to run vigorously without the device slipping or falling out. I can probably do cartwheels without the device falling out (that is if I could do a cartwheel...)The flat cables are nice as it helps you identify twists quickly.  Unnoticed twists is usually what breaks my earbuds and the flat cables help prevent this.The audio quality is quite good. There was no bias for any frequencies and I did not feel that there was any specific frequencies that felt muddled. Volume range was good and these can even be used for airplane rides.What sets this apart from many similar devices is the aptX support. So I have an HDTV and a receiver (that doesn't support bluetooth) and every once in a while, I will want to game late into the night, but not wake anyone up. As many people have known or have found out. Bluetooth has been decent for voice calls, but for music and gaming, it is actually pretty bad. Music is compressed over bluetooth and prior bluetooth conventions prioritized compression over quality, so music was downgraded. aptX fixes that. However, aptX unfortunately requires more computational power and a side effect of that was that there was a noticable delay of the video an audio syncing. Not too big of a problem for music, but a huge issue for gaming and movies. aptX low latency fixes that. This is the latest in bluetooth audio technology and if you have an audio device that support aptX, do not do yourself a disservice and forgo a transmitter that supports it.The microphone quality is decent with only a little bit increased background noise compared to using my phone.Multiple silicone buds are included to fit you canals.Please note I was provided a review sample.

This mFi cable from Yellowknife is much more sturdier than your typical wire!First off, the functionality of this wire mirrors the authentic iPhone apple lightning cable (at a fraction of the cost, mind you). Charging, detection, and data transfer are at the same speed for my iPhone 6.What sets this cable apart is the build quality. This cable is mean to LAST. The cable housing is far more tougher and a bit stiffer than the authentic wire. The cable ends are built with a lightweight aluminum that feels like it can be kicked around or scratched without breaking. The wire itself is a thick braided cloth which gives it a lot of strength and resistance to twisting (which is what usually breaks wires in the first place).Anyways, some people will not like the stiffness and thickness of the wire. I actually preferred it because I needed a wire which will run along the floor and likely be stepped on or rolled over with chairs. This wire is probably the sturdiest wire for lightning I've ever seen!Please note that I was provided a sample for review.

These colorful magnetic pieces are incredibly fun for my nephew!  Each piece has magnets at the edges which allows them to easily snap together at 90 or 180 degrees with other pieces so you can start building structures immediately!  The magnetic strength is strong enough so tha tyou can build big structures, but not so strong that it is difficult to break them apart from each other.The magnets are small, but they are secured in the plastic so they are not choking hazards.  My nephew loves to make crazy ramps with them to play with his car toys on them!Please note that I was provided a review sample.

My husband and I have both enjoyed previous installments of this series but unfortunately both of us tried reading this one and both of us found it a tedious read. It's the kind of book where it feels like it's nothing but talking and then changing the setting and more talking.That's not to say it's bad but I made the choice to DNF review it rather than keep trying to force ,yield to get into it. I gave it almost 200 pages before I just couldn't keep going. Maybe I'll pick it up on audio and try it again eventually.

Even though I consider Rachel Vincent to be one of my auto-buy authors it's been quite a while since I read one of her books. I hadn't even read the blurb when I picked this up to read and it was really, really enjoyable. It took a little while to hit its stride, the first section was pretty slow, but once it gets going it's a hard book to put down. While I saw one of the big secrets coming from a mile away, I don't think readers who don't read a lot of urban fantasy are likely to find it as glaringly obvious.There's a maturity to Vincent's writing in Menagerie that makes it almost good enough to lure lit readers into the genre fiction shelves. What wound up keeping me from being able to rate it with five stars was the really open ending. Some readers love them, even I do most of the time, but this story felt like it had just started. Definitely still worth reading, I just felt like this was a book intended to be a series that was given a non-ending-ending in case it didn't sell well.If you're in the mood for a dark urban fantasy featuring cryptids that's reminiscent of the Rachel Morgan series in many ways I think you'll really enjoy it. I much recommend it!

I work from home and spend at least 8 hours a day in a chair in front of the computer. Which can lead to one very stiff and sore situation with my back, the lower part especially. I wasn't sure I liked the idea of a memory foam seat cushion but I couldn't not try it when I saw the layout. Tailbone support is a big deal and after a few days of use I think that's what I get most from it.Unlike most memory foam products this is impressively cool. I don't get the sweaty backside I assumed was going to be an issue. I also very much find the size agreeable, it should work well with most office chairs. The only caveat for me is that the spandex type material is easily snagged. If you're in a home office, as I am, and have cats expect it to have a shorter life span. My cat has already put two snags in it.Overall, my experience in just one week has been less lower back discomfort, better awareness of my posture, and a general decision to keep using it since it doesn't make me sweaty.

As much as I had high hopes for this laptop as a great tool for my job it just doesn't have the space I need. I love the flipping aspect of it and overall I think it would be a good choice for those looking for more of a social media experience. For those of us who need to store a lot of files it might not be up to snuff. I found it great for video streaming and it's a perfect weight for long term portability.I would recommend this for high school and college students who want a nice laptop for school work and staying connected to family and friends.

When I bought my home 6+ years ago I quickly realized that the kitchen light had an odd bulb that wasn't going to be easy to replace locally but fortunately it lasted until it randomly just stopped working on night. Rather than drag myself all over town or spend an afternoon calling all the local places that might have had it I figured I'd just queue up with Amazon since I already had something else to order. I was pleased to find the right bulb at what I consider to be a reasonable price considering the last one had made it for at least the 6 years I've been using it.It's easy to install and the only thing I don't like so far is that it is a warmer, yellower light than the previous one. Not a deal breaker, I just wasn't expecting the change from a whiter light considering I ordered the same bulb that was previously in the fixture. Chances are I'll wind up preferring it in the long run. I can't say anything in regards to the bulb's life yet, as I've only had it a few days, but I'll update the review when I feel like it's had significant time to note it.

I'm really happy with this! I've got an iPad mini and I've had trouble with the cord from time to time so I wanted something much sturdier and this is definitely it. I'd like a longer version of it but overall it's top notch. I would recommend it to my fellow Apple product users, especially those who travel and find their cords getting damaged.Notes: I received a complimentary product in exchange for this honest review.

While I am loving this desk in general thanks to its layout, I have to admit that I think it has several flaws that are worth noting. First of all, this was a really heavy delivery, my UPS carrier was lucky my spouse was home. Keep that in mind when ordering. Secondly, it's cheap particle board and everything in the package will be covered in fine sawdust. Expect cracks and chips. The major crack in mine wound up hidden once it was put together but I worry the structural integrity of the desk is less due to it.It was generally easy to put together. I'm not very good with tool and putting items together but I did fine and it only took me twice as long as was suggested. The only trouble I had was with the drawer parts not working well. I wound up forced to use a drill to get it together.The usb station is a nice addition but this really isn't built for a tower cpu so there's no way to plug it in without purchasing a longer cord. I also have found the shelf clips remarkably flimsy and I'd recommend replacing them if you want anything heavy like books on your shelves. I was also very disappointed to find that the back side is all unfinished making it necessary to have it against a wall or get clever with paint.Overall, I wouldn't recommend it at the retail price. I don't feel that the quality makes it worth what is being paid. If you can catch a sale and keep in mind the issues I've pointed out, it does have a great layout and overall features. In that way it's made me quite happy.

With the holidays coming I've been trying to find a great gift for a couple that the hubs and I are friends with. As it happens we are all MTG players and GoT fans so I was hoping having the opp to review this would help me decide if I wanted to purchase this for them. The gameplay seems to be in the same realm as MTG but I love that this game doesn't become a money pit in the same manner. The cards are gorgeous, making this lovely from the collector side. All in all, I like it a lot and I think it's exactly the thing I was looking to purchase for my friends.

While pregnant 6+ years ago I sustained a neck injury in a car accident. During the treatment I received for my injury my amazing chiropractor would end our sessions with 10 minutes of TENS treatment. It takes some getting used to but I was amazed at how much it eased the discomfort I was experiencing.I occasionally still experience soft tissue discomfort, in particular in the neck and shoulder where I was hurt so I'd been in the market for an affordable TENS unit for occasional use at home. This one from Santamedical fits the bill very well. It's effective, very easy to use, and I was pleased with the battery life between charges. The timer is adjustable and automatically shuts off the unit which I like. The 6 modes aren't all comfortable for me but I like that I have options for various uses. Sometimes you just want a different kind of stimulation on a different region of the body. The only thing I dislike about it is the pads themselves could be better, they tend to peel up easily from my skin no matter what I do. But those aren't hard to replace with a better set.Overall, I am very happy with it and feel that if you're looking for an effective and economical TENS unit that's portable and easy to use I would recommend it.Notes: I received a complimentary product in exchange for an honest review. All opinions stated here are my own and are in no way influenced by the cost-free product.

I wanted to give this product a really snappy, clever review because they have such an amusing advert and this particular scentRoyal Flush (ha!)is great. Alas, I can't because I found that it's spray produces a fine mist that my asthma doesn't get along with. I had a very specific household member in mind when I got this... because that person isn't so great about warning everyone if the fan gets forgotten.A great product for households where breathing conditions are a non-issue, not so much for the rest of us.

I've been finding this book hard to review. Not because anything was wrong with it but because everything I want to say about it feels like a spoiler. I very much enjoyed this follow up to The Book of Ivy though. Getting to see the world beyond Westfall was great and the introduction of new characters helped strengthen the overall story. If you enjoyed the first book don't miss out on this one. It's a solid conclusion.If you haven't read the first book don't start here! You'll miss so much world building and character development that I think you'll have a hard time getting into it.

If you loved Becca Fitpatrick's Black Ice I think you will love The Foxglove Killings. It's one of those mysteries that really challenges the reader. I didn't think Kelly would be able to surprise me, I was sure I had the killer figured out and quite early in the book too. I'm very hard to surprise as a reader and that's both satisfying (who doesn't love being right?) but also disappointing because I love a good plot twist. This book did it!Woven with fascinating characters, a setting that is as much a character as the people, and a theme framed on classism THE FOXGLOVE KILLINGS manages to be dark, intense, and brutal in all the ways that will keep you up all night to finish it.

We've had this for 3 months now and I feel confident leaving a solid review now. It took me forever to find this litter box to replace an old Tidy Cat in a similar shape and size that was no longer being made. I have 2 male cats, one with mobility concerns and the other one who won't squat to pee so finding the right box was important.This is quite roomythe bigger of my boys is 15lbs of muscular monsterand fits a 25lb bag of clay litter nicely. My boys have both taken well to it. The only issue I have is that the closures on the sides are terrible. You really have to finagle them until they are both just right and even then they sometimes come undone. Especially if you want to use a plastic liner. It included a few of them and I'd never been one to use them before but I liked them a lot until I discovered what a pain they were with those closures.Overall, an economical box that's of a good size and quality. I would recommend it.

Hate to say it folks but not only is this EXTREMELY overpriced, it's really fragile. My spouse had put this in my cart to purchase for a tank we're putting together for our daughter and he hadn't looked at the size. This is TINY, very tiny for the $12.99 I paid. Worse, when it arrived Elsa was already broke off of the base. As I packed it up to return for a refund I noticed that the snowflake itself has a hole drilled into one of the spokes as if this was intended to be a part of a Christmas ornament. I meant to snap photos but I was in a hurry to get it ready for UPS to pick up.While it is very pretty, I'm concerned it might not actually be aquarium safe. Please do not waste your money on this.

You know a party book is weak when it has a larger invite section than games section. This was remarkably uninspired for a Disney product. As my husband would say... they are milking the Frozen cow for all it is worth. Most of these ideas aren't even particularly original. I'd consider this a great example of a company cashing in on a popular property and taking advantage of kids' naivety.Don't waste your money on it when you can find great ideas on Pinterest that are just as cuteif not even more sofor free.

If you're looking for a really comfortable pair of jeans, these are them. They're very soft and have great stretch. I have a really flat backside and these don't sag, but I'll admit I don't care for the shape of the pockets, they definitely accentuate the flatness. My pelvis is also on the shorter side so I find these sit much closer to my navel than I generally prefer but for those with a more average length there they should fit really well. The overall fit is true to size, unfortunately these gap in the back in spite of the claims they won't... and I have never had a pair of jeans that gap in the back for me!The rinse is quite a bit darker in person than in the picture but it looks like they've finally got the correct one shown. This is my first pair of jeans from Carhartt and it might not wind up being my last. I honestly never thought I'd dig anything Carhartt made and I live in a place where wearing the brand is part of our cultural stereotype but alas I'm starting to see why. These held their shape well, they're comfy,wear well, feel good in warm and cold weathers, and are just overall a great pair of jeans for the price.

I am loathe to write a DNF review. I don't write them very often as I hate not finishing a book, especially when I received a reviewers copy. Alas, LEGACY OF KINGS had three things bogging it down for me that ultimately lead to me making the choice to not finish and they were things I felt some readers may also find problematic.Writing in present tense narrative is something I hate and that was the first strike against LOK. One I could have forgiven if it had felt centered around two or fewer characters. Unfortunately, it just kept adding more and more characters until I began struggling to keep them straight. If you're one who is quite familiar with the characters in a historical context you might find this less problematic but for those of us who aren't it's confusing. The final straw was that nothing was happening. Lots and lots of talking. Then more talking. I just couldn't stay motivated to read LOK. I gave it a solid week to sway me and every time I read it just wasn't working.Guessing by the much higher ratings being given I'm betting that for the right reader this is a great book. I may decide to give it another go some day. It just wasn't working for me and for once, I felt confident that it was more about me than the book itself and I owed it to myself to move on to something I was enjoying instead.

What a different story. It's been a while since I was treated to a romance that had a solid dose of Bollywood spice and that's what I wound up enjoying most about THE BOLLYWOOD BRIDE. Ria is one of those onion characters, you just keep peeling layers and seeing more of whom she is. But I honestly never warmed to Vikram and their romance never felt like it was the central plot.While there's a touch of gothic romance underscoring part of Ria's past in good ways I found myself feeling as if Dev was trying to cram too many ideas into this book. Having not read her first book I'm not sure if this is just her style or an issue with this one only.If you're in the mood for something romantic that has a lot going for it beyond the happily ever after check this one out.

Finally something that lets me listen to my audiobooks in the shower. lolSo far I really like this. It's easy to use and easy to charge (love that it doesn't run on batteries or I'd constantly need to replace them). The only reason I'm not giving it five stars is that I'm not completely impressed with the sound quality. At times I've found that it didn't feel as projected as it could, like the speaker was swallowing the sound.For the price this is a great option for music/audiobooks/podcasts in the shower.

It hasn't truly hit heater season yet here in Montana but when it hits I'll update this review with more of my thoughts on this heater.First of all, it's beautiful. We mainly need a space heater in our large basement bedroom and while we've had lots of effective space heaters over the years none of them have been as attractive as this one. If having one that doesn't look awful in a space is important to you this is a sturdy and attractive option. Secondly, what I truly love about it is that it's very quiet. If you're hoping to use it at night to keep a room warm (as I will be) it's a very low noise choice. I was also pleased with the length on the cord. My cheaper ones have all tended to have short cords but this one is long enough to keep it at a safe distance from my wall and furniture.Overall, while I haven't been able to use it when it's -10F outside and my basement bedroom is arctic I've found it very nice on the few cooler nights we've had. While it's not an inexpensive heater I think it's well worth the investment in durability, quality, and effectiveness.

With all the early buzz about DUMPLIN' I couldn't help but feel compelled to give it a shot. I've always loved novels where someone who isn't the usual Mary Sue gets to take center stage but Murphy takes it just a step further and produces Willowdean Dickson, one of the most real characters I've had the pleasure of reading in a while. Rather than make the fat girl have a personality without flaws that makes her adventure a matter of size, Murphy created a girl so real and true to life it sometimes hurt.While at times I felt like the story tried to be too many things and jumped all over from themes of romance and friendship and familiar pressure and more, it was still engrossing. Two things killed my ability to rate it just a little bit higher though. The first was that it ended in a way that wasn't satisfying. I know some will be just fine with it but the word abrupt seems fitting to describe it and if those kind of endings bug you as much as they do myself you might find yourself disappointed. The second was that because of the way it ended a lot of parts of the storyline felt unresolved, actually the more I ponder it the more I think there wasn't really any resolution to anything.My grievances aside, there were so many wonderful characters and thoughts from Will within the book. Social issues of many flavors drop up and provoke thought and stimulate emotion. I personally felt grief for Will's aunt Lucy right alongside her. But other issues of class and status, culture and religion, sexuality and ability peppered DUMPLIN' with things I think are universally relatable.If you're looking for an excellent read for a book club that is sure to incite great conversations I very much recommend DUMPLIN'. One of the themes that overall will resonate with most young adult readers and adults alike though, is that we're all many things and sometimes things that seem opposite can be a part of us at the same time. You can be fat and beautiful, bold and insecure, love someone and not be in love with them. Even if you don't wind up loving DUMPLIN', you're sure to come away feeling as if you've had a heartfelt glimpse inside a character who is flawed and perfect all at the same time.

I'm going to blame the phenomenal graphic novel PRETTY DEADLY for giving me really high expectations when I pick up a western read with a female protagonist. Or maybe I'll blame the cover artist who made VENGEANCE ROAD so dang pretty that I expected too much from it. Either way it was one of those books that started out promising but wound up dragging for chapter after chapter and then gave one way-too-obvious clue as to the climax.My overall disappointment with the story aside, it wasn't bad just not quite as exciting and mysterious as I had anticipated. I love stories where a young woman disguises herself and has a great adventure and Kate was pretty awesome. The Colton brothers were an enjoyable contrast to one another and the way they interacted with Kate both before and after she gets revealed. Not everyone will love the way the writing is done but I love a first person novel that has an accent or dialect that gives it a voice. Additionally, there's an enjoyable set of author's notes about what inspired VR and how she researched the setting and era that I loved.While I found VR wasn't what I thought it had the potential to be I'd still recommend it. As long as you don't go in expecting lots of horseback chases and shoot-outs, and a somewhat lighter western than the True Grit comparison implies I think you'll find it enjoyable. Especially if you like seeing a young woman on the path to revenge.

I've recently rejoined the workforce after 10 years as a stay-at-home-mom. One of my biggest challenges so far has been that for those 10 years I did all of the cooking and cleaning (etc.) and now that I'm working but still at home meals are a bit more rushed. So when the opportunity to give this Multi-Cooker a try I was totally stoked. I love kitchen gadgetry anyway and the multitude of features here was quite promising.While it's a bit tricky to do more than use it as a rice cooker I think it will be a wonderful tool once I've established some fantastic recipes beyond those included in the book that comes with it. For my first attempt I adapted an oatmeal recipe from the book using Steel Cut (Scotch) Oats, an apple, dried cranberries, and a little bit of honey. I honestly figured it would fail but since Scotch Oats have become a recent family favorite I was quite curious if I could set-it-and-forget-it. To my delight when I got it going around 9PM it worked like a charm. After 20 minutes perfect oatmeal was done. So I let it sit on the Keep Warm setting until the following morning around 7:30AM when we enjoyed a warm and easy breakfast for a change. It was a bit drier and stickier by morning but not unpleasantly so. I was very impressed.Some things I also feel are very worth noting are that it has a handle (which I will love for the occasional dinners we have with friends where I normally haul my slow cooker) and that you need to take into consideration it needs additional time beyond the recipe time to heat up. For example, it took about 10 minutes to warm up for my oatmeal making the time before it was ready closer to 30 minutes. It seems to also remember where it was at if the power goes out. We occasionally have bad storms where our power cuts out so I tested this by unplugging the cooker during my oatmeal's cooking time and it went right back to where it was.Overall, I am really thrilled with it and can't wait to experiment with the many other features it has. It's a bit spendy compared to most slow cookers or rice cookers but I think the combination of features makes it well worth while. It's attractive, versatile, and easy to clean. I'm not sure what more I could have asked for.
