The elastic waist is in no may like ridiculous stretchy pants.  Instead the internal elastic waistband is a mere 1% spandex which gives just that extra give needed when buttoning the jeans.  Without that I wouldn't fit into these but now with my lost weight and slimming body these relaxed fit jeans fit snug but not too tight and look absolutely great allowing me to cater to my new thinner self.  And again the waist is not a cheap elastic material.  Instead the jeans appear the same as regular jeans till you go to button them and they have that little give.  I am thrilled that even while still having my slowing fading pot belly I can go down a size in jeans.  Finally I can wear a size 38.  And these jeans are in no way meant just for older folks like me.  Anyone who has a little extra in the waist will find these allow you to still have a great fit.  And they wash great as well.  I truly am very impressed with the quality of these jeans and can finally say goodbye to Levi's and especially to their outrageous prices.  Highly recommend these jeans.

I've been looking for a scale that is both decorative and accurate in its reading for quite a while now.  To receive this Taylor glass digital scale far surpassed all my desires and needs.  The scale is made of a very stable and durable glass and the faux marble design is classy and subtle.  The design will blend perfectly into any high end bathroom and is also simple enough that it will also add a great touch to any modern dcor or any style between these two ends.  More importantly though is its accuracy.  The scale comes with the batteries already inside and is honestly the most user friendly scale I have ever tried.  With first use you simply step on and off it quickly.  That resets the scale to zero and it is set to go.  When you stand on the scale to weigh yourself it will jump to your weight and at the end slow down to 0.2 pound increments of accuracy.  When the weight is ready the scale will flash twice and then the weight will be locked in.  The 3" lcd readout is bright and easy to read.  The tempered glass platform is made of the highest quality and this scale will read any weight up to 400 pounds which is a great bonus.  I can't recommend this scale enough.  Huge kudos to Taylor for making such a superior well crafted scale.

Be sure to note exactly what you are getting here before purchasing to make sure you get what you want.  The emphasis here is that you are getting a set of five bands with varying resistance (Yellow: 2-4lbs, Blue: 4-6lbs, Green: 10-12lbs, Black: 15-20lbs, and Red: 25-30lbs). The bands are strong, flexible and durable.  They are also easily stackable to build the weight of maximum resistance you want.  The set is user friendly for what you get.  It comes in a nice zipper pouch.  The added components are of good quality but you only get a door anchor which helps keep the bands in place when exercising.  You also get ankle straps that a great for bringing your workout to your legs.  The foam handles are comfortable and strong for extending the bands.  The one thing that confuses me is that the straps are very long and seem to only really be good for a tall person like me.  The directions are minimal and don't really offer suggestions or guide a person on how to use these bands to their best benefit.  So if you are looking for varying weight resistance bands that are of a long length this set might serve you well.  Again, read the details of what you get.  Don't be fooled that there is more to this set than described.

I wasn't sure if this would fit my Sony NWZE385 16 GB Walkman MP3.  The Walkman does fit but it is not a totally snug fit so there is sliding movement from top to bottom with about 1/4 inch of empty space.  The band fits on my arm but a more secure fit would be possible if the band was stretchable.  Instead I must make it very tight and if being very active it will eventually slide.  Also due to the slippage of theWalkman I must wear the band with the Walkman upside down to make sure the ear buds stay securely attached to the player.  And no matter how I position the band I find it pretty much impossible to click the function keys to jump tracks or change music.  I must stop, take off the band to do that.  At least once my music is set and the band in place I am pretty much set.  Sadly this product is a settling product.  It is the only option available to serve this purpose for the Sony NWZE385 16 GB Walkman MP3.  Lastly I am not sure how good the protective sleeve the Walkman rests in is from protecting it from sweat.  I don't sweat excessively when I wear it.  If you are looking for a product to wear your Walkman on your arm this is the only product available.  It will do the job but just be aware it is not perfect.  Also make sure you get the correct size band for your player.

Due to how hard it was to get this attached to the original band and then how bulky and cumbersome it became I toyed with the original band to be able to use that alone with a very tight fit.  This extender does work but is not made to seamlessly fit.  Instead you must really force the end into the original band and it does not add the number of inches stated in the product description.  It also makes the band very heavy and difficult to put on.  There is no way that the extender or original strap will not tear over minimal time due to how hard this is to use.  Also it comes with no instructions and due to how tricky and difficult it is to attach the extender it would be good to have some directions letting you know you were doing it right.  Instead I had to keep looking at the pictures on Amazon to make sure it was right.  If you really need it give it a try.  Sadly the iGadgitz arm band was the only item available to do the simple job of attaching my Sony NWZE385 16 GB Walkman to my arm.  This product for me was useless and too much of a pain to return.

It's been over 10 years since I have given remanufactured ink cartridges a shot.  They were always leaking and worked streaky at best.  So I've been buying the HP 92 and 93 dual pack to be sure they would work.  But the cartridges are very pricey and when I saw the price and reviews of the Valuetoner cartridges I decided to give them a shot.  If they didn't work out - nothing really lost due to the price.  I was totally impressed with the purchase right upon receiving them.  The cartridges are packaged individually and with great care.  They also come with detailed and clear details on the cartridges themselves, how they work and how to troubleshoot if your printer won't see them as valid cartridges.  It all went very simply for me.  My printer noted that they weren't authentic HP cartridges but accepted them right away and printed the test page the same as after every cartridge installation.  These cartridges did not leak at all upon opening and printed flawlessly upon installation.  The test page was perfect and after about 100 pages both cartridges have not streaked or faltered in quality at all.  I see some people feel some cartridges are not performing as they wish.  Honestly that has happened with authentic HP cartridges to me many times as well.  I print many photos and often with the HP cartridges they would start fading or streaking after only 10 prints and I would have to put my printer through the clean cartridges mode.  With these Valuetoner cartridges that has yet to happen.  I am more than thrilled and impressed with their quality and the professional packaging of the company.  I highly recommend giving this company and these cartridges a shot.  If my cartridges do indeed start to falter I will adjust this review accordingly to be as accurate and helpful as possible.

I just purchased a 32 oz narrow mouth water bottle and needed something to be able to clean it.  Thus the OXO Good Grips bottle brush.  Boy was I impressed with what I thought was going to be a simple basic item.  The handle is long and sturdy and the brush is hard enough to be sure to get the job done and soft enough to not scratch.  The brush gently squeezes into my water bottle and then the brush expands and provides a thorough cleaning.  It is also excellent for cleaning tall glasses where you don't want to take a chance getting your hand in there.  I am confused by some saying the handle or item itself is too small.  The handle by itself is 10 inches and the brush is 3 inches for a total of 13 inches.  I experimented with bottles with different size openings and found this brush could squeeze into anything with an opening even as small as 3/4 inches and then expand to fully clean.  Very impressed with this durable brush.  Lastly it also has a rubber grip on the top portion of the handle to help make cleaning even easier.  Definitely recommend.

For such a long time I have been reusing 16 oz. water bottles after I purchase them for the gym, outside exercising and just for having water on hand.  But problems with that were 1) bottle was too small 2) bottle hard to clean and 3) bottle pretty flimsy.  This Nalgene water bottle provided solutions to all my problems and has now become an item that I carry with me every day no matter where I am or where I go.  The bottle is strong, sturdy and when empty not too heavy while still being extremely durable. (I love the orange color I got.)  And when full it still isn't too heavy.  The cap fits on snugly and no matter how this bottle gets tossed around it doesn't leak at all.  The mouth opening is also perfect for me.  It far surpasses those ridiculous squirt bottles and is also not a wide bottle which manages to dribble water all over me when used.  This narrow mouth top is about the size of a quarter and just the perfect size to get a good amount of water each time.I use the treadmill at the gym and this bottle fits into the cup holder just fine.  But where it serves its greater purpose is on my daily aerobic walks and while just living life day to day.  The 32 ounces it holds is just the perfect amount to keep me hydrated all day with the bottle not being too heavy.  The most important factors here are the bottle is bpa free, it is very durable and does not leak, perfect size mouth and easy to carry around.  Highly recommend.

Hanes has always been my go to for white briefs and it has been a long time since I needed to order new pairs.  A lot has changed in that time.  Sizing was very frustrating for I used to simply get them in size 40 and I would get the fit I wanted.  Now they have changed their sizing to S,M,L etc.  The L is 38-40 and I am losing some weight so I gave them a shot.  Luckily for me they were the perfect size.  They fit snugly while not being too tight.  The material is heavier in the front where they need be and thinner the rest of the way around.  At first I wasn't happy noticing this difference from my older pairs but especially after washing I find the thinner material very breathable and soft.  These briefs certainly wash well and shrank just a minimal amount - I did wash them in hot water.  Some people have said due to the thin material these can seen see through.  I totally disagree.  As I stated above, the material is thicker where necessary.  Being tagless just adds to the comfort.  I took off one star for I did have to do some guesswork on which size would work best for me and think some others may have more trouble finding that correct snug fitting size due their new sizing system.  But for me, luckily having found the correct size that works, Hanes will continue to be my white briefs of choice.

This shower curtain is a great addition to any bathroom dcor.  I received the cream curtain in a damask design.  The design is luxurious and stylish without being over the top.  I have only positives for this curtain.  It is 100% polyester and manages to feel like a quality fabric curtain.  Common sense dictates that a shower lining must be used with it for this curtain is fabric and not meant to get wet.  This curtain is expertly designed so it will add that final touch to a high end bathroom or bring modern style to a more casual bathroom like mine.  I like brightly colored towels and mats and this cream designed curtain manages to make my bathroom look fresher and crisper with the curtain standing out beautifully while enhancing the other bright colors I have.  It will be perfect for the fall and winter months.  Excellent shower curtain with a simple design that is very well made and attractive.

I am a guy and I absolutely love this hair blower.  I love that it is very solid in construction, blows out steady strong air, is very easy to handle and hold and also find the fluorescent pink color a real kick.  But what matters to me most is that it has a true cool setting.  I wear my hair from short to mid length and I sweat easily.  In hot summers and even within the humid air after a shower in the winter warm air even on a low setting always takes forever to dry my hair and will also tend to make it dry.  I have been searching high and low for a hair blower that has a cool setting.  My old one only has warm/hot and I could only find ones that were the same but had an added cold burst.  This isn't really a setting and is meant to be used to hold hair in place when styling.I am glad that I got this hair dryer during a very hot summer so I could really test how it suits my needs and even on hot humid days when I can't stop the sweat the cool setting works well to dry my hair while cooling me down as well.  Now I can have full healthy hair even in humid weather and the 1875 watts really have the dryer putting out a strong stream of air.  I highly recommend this hair blower.  It is of much better construction than my old one without being too heavy or bulky.  I see it being very user friendly for women with long hair or styled hair as well.  And it also has that burst of cold air which I will occasionally press for some fun.  It's good to see a product so well made that works so well.

You would think after all this time a clock radio would be a reliable easy to use item.  Up to this one I just couldn't find one I really liked.  My old one was a Sony and this Timex puts it to shame.  First off I love its appearance - it is sleek, slim and modern taking up very little space on my nightstand.  It adds a definite positive look.  And the numbers showing the time are huge which is a must for me when I wake up without my glasses on.  There is a dimmer to adjust the brightness to your preference.  Also of utmost importance is setting or resetting the time.  When first plugged in it showed the day and month followed by the time zone.  It was eastern, my time zone, but the time was off one hour.  The manual explains everything clearly and simply and a quick slide to the DST Switch added the hour I needed.  The buzzer is an excellent volume for me and the radio comes in great with a total of 20 available presets.  You can use the aux in jack to connect external audio for playback and finally there is a usb port to charge any device you need to.  From the sleek design to having an actual hands on manual that explains everything this clock radio by Timex is the most user friendly one you can find.  I love it and highly recommend it.

I have always relied on Scotch-Brite non scratch sponges for my kitchen uses with pans, dishes etc.  They have always been reliable cleaning well and keeping all items scratch free.  But till these sponges I had yet to find any sponge to really work well on hard to clean areas around the home where grime and dirt has accumulated.  My perfect test for these was a seldom used shower stall that had been neglected.  I had tried other products that never got it fully clean and also made the task no easier.  Though these sponges advertise themselves with no pre-soaking needed being a pro, that doesn't matter to me and I did presoak the sponge as well as wet the shower stall tiles and ceramic base before use.  This sponge honestly proved to be miraculous.  Very little extra energy needed to be exerted on my part and this sponge easily and smoothly cut through all the grime and mess ultimately leaving a spotless and shiny shower stall.  I used it to clean my bathroom sink which I thought was clean and a new found shine emerged.  Bottom line, these sponges do as advertised and are indeed "extreme"  cutting through the hardest and dirtiest areas.  Also unlike other similar products they do not wear out quickly.  After use simply clean the sponge and rinse, let dry and it will be ready for use again.  Also for how extreme their cleaning power is they don't scratch any surfaces that I could tell.  I highly recommend these sponges.  For those jobs you usually find yourself forcefully scrubbing away at these sponges will be a wonderful solution.

When a true artist writes a novel it is amazing to see the true magic that appears.  And that is what happens here with MORE HAPPY THAN NOT the magical and truly heartfelt debut from Adam Silvera.  This novel is also so hard to classify.  Is it a gay novel?  No it is a novel where being gay is a part of the huge story being told.  Finally someone strong enough to write a novel where gay doesn't have to jump at you, be stressed as a major theme etc. even as the main character himself struggles with it.  The other complexity is that this is described a s a young adult novel and I say nope, it is a novel for people of all ages.  I am 53 and devoured it and the mastery of the mind that Silvera possesses.A simple life is shown for main character Aaron.  He is not really happy, not really troubled.  He is existing.  He has a supportive girlfriend, nonexistent brother and very busy mother.  His life has had trauma including the suicide of his father.  But then something happens.  Aaron meets Thomas and finally someone gets him.  he can be himself in a way he never could before.  And along with this comes feelings, emotions and obsession.  And Aaron's old life isn't too welcoming of his new special friend.  And Thomas really seems to bring out the true Aaron and that is a gay Aaron.  But all the problems that come with it make Aaron want to make it go away, sadly.  And the Leteo Institute can help with that.And that is enough of the plot for what this novel is about is the true magical realities of life.  Emotions glow and shine here jumping off the page.  The characters are so real and believable the reader can't help but get fully drawn into all the worlds that encompass Aaron.  And Aaron himself is a magical being.  It is a true honor to follow him on his journey of self discovery, fully allowing himself to identify all the parts of himself from his interests to desires.  Huge kudos to Silvera.  He presents here a truly special masterpiece of literary work that all can enjoy.  It  is about life and being true to ones self.  And the imagination that Silvera possesses adds layers and layers of searing wonder to an already special story.  Highly recommend and can't wait to see what he comes up with next!

I need to start by saying simply that FINDING JAKE is an exemplary piece of literary work written by Bryan Reardon who uses his skill with complex psychological themes, character development and a true gift of handling the written language to present a story that is timely, realistic and devastatingly believable.  The subject matter is hard core.  A stay at home dad who truly loves his family begins to question how well he knows one of his sons and goes through a deep inner struggle after a shooting happens at the sons school.  His son ends up being the only child missing and he must try to figure out what that means,  This story becomes very real as it openly encompasses all real and true emotions and feelings a parent and family would endure including faith and doubt, love and heartache.  The realities and emotions are laid on the page raw here.  The novel also manages to be a piece of psychological suspense while tackling these issues.  Reardon takes the reader on a wallop of an emotional journey till the satisfying conclusion.  This novel is very important to read not only for being an excellent novel but also due to how well it tackles issues that are so important in life today.

THE PRESERVATIONIST is the type of book that really shows how talented the writer is.  The story is pretty basic.  Freshman girl on college campus who is pretty fragile.  40 year old man who works at the campus becomes infatuated with her.  Another young man becomes interested in her as well.  Add into all this a serial killer striking on campus and the stage is set for a pretty good thriller.  But what author Justin Kramon manages to do is pretty amazing.  The novel starts pretty simply leading the reader to think it will be a basicly told tale but then an atmosphere of true creepiness, anxiety and growing horror instills itself in the tale and never lets up.  The characters become very real and whether the reader likes them or not the plot twists and turns play on your emotions till the final conclusion.  Kramon makes this a very real tale about fear, stalking and the true menaces that exist in society today.  Kudos to him.  The novel may actually be very disturbing for some but this is a testament to how good the author is.  He makes it all so very real.  This book had my skin crawling and stayed with me for a long time after finishing.  Highly recommend.

I am a die hard historical fiction reader and I wasn't exactly sure what to expect with THE ILLUSIONIST.  It is not so much historical fiction as much a period piece taking place in 1870 Victorian England.  Author Rosie Thomas skillfully brings all of that period to life.  The atmosphere and way of life jumps off the pages.  Bust more importantly this is a character driven novel that evolves around a young woman Eliza who is trying to find her way in life as a person and more importantly as a woman.  She is working as a model when she meets the amazingly well developed character Devil who is a showman looking to start his own theater company..  Add in Carlo Bonomi, a dwarf and the bizarre Jasper Button and you have the full set of main characters here.  They are quirky, bizarre and more importantly very human and fully developed by Thomas.  This novel has a captivating story line that will effortlessly pull the reader in.  It combines the world of the theater, a love story and a complex thriller.  And throughout all this the story is held together by Eliza as we follow her on her inner and outer journey.  Rosie Thomas shows true artistry here as she combines these innovative characters with such  a strange yet truly believable story line with the back drop of Victorian England.  The story line brought to my mind some of John Irving's novels.  If you like novels that are intelligently written and very imaginative with well developed characters you will love this book.

YOU CAN TRUST ME is indeed a nice addition to the light mystery and suspense genre.  The story is about Livy Jackson who is convinced the death of her friend was not suicide as it has been determined to be and with much research thinks it may be linked to the murder of her sister 18 years earlier.  This is not a deeply character driven novel.  Livy Jackson is believable and carries the story but most others are there to carry the plot along.  And that is fine for the plot is excellent.  Author Sophie McKenzie provides a very imaginative plot full of many believable twists and turns.  You become fully invested in Livy's search and once you think you have it figured out something will happen and send the story in a whole new direction. But it is all plausible, totally thrilling and definitely addictive.  Indeed a page turner the suspense here will have you reading quickly till the satisfying conclusion.  Always happy when I discover a new author to read, Sophie McKenzie has now been added to my must read list.

When you read the story synopsis for this novel you may be taken aback by how dark and disturbing it sounds.  Author Jessica Treadway tackles some heavy stuff here and comes up with an amazingly complex and intricate intelligent psychological thriller.  What we get added in is the full concept of the family dynamic.  Sadly the story here is not one unheard of in true crime.  Parents that have an awkward, different and somewhat troubled daughter are happy when she finds a boyfriend and seems to come out of her shell.  But then disaster strikes and the parents are attacked brutally asleep in bed.  The husband dies, mother survives and the boyfriend is found guilty.  But he then receives an appeal and the daughter returns home.  That is the story in a nutshell but what Treadway provides the reader is so much more.  This is a deep and intelligent psychological thriller told with maturity, insight and truly complex characters that jump from the page.  Treadway handles this very disturbing subject matter with full respect to the reader and takes them on a true journey.  The story is told from the viewpoint of Hannah, the mother, who is forced to relive the nightmare event over and over and the multitude of feelings and emotions she goes through are both devastatingly realistic and believable.  This novel may be difficult for some but it is told with such intelligence and literary prowess that the reader will feel safe while treading such subject matter.  Disturbing but highly recommended.  This is what quality literature is.

This book is excellent for a summer beach read or late at night before bed - though falling asleep might be a little difficult at some points of this creative thriller.  Evelyn Baine is an FBI profiler whose best friend had disappeared 18 years earlier.  Now in the present day another girl goes missing, now making it four total, with the same clues being left.  This is a very intriguing premise and author Elizabeth Heiter runs with it providing a strong suspenseful read with many unexpected twists and turns.  Understandably the main character is emotionally involved in finding out what happened to her friend but at times character development is not fully consistent or even somewhat lacking.  But this novel is not a deep intelligent psychological thriller and I don't mean that in a bad way.  What the reader gets is a strong novel of romantic suspense that is driven by a very imaginative plot that carries the reader to the very satisfying ending.  Some great thrills here combined with slow and effective building suspense.

This is the first camcorder I have ever owned.  I have used friends over the years and pretty much know how they work and am so glad that they have been around a long time before getting my first one.  This camera is so user friendly and is very small and fits in the palm of your hand.  This makes it easy to use for video experts as well as those new to camcorders whatever the age.  The camera films seamlessly and even if you jitter a little when filming the video shoots flawlessly.  You also get a suction cup mount that will attach to your car or other moving thing as well as one for a helmet or more stationary item.  Everything you need to process your video, edit it, make special videos or movies is here and the directions are very good.  Some say they are not but you get basic instructions here and more detailed info is available online which many companies are doing now.  I could go on and on but all the camcorder says it does in the item description it does and then some.  I must again stress how simple it is to use and that it will provide all the high quality necessary for video experts as well as provide a new user with all the tools to put this camera to its best use.  I've been having a ball with it and have been shooting some fun videos to put on the internet.  Much fun.  I've researched other such items and really think this action cam set is the best deal.  Definitely recommend.

Joy Fielding has been writing for a long time and I became a huge fan after reading her deliciously suspenseful book SEE JANE RUN  That was an amazing literary psychological novel of true suspense.  Since then her books have been hit or miss.  I loved STILL LIFE and HEARTSTOPPER but really didn't like SHADOW CREEK or NOW YOU SEE HER.  I found her style to be turning more mainstream and many novels even took on a Mary Higgins Clark style with one dimensional characters and slight plot lines.With this new one SOMEONE IS WATCHING Joy Fielding pretty much returns to her true form.  When it comes to the plot she is masterful here with believable twists and turns and suspense that truly will keep the reader breathless.  The characters are another story.,  The main character Bailey Carpenter is well developed and her psychological profile mixed with the great story are what make the novel work.  Other characters can tend to be pretty one dimensional and some conversations are pretty silly.  But from the first truly dramatic scene in the book Fielding turns into an A+ writer in regards to the strong plot.  Her writing there shows she still has the chops for an excellent psychological thriller.  Read till that scene and Fielding will pull you in with it and make you read till the end.  Her sometimes too detailed descriptions of clothing, furnishings and the like which are truly a la Higgins Clark need to be just overlooked.  The overall read here is excellent and to Ms. Fielding I say write a truly great novel like SEE JANE RUN to  remind your readers you still have it.  And I guarantee new readers will come running to read it too.  But this novel I can definitely recommend.  Give it a shot and really good suspense will come your way.  It may not be SEE JANE RUN but it comes close.

l I love this Curel fragrance free lotion and have been using it for years now.  I don't use it on my face but it gets daily use on my hands and the rest of my body.  I have sensitive skin and arm really turned off by any fragrance.  This lotion is truly fragrance free and what is next in order of importance for me also is it doesn't get greasy at all.  It is a medium thick lotion and absorbs into the skin pretty quickly moisturizing right away.  I use it on my hands before bed year round.  In the summer months that is all I need to keep my hands soft  no matter how often I wash them or whatever else they get put thru.  In the winter months I may need to use it another time during the day due to the dryness in the air here in the northeast.  It is also in the wintertime that I use it on my body as well for having the heat on so often my body can get dry and need some help.  Curel advertises this product as providing 24 hour relief.  It certainly does that but I also find with regular daily use it thankfully makes you feel like you don't have dry skin at all.  It certainly does comfort as it states and I love how it replenishes moisture making your skin feel healthy without that greasy feeling other products may have.  Highly recommend and if you have sensitive skin this should definitely work for you.

I had lasik surgery years ago which worked great but now have dry eyes and an eye condition called blepharitis.  These are the only drops my eye doctor recommended and also the only ones I found truly work with my own trial and error with different drops.  These drops are very comfortable and soothing on the eye when used and the lubricating effect is pretty instantaneous.  I use them daily in the morning and evening.  By doing this my eyes never get the grit feeling or slightly blurred vision associated with dry eye.  Other drops I tried either burned the eyes a little or just didn't continue to work over time and I needed to use them more frequently.  My local drugstore has their version of this eye drop but with certain products you need to stay with the name brand.  I stand true by the Refresh tears and highly recommend them to anyone with continuous dry eye.  And the true testament is my eye doctor always telling me he can tell I am using the drops by the moisture of my eyes.  If you've struggled trying out other brands of eye drops Refresh just may be your answer.  They are the only ones for me.

I have gone through so many backpacks over the past few years and the zippers either broke or material tore and this was just with every day use.  I have been using this Fat Boy backpack for 2 months now and am thrilled with it.  It is not just ok or just of acceptable quality.  This is a great backpack.  It has so many pockets that it fulfills any need imaginable I may have.  There are 2 large pouches and a mid size pouch that has a pocket, key ring and other storage compartments.  The front has a small zippered pocket that holds quite a bit and is perfect for keys and items needed to be on the ready.  Due to the problems I had with other backpacks I eased into use with this one and that was not necessary at all.  The Fat Boy backpack is made of very strong durable duralite material and is made to withstand heavy use and still hold strong.I only have positive things to say about this backpack.  First, it is a very attractive bag.  Each zipper has two ends and are very strong and never catch on anything or show sign of wear no matter how stuffed the backpack may be.  I use it every day and it has gone from being stuffed to the brim with heavy books and other items to just dragging it around with the daily necessities.  The bag is a perfect size that is great for use with minimal storage and expands to a huge size when each storage area is fully packed.  And as I said it never shows wear.  The straps are very comfortable, the clip in front with which to add heavy gear is very helpful and most importantly for me the small handle on top is very durable as well.  That is often how I carry the bag and again, it never pulls or shows signs of wear.  Also of importance is the material of the inner sleeves and that is strong as well and will not tear.  I have also used this backpack in the rain and it has never gotten wet inside.I recommend this backpack very highly for any possible use from school to hiking or even overnight traveling.  It can be small and slim when need be and does indeed open up to be a true fat boy when filled to the brim and you will be amazed at all it will hold.  I'm thrilled I discovered this brand.  It comes with a 5 year warranty and is of the highest quality.

Often engagement calendars such as this aren't of the highest quality.  That is far from the truth with the 2015 Downton Abbey engagement calendar.  The pages are of excellent quality glossy stock paper.  Each page which has the dates has 7 days on it with the current, past and next month in small print at the bottom.  And every other page is a glorious picture of the cast and set of Downton.  These beautiful photos are definitely enhanced by the quality of the glossy paper on which they are printed.  This calendar indeed does Downton proud and will make any fan very happy.  Also each date is within a spacious rectangular square for plenty of writing.  In the back there is a page showing all the months for 2014, 2015 and 2016 plus lovely lined blank pages for notes.  Love this engagement calendar and can't recommend it enough !

The title of Olly Mur's new cd NEVER BEEN BETTER says it all.  He has never been better!!  I am a huge Olly fan and am so glad I discovered him.  I am still waiting for him to fully take the US by storm.  He has such a strong individual identity to his music and its a style we are definitely lacking here in the US.  Songs may have a tinge of Maroon 5 at times or even Bruno Mars to Michael Buble but when it comes to it there is only one Olly Murs.  He is a true artist - a singer and performer  with a cheeky personality and amazing voice with a range that can go to the very low to high falsetto.  The first single here WRAPPED UP is a feel good disco tinged danced track that is amazing.  The opening track DID YOU MISS ME starts things off with a strong uptempo beat that had me answering "Yes I did miss you Olly!!"  The song also sets a high order for the rest of the cd.  I have loved all of Olly's cds and don't think there is one bad track on any of them but here on NEVER BEEN BETTER he manages to raise the bar.  His style and passion is still in the forefront but this cd is in no way a rehash of other albums and other hits like DANCE WITH ME TONIGHT or TROUBLEMAKER.  BEAUTIFUL TO ME and NOTHING WITHOUT YOU are beautiful ballads and HOPE YOU GOT WHAT YOU CAME FOR, WHY DO I LOVE YOU and CAN'T SAY NO are awesome uptempo tracks.A real standout here is also UP a great duet with Demi Lovato.  The thing with Olly is on his cds each song comes to life with his true artistry and emotive ability.  This guy can really sing and his strong vibrant personality that is such a major part of his charisma also shines thru on all tracks.  And Olly is an artist that makes his music even better when performed live and if you have seen him with each superb track here you can just envision it being brought to life with his intense passion and talent  STICK WITH ME is an anthemic type song and the regular cd ends with two lovely slow almost a cappella ballads TOMORROW and LET ME IN that truly showcase Olly's vocal abilities.  The deluxe edition comes with four additional tracks including the standouts WE STILL LOVE and HISTORY.If you are an Olly fan already purchasing this will be a no brainer but if you are just finding out about Olly Murs I highly recommend this cd.  Olly is the real deal and an artist to definitely be following.  This is his fourth studio album and he just continues to grow and get even better and the future for him is timeless.  He is so huge in the UK and I really hope with this cd the US can get on board as well. I love Olly.  NEVER BEEN BETTER is my favorite song on this new cd and the title sums up the cd as a whole.  Can't recommend it enough.

With Hane's products I always know they will be comfortable and fit as they should but with these I wondered if they could honestly deliver as described.  And the answer is a definite yes.  First off, as I already stated these briefs are ultra soft and fit like perfection seamlessly not pulling or tugging in any way they should not.  To test if they truly adapt to body temperature change I wore these for many days here in the northeast going in and out of cold weather, while exercising and jogging and pretty much any activity you could think of.  And where when wearing my regular briefs I would sweat and be left damp these did indeed adapt to my body temperature changes and remain warm and protective throughout all changes.  I was so impressed I ordered some t shirts as well.  For someone who tends to be an excessive sweater these are a true gift.  Definitely recommend.  They indeed work as advertised.

I love that all Diana Ross's RCA albums have been gloriously remastered by Funkytowngrooves.  To some these were the wasted years.  I totally disagree.  Listening to these albums there are many standout album tracks and some that fall into the category of Ross classics.  Most artists were having a difficult time finding the right sound in the early 80s after disco had died and a new techno sound was emerging.  Diana Ross managed to do it providing some excellent music as far as I am concerned.With the 1983 RCA ROSS  Diana's vocal performances are superb and she takes a full on r&b urban soul interpretation of the songs, even those that are more pop.  From the opening THAT'S HOW YOU START OVER to LOVE WILL MAKE IT RIGHT, LET'S GO UP and even GIRLS she caresses each song with that velvety Ross voice and makes each song shine.  The standouts are the funky jammin PIECES OF ICE and my favorite the uptempo UP FRONT.  This cd is beautifully remastered and there are 8 bonus tracks that are worth the price of admission alone - 3 different mixes of PIECES OF ICE and 4 of UP FRONT.  Add into this the great ballad LOVE OR LONELINESS and in-depth liner notes and you get a Ross gem.I highly recommend this great expanded edition of the 1983 RCA ROSS not only to Diana fans. but also to all r&b/soul fans.  Diana sounds great here and this album stands up there with many of her finest.

I had to return this one.  I was very disappointed with this blanket for many reasons.  I was replacing an old high quality fleece blanket that was starting to wear where it tucked under the mattress.  I saw all the rave reviews here so quickly purchased it.  I was very surprised by how lightweight it was.  It was soft but seemed of lower grade quality and something that wouldn't last long compared to my old one.  The one I have was thicker and softer than this one.  But perhaps this is just a matter of opinion.  The chemical smell it had upon opening was not.  I had purchased a cotton blanket, new sheets along with this blanket.  I washed everything and only had a problem with this blanket.  After washing the chemical smell was just as strong and even stranger for it was now mixed with the pleasant smell of my detergent.  I ended up sticking with my old blanket which is of far superior quality and sent this one bad.  Must admit I was very disappointed.  The smell kept me from being able to try it out and test its true durability and comfort/warmth factor.

Every year at this time I go on my search for my calendar of choice for the upcoming year.  I found many great options here on Amazon and then realized upon closer inspection that many lacked the normal info on each calendar month.  They only listed the days without listing holidays and more importantly having a small square of the previous and upcoming month.  I was so glad I realized this and then I luckily found this Guys calendar.  Often a calendar can be a disappointment when seen in person but not this one.  12 hunky guys of all varieties in seductive poses shot to definitely show them all at their best.  These are not just magazine type shots but true professional quality photos done with impeccable lighting that are truly meant to be seen in large calendar size.  The calendar is printed on high grade paper and also has a page showing October to December 2014 so the calendar can be put to use way before 2015.  This calendar was printed in the UK.  Everything is English but under each month and day each is also typed in 4 other languages.  Not sure what they are but this calendar is recommended for not only English speaking people.  If you enlarge the picture of the back of the calendar above you will see what I mean.So I've found my 2015 calendar and couldn't be happier.  If you are looking for a calendar with attractive men to help you get through the year this one I highly recommend.  Great quality and a great purchase!

I needed to replace a very old cotton blanket that I had.  I use it alone with sheets in the spring/summer months and along with a fleece blanket in the winter.  The old one I had was very soft but also felt like a knit and stretched out very easily and quickly became threadbare.  But it was comfortable.  This Utopia cotton blanket now shows me what a quality cotton blanket should be.  It is not stretchy like my old one.  It has a weight to it that manages to still keep you cool in the warm months and add warmth in those cool winter ones.  I washed it once and it did shrink a little but this was due to my putting it on high heat in the dryer.  I got the full/queen size and it fits perfectly on my queen bed.  The plum color is very attractive.  The blanket is very soft and comfortable and very durable.  It's so nice to have a light blanket that still has some weight and where the material does not pull or stretch at its own will.  This is a quality 100% cotton blanket and puts cheaper lower quality ones to shame.  Definitely recommend.

So much is great about these sheets.  They are amazingly soft, wash very well and are the perfect thickness for warm summer nights or cool winter ones.  The title is indeed misleading.  Are they Egyptian quality?  I have no idea.  And they are said to be 1500 thread count but that info is no where to be found on the package.  Sadly most of the negative reviews here are due to this misleading info in the title.  These sheets are indeed 100% polyester and of a very high quality especially for such a price.  I love these sheets.  I added them to all new bedding material - comforter and blankets and they add an extra luxurious touch.  I have also washed them many times and the gorgeous color and softness have in no way faded.For those looking for 1500 thread count that is not what these are.  I wish these were advertised for exactly what they are.  The misleading info is in no way necessary.  They are indeed high quality sheets that can sell very well for what they actually are.  I gave a true 5 star review for the thread count etc. didn't matter to me.  I got soft, durable, attractive luxurious sheets that are very comfortable.  My needs were totally met and then some.  I will indeed be buying more.

They aren't Stars, but they are Champions. First time I've had to buy new discs since 2000 (and my old ones are still in excellent condition, almost all are Innova Champions)Spendy but highly recommended if you want a good set. Now I can buy a couple of individual discs and complete my set.I feel weird now that I've described my disc golf discs as if I were building a Magic: The Gathering card set...

Who doesn't like mini-wheats? You're probably a communist. If America had just instituted the mini-wheat test during the McCarthy years, we could have uncovered all KGB spies and won the Cold War in like... 1871. Pretty sure that's the right date.Nope. My wife is a history teacher and she's threatening to give me the silent treatment because of my totally accurate and believable history lessons that I give in Amazon reviews.

Let's just say the Fuchsia is EXTREMELY BRIGHT. I'm waiting for some jerk to call me a fruity name so I can bounce one of my disks off his head. I would definitely buy this again, and if my wife sticks with playing, I'll buy her one. Excellent quality, tons of storage/pockets/zippers, and the strap is padded. Very high quality and I hope it holds up for years.
Coupled with an AC900 router, no more hitching with Prime/Netflix/HBO (router is downstairs, this is upstairs). Looks funny, works great, and wasn't too expensive.

I'm so in love with this little lantern. It's bright as heck even on "normal" setting. Flexible, waterproof, solar charging... what more can someone ask for?Oh, that's right, I'll tell you. The docking of one star is because the USB charging port is INSIDE the lid, which is annoying. Beyond annoying. Beyond BEYOND annoying for the fact that the port doesn't seem to like USB chargers. Don't get me wrong, it charges just fine, but only once you actually get the cable end to fit all the way into the charging port.But that's the only thing I can find wrong with it. If the apocalypse ever comes, the only way I'll be in the dark is if someone blots out the sun.
We're huge Blackhawks fans who live out west. We're now huge hockey nerd-fans who have begun collecting hockey memorabilia.
Works perfect. Not sure why anyone would pay double+ for anything else.

I give this thing five stars simply for the hilarious comments I've received when friends see it in my camera case.But I also give it five stars because it's waaaaaay handy and for more than just cleaning camera stuff.I got the big 'un. Could probably also double as a weapon if you were a kung-fu master, but you maybe want to not take my advice on that too seriously (unless you are a kung-fu master, then it's probably a good idea).

It's pepper. But somehow it's better than pepper. It's like... super pepper? Ultra pepper? Crazy pepper. I like Crazy Pepper the best. I'm going to call this Crazy Pepper from now on. I've also added it to our Prime Pantry list to ship every six months.You wouldn't think there was that much difference between regular "mass produced" pepper (I feel weird even saying that) and this. But there is. Just try it. Get yourself a nice grinder.

Gave this to a friend who has a 9 month old. Her comments:"Dries fast, the suction cups stick far better than I thought they would. Easy to keep all of the bath toys and other items in a single, easy to reach location. Would highly recommend."
Decent product, annoying to clean. Looks like it will last a long time. Maybe I'll stop receiving an email every day to review this product now that I've reviewed this product?
Was exactly what I needed.

So... I saw a few kettles on sale and decided to have a look. I happened to notice this one, which made me smile, because I've had one for almost seven years according to Amazon:"You purchased this item on December 10, 2008."Well... it's still going. Used to get a lot of scale build-up before we installed a water softener. Have never had that problem again. For the price and the long-term reliability (it gets used 3+ times per day pretty much 350+ days per year), I don't think this thing can be beat.

It's an Xbox One. I wanted a PS4, but the PS4 is nothing like the PS3 in terms of media center hub. Our Xbox360 was like a jet engine, so that didn't help either.However, we have over 1,000 DLC songs for Rock Band (Xbox360), and they won't transfer to Sony's console, so that kind of made the decision pretty easy. We mostly use it for Netflix at the moment, if it even turns on at all (summer = rarely watch TV). It IS very quiet, so there's that, which is a huge plus for us.Games... I don't know. I got GTA5 with it, but I hate FPS-style games on consoles because I grew up with mouse + keyboard. So I bought GTA5 for PC, and have played over 100 hours so far. I bought my wife Dragon Age: Inquisition, but she's a PC gamer as well, and has been addicted to Civ5 all summer (school teacher, this is her only time to play).I'm sure there will eventually be non-FPS games (we love racing and sports and puzzle games) that will never come out for PC, so we'll eventually get our gaming in. Definitely when Rock Band 4 comes out this fall.I'm still unhappy that I have to pay for XBL just to use Netflix and other apps. I don't play online on the consoles, only PC. But I paid just so I can cry and complain about it, though my normal brain assures me that eventually I'll use enough features to justify the $32 (got it on a great sale!). Plus, I am well aware of the fact that paying for a premium service means the service is generally superior to others. I own a PS3 as well, and Xbox has always been better in terms of online services, though Sony has definitely caught up these days. So I complain, but in the end, I understand and accept. It's a first-world problem. I guess I'm lucky enough to complain about paying $32 for a luxury when $32 in other parts of the world could buy life-saving medicine. Now I feel like a jerk for even owning an Xbox... what the...?Pro:quietfasthas all the proper apps like Netflix, Amazon Prime, Hulu, sports, etcgood games that I'll be interested in eventuallyROCK BAND 4! AND ALL OUR PREVIOUS DLC TRANSFERS!somehow the controllers are even better than the 360'sbuilt-in wireless and HDMI - I would have never bought another MS product if they made me go through the misery they did with the 360 and the separate and crummy wireless adapter and no HDMI port (yes, they added HDMI on the later ones... but I wasn't about to buy another 360 just for that).Helped us decide to cancel DirecTV and save $113/month once we could get the NHL Center Ice package to work with XBLMS always updates their consoles and adds excellent features (like backwards compat and DVR functions)Cons:sort of useless for the moment but that will slowly change over timemakes me sad that I waste energy complaining about having to buy Xbox Live Gold when other humans on the planet are living in horrible conditionsNo HBO Now app yet

When I first put these on my Jackson, I was amazed at how bright they were. Then I turned on my amp (Marshall head + 1960 cabinet) and was very disappointed. The strings were TOO bright. I know, that sounds odd, but I just didn't like it. Keep in mind, I'm a "metal" guy, so I like my sound a lot darker, but I always love the bright-yet-evil tones new strings always bring.The Jackson is tuned normally, and I do play more than just metal, but even clean tones and non-metal distorted tones were just too dang bright. The treble nature of these strings + 2x9v EMG-81 bridge pickups kept muddling everything together in a weird, not pleasant way. I've messed with my tone controls a hundred different ways, and no matter what, it was just too bright. I initially was going to give the strings a 1- or 2- star rating, but with the explanation/context of why. They are NOT bad strings at all. Just too freakin' bright and sharp and treble-y.However, I bought these about the same time as I bought my wife an electric bass + amp. I decided to leave the strings on the Jackson as my ESP has the super bottom-end heavy strings and is set up and tuned to D, though I spend a lot of time in drop C. So I kept these Cobalts on the Jackson so she and I wouldn't have tuning issues while teaching her to play. Fast-forward about two months, and my initial dislike for the strings has changed.I'm really liking how they've held their brightness, but it has mellowed out quite a bit after 6-8 weeks of banging around on them. Again, still very bright, but yet now they no longer bleed notes into one another while annoying me to death with the sheer high-pitched treble.However, even though I'm very thorough about cleaning strings and the guitar after every use, they are starting to corrode. I play the ESP about 1.5x more than the Jackson, and the ESP's strings are at least twice as old as the Jackson w/Cobalts, yet the ESP's strings are not showing any signs of rusty-corrosion-whatever it is that happens to metal strings.If you're after a really bright tone, these are the best I've ever heard. I'm very tempted to try the super bottom-end versions on my ESP. But like everything audio, everyone's tastes / preferences will be different. There's probably seven other guitarists who are exactly like me in terms of music style and genre preferences who would throw rocks at my head for saying the Cobalts are too bright because to them, the Cobalts are too muddy or such. I'm mostly disappointed that they don't hold up to sweat/moisture as well as the non-Cobalts on my ESP.

Bought this and the Swiss Navy brand at the same time. While I don't really need to go into details, I can say that this stuff isn't really all that great. It is extremely slick at first, but unlike the Swiss Navy product, it gets tacky very quickly, almost like water-based lubricants. It's not really all that pleasant of a sensation, if you can imagine when such a product would be used.It's very expensive compared to the Swiss Navy stuff (which is kind of embarrassingly large spray-pump bottle, which makes me feel weird for some reason, but hey, at least it's not the 55gal drum of personal lubricant that was on sale during Prime Day disaster sale). It doesn't take a lot, for sure, but this would run out about 25x faster than the other brand (which costs less).However, this is our first time trying silicon lubricant, and I'm glad we did. It is VERY superior to water-based products (in our opinion). After 13 years, I'm not embarrassed to say that being disappointed in this particular product is okay for the fact that just trying silicon-based products in general has re-excited our already fulfilling lives.(wow, that sounds kind of pretentious! But it's true, which sounds weird, right?)

Puzzles are so annoying! I hate them!That's a quote from my wife as we spend a couple hours every other night putting this together... but she actually loves them because she's the one who talked me into doing something I haven't done since I was... 8? 9? haha, anyway, it's actually very soothing to listen to slow groove music or nighttime NPR while concentrating on not smashing the table into sawdust because YOU CAN'T FIND THE ^$##$@! RIGHT END PIECE? DID THEY EVEN INCLUDE IT? I BET THEY DIDN'T JUST TO MESS WITH US!This was the only hockey-themed puzzle in the 1000 piece range, and we're huge hockey fans. Hockey is an aggressive sport, and apparently so is jigsaw puzzling. I've been shoved out of the way numerous times already. I think I need to buy us both mouthguards if we're going to continue to spend loving couples' time together in this manner ;).

It works! Though our household has moved on from optical drives of any kind, I had to buy this for a customer when I built him a new computer. Burns great, plays CD, DVD, and Blu-Ray no problem, isn't loud (even when spinning, though noticeable, just not annoying), and is compatible with everything under the sun.Remember when these things were $500 just for CD burners? I gave the customer 2x100 spindles of DVD-R / +R blanks just because they've been sitting on the shelf for about 5 years...

Bought my very first SLR (a Nikon D3300 DSLR), and needed this to get the images/movies from the camera to my desktop. The camera is only USB 2.0, and with 32GB of junk (I'm still learning how to use the camera so I take a ton of pics and movies and most are awful or blurry as I'm learning the settings) to move, I wanted it to go quickly.Transfers are just as good as my portable SSD drive. I'm sure having a top-end SD card and being a PC junkie my whole life helps in the sense that I buy/own high-end gaming and editing machines. I like to deal with the pictures and movies on the desktops as they all have RAID-0 platter or SSD drives, so speed is important to me.This unit is nice and small, which is both good and bad, as I've already lost it once in the short time I've owned it. I love that it has a cap, but wish companies would figure out how to keep the cap attached to the unit with a short leash (durable one too). Of course, that's a feature in units costing 2x or more.Overall, very satisfied. I would recommend this product to anyone. Transcend might be a bit of a no-name company, but to techies like me, they're a very familiar name and make excellent products (and like any product line, there are bound to be some lemons in there... it's tech!).

Based on the top reviews, and after 3+ weeks of driving myself and my wife crazy with the hardcore researching about which camera to buy in this price class, I chose the D3300. My first experience was with a third-party seller, and I'm still extremely angry at them for hosing my order up so badly.So, I decided to spend a little more and buy from Amazon instead, knowing Amazon would make any problems go away as quickly as possible. Since I didn't get the kit from a 3rd party, I paid more and got a lot less in terms of accessories. I've had to buy the wireless remote, wired remote, filters, petal shade thing, cleaning cloths and brushes, all that stuff that I've just found out is pretty essential if you're going to spend the time to learn how much this camera can do. I'm an avid sci-fi nerd, which means I love nothing more than to stare at the night sky, and now stare at the night sky while the camera is doing a long exposure to capture the Milky Way.The case is nice and padded, and has room for the camera and both lenses, and so far, all of my accessories. It has adjustable padded velcro doohickies in it to resize the compartments to your needs. It's not stiff at all, which could be worrisome if I was rough and tumble, but since this is my first "real" camera in my 41 years, I tend to treat it like my ESP and Jackson guitars (like they are unstable nitroglycerin containers).The lenses are both Nikon-made, though I'm nowhere near experienced enough to know if they are as great as others have said in these reviews. So far, the camera and lenses work exactly as they should, and I've quickly learned how to actually do manual settings in some situations (as Auto mode is okay, but when you hit the right exposure/ISO/etc, the full moon through the zoomed 200mm is too awesome for words... I guess I'm weird but it's still amazing that my moon pictures that I got the settings right look just as good as the National Geographic type quality stuff I've seen my whole life... the craters and such... this came from MY CAMERA!).The D3300 doesn't have all the extra Autofocus bells and whistles that some others do, but so far, it works great. Again, I'm a nooblet, but I'm doing something right, and I'm sure that something is getting a good camera and lens that will guide me with excellent results. The flash is something I haven't used much of yet, though I am definitely going to purchase an external unit as I'm a nerd and want to learn that too.One of the things I like about the lenses, and this is probably common knowledge to SLR users, is that they have a little button on them to lock the lens "closed" (or "retracted" is probably a better term). The camera is constantly reminding me when I turn it on that I have to hold the button on the lens housing and twist to get it to lock in the "open" mode. Seems like it would be annoying, but I'm paranoid-careful still so this is a good thing. Plus it retracts them further than their shortest active mode, which saves an inch or more of space in the bag.Overall, I am more pleased with this camera kit than I can put into words. Again, it's my first "real" camera. Sort of like when I bought my first "real" (ie: expensive as @#%@) guitar. It's a learning experience for sure, but I joined a local camera club that meets regularly, and I'm a big internet nerd so I've been reading as much as I can then rushing outside to try it out. I like that the camera guides me into doing things without confusing me too much.The biggest issue I've run into so far is I had to search the internet to find out why the camera wouldn't take pictures in the dark. I KNOW these things are awesome at taking pictures of the night sky, but mine wouldn't... For experienced camera persons, you're probably wanting to thump me in the head because you know the answer, but for other rookies like me, the answer is: set it to manual focus.Yep, turn off AF (autofocus). If it's too dark, the camera can't focus on a subject and so refuses to open the shutter. Now, there might be another way around this, but this was the only real answer I found that solved my problem. Now I've got about 9GB of images from just about every shutter speed imaginable, and I'm about to have about 5000000GB more now that I have a wired shutter remote and can leave it open for an hour or more.Note to self: buy a nice motorized tripod with GPS so it will track the stars and not leave streaks.This kit did come with the wireless / WiFi adapter. I haven't used it yet, and to be honest, I'm not sure if I ever will. I guess I should finally stop being an old man and get an Instagram account. I have a nice LG G3 phone, but I can't really see how using my camera in WiFi mode would be helpful. It seems like just another step or six that I'd have to go through when what I really dig is popping the SD card and plugging it into the desktop via USB 3.0 card reader. Blazing fast transfers that way, much faster than WiFi or USB 2.0 phone. I'll keep it around just in case someone tells me a good use for it, but if the kit came without it, I wouldn't have cared. Which also means I am glad I saved some money and bought this model instead of the next step up (D5300?) which has built-in WiFi and GPS.Thanks to all of the great reviews of this product. They really did help me make up my mind between this and the Canon T5i (I REALLY wanted the 1080p video @ 60fps, and from everything I've read and seen, the D3300 video capabilities are superior to almost every other camera in this price range) and a few others (Pentax and Minolta were candidates too).
Batteries charge quickly and last as long as Energizers/Duracells. No reason to ever go back to disposable batteries again.

Uh... trash bags. Trash bags that won't split open when you put non-pointy, non-heavy, non-whatever items in them! Probably can't withstand the weight of a dead body, but if you're a hitman or other crazed psycho, you probably have better options than trash bags to hide/move the evidence of your crimes.

These are fantastic! The only thing I wish was better would be that they'd stay on as long as they detect motion instead of shutting off and making me wave my hands like a drug-crazed necromancer to turn them back on.Range of motion detection is pretty good, and the light is very bright though not harsh (more like a warm yellow). Caught them on sale for 50% and regret not buying more!The only real negative I have other than the light won't stay on as long as there's motion would be the sticky pad / mounting. It's terrible for textured walls. If they'd include two holes in the back panel and two small flush head screws, it would make me very, very happy (I'd have them all over the house)
This is the third one of these my wife has purchased. All have broken or stopped working correctly after a few uses. Will never waste money on one of these again.

I can't really tell the difference between this and the Xbox 360 wire controller. By far my favorite controller design (though I still love the Playstation controllers as well). Thankfully, these have come waaaay down in price.If you have a PC and need a controller for certain games, this one seems to be the most compatible.
Excellent for SSD and spindle HDD's. Easy to get in and out of, and swapping drives is hassle-free. USB 3.0 means SSD drives and 7200RPM drives can transfer a ton quickly. No problems at all so far!

I last bought rechargeable batteries more than a decade ago when they were still terrible. The Enloops are like getting a new set of Energizers/Duracells with each recharge. The charger plugs in almost anywhere, the charge time is low, and the batteries last a very long time.

Meh... they are okay as colored pencils go. Almost half of my arrived outside of the box with the "leads" broken completely off. As for coloring... they work. It's Crayola. I've been using them for almost forty years.

What can I say? It's GTA V. I played this on my new Xbox One until the PC version went on sale (far superior in terms of controls, graphics, and of course, mod options).If you want to rob, murder, carjack, fly, and die a lot, this is the game for you. The most important aspect for me is the awesome continued support from Rockstar to keep patching, not to mention the new events that are always happening online.

Bought this with some colored pencils for adult coloring books. Never really paid attention to pencil sharpeners before, but decided I would use a nicer one since I bought some of the more expensive colored pencils. This sharpener doesn't grind the pencils down to half their size while trying to get a good point. The "leads" don't break off, and it's sharp enough to need barely any pressure to do its job.This thing is so inexpensive that I'd recommend it to anyone, even if you're not into colored pencils.
Works like a champ with both SSD and spindle drives. Easily taken apart to get the drives in and out. No problems at all so far.

Been using these and some Crayola pencils on my new hobby: adult coloring books.I'm not a colored pencil snob, so I don't know if these are the best or not, but they are much nicer, smoother, and fill in better than the Crayola pencils. Would recommend to anyone!

This stuff is pretty awesome. I'm guessing everyone knows what it will be used for, so I probably don't have to go into detail about it.Slick, not sticky at all, and lasts a long time. Plus... this is a pretty huge bottle. It maybe isn't 55gal drum awesome, but there's at least 100 "parties" in this bottle! (ie: you don't need a lot to get into some serious fun, so don't waste it!)

I actually dislike the Flyers a lot. However, I am a huge hockey fan, and the ONLY two teams I refuse to own any apparel from are the Rangers and Red Wings.The colors on this hat are vibrant and will hopefully last a long time in the sun. The material feels almost like it is the same as what is used in jerseys. Would recommend this brand/style of hat, regardless of logo.

Caught this on sale for such a low price I wondered at first if it was maybe broken or cracked ;).The glass is very thin, but it has a Calgary Flames logo! We use this to store coffee beans that will be used relatively quickly.

Nice little BT speaker. It has decent sound, though of course it can't output at very high volumes because of its size. The little neoprene pad that comes with it is nice and keeps the speaker from moving around.Bluetooth = decent sound, but nothing specialline-in = excellent sound (though again, don't expect this thing to be very loud)battery life = excellent, have used it probably 6+ hours at a time (I plug it in after just to make sure the next time I use it the battery will be fully charged)

Doesn't work on LG G3 even with Amazon app store whatever. I'm guessing that one must own an Amazon Fire HDX or such? This is why I don't buy my apps from Amazon.Works with Google Play version. Too bad for Amazon.
High quality, thick cables. A bit stiff (giggity) but far better quality than pretty much all other USB 3.0 cables.

Noisy little monster that vibrates and rattles unless I place a heavy brick on top of the reservoir.Always wanted one of these.I'm totally cured of that desire now.I'll stick to the ancient art of pouring fresh water for my cats every few hours.
Love it. Instant USB 3.0. Easy installation (download latest drivers instead of using the CD/DVD). No problems at all, just as fast as my native Intel USB 3.0 controllers.
Best bang for the buck for gamers. Would purchase again without question.

It's a big floppy hat with a wide brim and an adjustable cord to fit any head. I'm an old man of 41 and love spending time in the garden but don't really dig the neck burns I get from only wearing a baseball cap. I even had a pretty lady smile at me as she walked her dog by, which means I don't look utterly ridiculous!(disclaimer: I think she was just being nice, like when you see a doddering old man doing something and you sort of smile and laugh inside)

I bought this because a bunch of beach bullies made fun of me for not being able to shatter beer bottles by squeezing them with my hands. My wife grew tired of my crying and complaining about how these mean men always ran me off the beach in shame.Fast forward a week. I accidentally crumpled the door handle on my car as I was getting in to drive to the beach. I left impressions in the steering wheel while I psyched myself up for the coming confrontation. I nearly ripped the interior door handle to shreds getting out of the car.When I arrived at the usual place, the bullies were there, smashing bottles of various thickness with their hands. As I approached, their taunting began immediately. I said nothing, simply grabbing a Corona bottle from the nearest one and turning it into fine silicon powder before any of them could blink.The looks of fear directed at me were priceless, but the soiling of their designer beachwear when I reached down and grabbed a handful of sand then crushed it with so much force that a diamond formed with my enclosed fingers... best feeling ever. Well, almost best. The bullies running away crying tears of shame and terror was of course much more delicious, but that sounds like bragging and as I've learned since I developed this new superhuman power... bragging only makes idiots want to challenge you.Also, yes, compressing sand does not create diamonds. Normally. This Gripmaster is a game changer, however. The laws of physics and chemistry and scientology are out the window now. My hands can now perform feats that only comic book nerds have dreamed of!

Was a bit iffy about this as I'm old, cranky, and view new technology (especially "small" technology haha) as evil or stupid. (Not really, I spent 20 years in high tech fields, but I AM old and cranky and when it comes to my musical instruments, I'm all about the good stuff from the past like my awesome, modded ADA MP-1 rack preamp).Took a few minutes to figure out (most of it trying to figure out how to angle it once I attached it to the bass headstock). Absolutely love this little tuner. Has a good number of settings and works like a champ. Would recommend to anyone!

Bought this for my wife as a scratch-and-dent item. I THINK I might have found the cosmetic imperfection, but not sure (this means I'm very happy with the bass!). I've done a thorough check of the bass at the important areas and all is perfect. One of the knobs is mismatched and was loose (still attached to the post but needed tightened), but included in the package was an extra knob that matches the other three =/. All the normal tools that come with new guitars/basses was included.Opened the box, stretched out the strings a bit, tuned it up, and began to bang away on it. Great bass so far. I really, really like the action and the weight (my wife, on the other hand, feels like there's a 90lb block of wood hanging from her shoulder haha, but I've been playing 20 years and she's been playing for about 11 days).Never owned a Schecter instrument before, but I've always heard good things about them. This was generally rated as one the best buys for sub-$500 basses. Glad I won at this round of roulette! Would definitely purchase a Schecter again in the future.

Bought it as a "scratch & dent" unit for a decent amount off. Box looked like it took a detour through Kabul then Baghdad before arriving. Unit was packed in factory styrofoam and has no damage other than the slight cosmetic damage on the vinyl covering (that was shown in the product picture... SERIOUS KUDOS to whoever put that picture up, I wish more pics of the actual imperfections/damage were put up so cheap shoppers like me wouldn't have to play roulette!).Amp has plenty of power and very nice punch for a 10". Decent tone controls. The onboard tuner really sucks and I'm not sure why as it should be about the easiest thing to get right in any situation (considering I bought a $10 clip-on digital tuner that is actually better than the one built into my Boss GT-8 board). I won't take a star off for the crummy tuner as again, this amp has a really nice sound, and gets as loud as I need it (bought it for my wife and her new bass, I'm playing guitar through a Marshall MG100HDFX head + 1960A cabinet + 2x12 custom Celestion cab).But the best about this amp is that it has an angle bottom and can sit either flat like a typical amp or a floor monitor pointed up. I wish more amps had this feature (then again, I haven't purchased a new amp in almost a decade so maybe they all do now? But I didn't see any other bass amps with this feature during my shopping travels).This isn't an expensive, pro amplifier. It could probably do in a pinch for small gigs as it most definitely is powerful. Glad I purchased it!

These little 4-port externally powered hubs are excellent. Bought one and loved it so much I ended up buying three more + PCI-e USB 3.0 expansion card for an older machine. Paired with the newest flash drives and USB 3.0 portable drives, everything is extremely fast. No problems with these units at all. Would easily buy/recommend them again.

256GB version. Best SSD I've ever used. Would purchase again. My experiences and test speeds are in line with what the top reviewers have discussed.PS this thing seems even tinier than the various other SSD's I've purchased!

Never owned one of these before, never thought I needed one either until the wife told me about the time one of her students quick-charged her phone in Washington D.C. (you know, the high school trip kids get to go on). Bought it as I trust the "Amazon Basics" line of products, and it works like a champ. Charges our LG G3 phones, Sony Walkman mp3 players, and all of our various Kindles. Definitely worth the money!

I want to love this French Press. The carafe itself is stainless, thick, insulated, and cleans easily. Five stars for it.However, the plunger assembly I'd give 1 or 2 stars at most. The top handle unscrews so it can be removed from the hollow, thin cap/cover. This presents a serious problem when trying to get the brace + screen at the bottom to unscrew so they can be cleaned. Not a fan of it at all and now I regret buying this instead of the slightly more expensive one I initially wanted.Still, it makes excellent coffee and it will never shatter like the previous eight or nine glass presses we've gone through (seriously, you accidentally drop a plastic fork on the things in the sink and they shatter like cartoon glass). Wish the lid / press design was better.

Read a ton of reviews and forum posts that praised this card as magical. It is indeed very magical for the price.Intel Quad Q6600 @ stockCorsair 8GB2x80GB RAID-0 + 5TB of storage600w Corsair psuAs you can see, the machine that received this card is a bit older, and has served as our home server for probably 5 or 6 years now. It had a Radeon 4850 512MB in it, and played Eve and some other games decently, but it had too much trouble playing Borderlands 2, Diablo 3, Elite: Dangerous, and Star Citizen. So I saw this for a great price after all the reviews (and bought a Giga Vapour R9 290 for my main rig at the same time) and bought it.Pros:Plays all the games @ 1080 on high (newest games) or ultra (some older titles). Steady 60+ FPS.Doesn't require PCI-e 6/8 pin power connector. Runs off PCI-e slot voltage.Quite a small card. Kind of hard to believe such a small pcb can provide so much oomph in games.Doesn't get hot enough to need a giant blower/fan.Cons:During some intense fights, the fan will spin up and is very noticeable, but it absolutely does NOT sound like a jet engine or how some of the higher-end gfx cards sound when they nearly catch fire.Not so great at 2140/4k. But this is a budget gaming card.If you are looking for a killer budget card that can play all the games (as of April, 2015 at least) and play them well without sacrificing too many graphics options, this is the card for you. EVGA has always made excellent video cards, and their warranty is still decent.

AHMAGHERHD! You know how you had mom's old bundt pan, and just thought it was great? And then you buy a real one like this Nordic Ware Platinum and suddenly you realize you sort of owned a counterfeit pan?Yeah. Us too. First use was amazing compared to the weird things that used to come out of our old pan haha. *ahem* Seriously. I never thought I'd say "quality bundt pan" to anyone in my entire life. I'll be shopping this brand for other pans as we start to get rid of old ones (that have probably 9,000+ loaves of bread or brownies or such somehow molecularly bonded to the metal).

I'm a bit of an audiophile (was in a heavy metal band back in high school / college, have kept up our home theater and such with quality audio products). However, I bought these for a secondary gaming PC, one that we also use to play music when working downstairs. I would not claim these were top-end by any means, but they do get nice and loud without distortion, and the bass isn't too hollow.The biggest factor for me is the control unit. I love the on/off big knob + smaller bass knob. Even better is the mic/heaphone ports in the front.For the money, I've rarely heard speakers I like as much. Would recommend them to anyone who didn't demand the absolute top of the line audio gear.

Too dim to be of any real use other than the absolute darkest of areas. If you just need a guide light but don't need to see where you're actually stepping, these work. Hard to find a nightlight that has just the right amount of light though.
