I found the material presented therein to be extremely edifying but challenging.I highly recommend that you read the book. I will miss reading it, but now will tackle some of Castanedas previous books, which I have not yet read,

I have many points of contention with regard to this book, as indicated by the one-star rating.Firstly, as regards the book's misnomer of a title, "Ekstasy", there is nothing about "ekstasy" or even ecstasy in it apart from a short reference to an OBE or rather NDE experienced by the famous psychologist Carl Gustav Jung in 1944. This was interesting but the concept of ecstasy is hardly an essential or a characteristic feature of the book. Where Black gets the word/spelling "Ekstasy" I don't know.Secondly, the book as a whole is characterized by the author's extreme skepticism about the whole matter of the feasibility of out-of-body experiences. He has an ambiguous attitude towards the subject since he doesn't believe such experiences are possible but was attracted enough to the subject to embark on writing the book.The book is packed with skeptical terms, phrases, expressions and insinuations of disbelief, such as the following:"there is no reliable evidence for life-after-death" (Black is in for a shock/huge surprise when it's his time to go)"often claimed to have the power of out-of-the-body flight""confused out-of-the-body experiences with the mythology of astral travel""the out-of-the body phenomenon, as suspect as phrenology and UFOs""the fact that he (Krippner) even entertained the notion that in an out-of-the-body experience some part of consciousness might really leave the physical self - seemed preposterous""if one entertains the possibility of an energy body" (so he neither believes in life after death nor auras)Black refers throughout the book to numerous examples of persons who were well-known for having frequent OBEs, such as Herotimos of Clazomenae, Carl Gustav Jung and Robert Monroe, founder of the Monroe Institute, who wrote the classic book on the subject, "Journeys out of the body". He even informed us: "There is evidence that the out-of-the-body experience was one of the initiation rites of the Orphic mysteries.He asks Monroe what proof he had that his OBEs were real. "I haven't been looking for proof", he answered. Of course not! That wasn't the point.The irritating thing about this book is that the author discounts all the innumerable accounts of OBEs through the ages, instead focusing on his own subjective doubts about their reality.He regales us with the concept of "autoscopy" - the projection of a consciousness unable to accept responsibility for a particular act, a narcissistic hallucination that denies the power of death" - as though OBEs are simply expressions of mental instability.Black refers, among others, to John White from the Institute of Noetic Sciences, "a think-tank devoted to examining human consciousness". White states that "the planet is getting ready for a great leap forward ... a new species is emerging on the planet".All this is so true, and we are in the midst of this great leap forward and in the "Love Revolution", as Matt Kahn terms it. (But Black is apparently not yet cognizant of these developments or revolutions.)At the end of the book Black admits that he himself had an out-of-body experience (!), though he ends by discounting it. He is split - he "struggles alternately to believe and to disbelieve, unable to do either".I respect his honesty.I found most of the book boring, but I like to finish books I've started, unless I find them unreadable. This book was exquisitely written and for this it absolutely deserves the one star, and it was therefore not unreadable. Also the author's constant provocations kept me awake and reading.Many may appreciate this intellectual treatise on whether or not OBEs exist, though I did not. I have no idea why I was initially under the illusion that this was a book I would enjoy. But it was a disappointment to me, since I'm in no doubt of the existence of OBEs, and have had a few myself. I therefore cannot recommend that you read it, though, as stated, it may be of interest to many.

I find all of Castanedas books unique, fascinating and engrossing, and this one is no exception,We are told about how Carlos met Juan Matus in a bus station in Arizona, and that this was the start of a ten-year apprenticeship.Carlos first learns about the importance of erasing ones personal history since this makes us free from the encumbering thoughts of other people. One can erase personal history by not revealing what one really does, and by leaving everyone who knows one well. A fog will thus be built up around oneself.It is also important to lose self-importance. In another book it is explained that in order to dream we need energy, and self-importance uses much energy, so therefore it is best to rid ourselves of it in order to preserve as much energy as possible.Carlos also learns that death is our eternal companion and our most important adviser, and is always to our left, at an arms length away. Awareness of our impending death helps us to drop the cursed pettiness that belongs to men that live their lives as if death will never tap them.We must take responsibility for all that we do, we must know why we are doing things, no matter what, and then must proceed with our actions without having doubts or remorse about them.Don Juan seems to be able to read Carloss mind and knows about things that happened in his childhood and youth without having been told of them.Carlos tells Don Juan that they are equals, while in actual fact he feels that as a sophisticated university student he is superior to him, who is an Indian. He is dumbfounded when the latter informs him that they are not equals - I am a hunter and a warrior, and you are a pimp.The world is a mysterious place, especially in the twilight. The wind can follow one, make one tired or even kill one. It is looking for Carlos. Carlos learns about being inaccessible. He has previously made himself too available, especially in his relationship with a particular blond girl. One must make sure not to squeeze ones world out of shape, but instead tap lightly, stay for as long as one needs to, and then swiftly move away leaving hardly a mark.A hunter should know the routines of his prey and, most importantly, have no routines oneself. Carlos himself eats lunch every single day at twelve oclock, as Don Juan keeps pointing out.These are but a few of the topics that Don Juan teaches Carlos about. He also learns about becoming accessible to power, experiences a battle of power and learns about a warriors last stand. He learns the gait of power and the tricky art of not-doing.Finally, he learns about the ring of power and meets a dangerous, worthy opponent, a sorceress going by the name of La Catalina.Towards the end Carlos meets Don Genaro, another powerful sorcerer, and he and Don Juan make Carloss car disappear into thin air.Carlos is sent out into the mountains by himself and stops the world. He has a conversation with a coyote who speaks both English and Spanish (!). Carlos sees the lines of the world.We understand that Carlos time with Don Juan has come to an end, since it is time for the latter to leave this world. Carlos sadness is overwhelming, and so is that of the reader.This is an amazing book. The information/knowledge presented is fascinating and absorbing. Castaneda presents the information in great, satisfying detail. The book is well-expressed, though the content is difficult to grasp. (Carlos himself makes no secret of the fact that he finds it nigh impossible to understand Don Juans concepts and methods since the units of his description were alien and incompatible with those of my own.)I am really going to miss reading this authors works when Ive got through them all, but luckily I still have many left to read. The separate reality portrayed in these books is quite different from our daily reality, so it is an amazing journey for the reader to delve into these books and access this other reality, or world.I strongly recommend that you read this mind-expanding book!

This is the first book Ive read by Castaneda in the last many, many years. Im afraid Im not good at reading books in the correct order, and this applies with Castanedas books too. It would perhaps have been easier to begin with his first books.In this book we are instructed, among other things, about the art of stalking and the mastery of intent.We learn about a point of brilliance called the assemblage point on the surface of the luminous ball surrounding our body. When this is moved from its usual position, it brightens up new energy fields, making them perceivable. This perception is known as seeing. Movement of the assemblage point enables perception of an entirely different world. Sorcerers go into that other world to get energy power, solutions to  problems, or to face the unimaginable.Intent is what causes us to perceive. The aim of sorcerers is to reach a state of total awareness.We are given the dramatic story of how the nagual Elias meets Julian, saves his life and takes him as his apprentice. Julian becomes the benefactor of Don Juan.Don Juan accompanies Castaneda on long treks and in particular to a special cave which was created as an instrument to push the apprentice deep into heightened awareness.Don Juan tells about a time years ago when he was kept prisoner by his benefactor, tricked into believing that the house belonged to a monstrous man and that he needed to wear womens clothes in order to escape. Eventually he did manage to do so but kept being pursued by the monstrous man until he realized it was a figment of his imagination (actually, an inorganic being, a formless energy field).Don Juan keeps banging Castaneda on the back, thus enabling him to move his assemblage point and enter a heightened state of awareness, in which state he clearly understands everything. However, later, he may have forgotten not only his understandings, but everything that happened.(Don Juan states at one point that striking Cs back was actually more a trick to trap his attention than a bone fide maneuver to manipulate his perception.)We need to intend the movement of our assemblage point. We want it to reach the place of no pity, which is the site of ruthlessness. When this happens the eyes of the sorcerer begin to shine.Don Juan frequently bursts out laughing when Carlos opens his mouth, just as Don Juans benefactor Julian continually weeps profusely when together with Don Juan (which he does to hide his laughter).We learn about the art of stalking and its four moods  ruthlessness, cunning, patience and sweetness. Stalking is special behaviour  it is secretive, furtive, deceptive behaviour designed to deliver a jolt. And, when you stalk yourself you jolt yourself using your own behaviour in a ruthless, cunning way.You can use the idea of your death to stalk yourself. Death is our challenger  the only worthy opponent we have.I found comprehension of all the presented information to be extremely challenging. Carlos himself found the material challenging/incomprehensible. This is because it is a totally different sort of information than that we are used to understanding with the logical left part of the brain.But the book is well-written, fascinating, engrossing and highly entertaining, and I recommend it highly, although it may be preferable to begin by reading The teachings of Don Juan and the other early books before tackling this one.

A friend lent me this book in Danish, so I read it in that language. It is a collection of selected texts from the work of Byron Katie.I've previously read this author's book "Loving what is" and much appreciated it.It is Katie's view that the world would be transformed for the better, were we all to use the Work - her method of posing ourselves the following four questions whenever we have a problematic thought:1) Is it true?2) Can you really know that it is true?3) How do you react when you believe that thought?4) Who would you be without that thought?When you've asked yourself these questions, try finding opposites to the sentence you wrote/your problematic thought. For example, if your problem is "My husband doesn't listen to me", try saying "My husband listens to me", "I don't listen to myself" and "I don't listen to my husband".Katie's basic premise is that the universe does not make mistakes. This means that whatever happens is what was supposed to happen, what needs to happen. Thus everything that happens to you or anybody else is good, even though your baby dies, your legs get chopped off or everyone in your village is massacred (note , she doesn't use these latter two examples in the book). However, for some Katie's statements are provocative.When a suitcase falls on top of Katie's head when she's sitting in a plane, she says it "felt like a kiss". She continues "How could I know that I needed a bang on the head? Because that was what I got!"Katie tells us that everyone in one's life, everyone one encounters (everybody in the world, actually) is God in disguise, and will show you all you need to see. When you see your partner as God, your work with The Work will be simple.The worst loss you have ever experienced is the greatest gift you can get.All our thoughts are projections. We are the only one here. There are no others here. This world doesn't even exist.The book consists of small extracts from other books, and thus can seem a bit disjointed,  but the extracts all have the same theme of questioning one's thoughts. There were quite a few parts of the book that didn't seem to me to make sense. This may have had to do with the Danish translation, but then again Katie herself writes somewhere in the book that many have told her that some of what she says is nonsense, and she seems to admit that sometimes she talks "nonsense" or what could be construed as such.In the books Katie discusses some of her own problems with her offspring. Now however both her children are doing the Work.I felt good while reading the book because I kept being reminded of how to let go of difficult situations by accepting the reality of things. Katie's work has the same precept as that of David R. Hawkins, among others - to let go of resistance and love everything, accept everything. When you do this, it is possible for healing to occur.I recommend that you read the book - it will help you to manage your life with acceptance and joy.

I received this book free in return for a review.Unfortunately, I hadnt realized that this was a work of fiction, and thus not really my favourite type of read, and I was unable to get through the book.However, I found it to be beautifully written and to be a wonderful romance about a beautiful Indian princess named Damayanti who wishes to learn the secret of enduring love.Great Swan (a female swan) becomes her guru and Princess Damayanti is told that she must study men, and travels with the swans on this quest.She learns that she must let go of the compulsive need to have your existence validated by the man of your dreams She must learn to recognize herself as worthy of a place in the universe independent of any man. Practically all the women I know need to learn this so the book has a valuable lesson for us.We also learn that males seek love within their feminine counterparts instead of the love inside themselves.We are introduced to the various deities, including Brahma, Creator of the Universe, Shakti, the Goddess of Cosmic Love, and Shiva, the Destroyer of the Universe.Damayanti must pass through seven inner gateways in order to learn the secret of enduring love.Though this book was not for me, Im sure it will interest, perhaps even fascinate, those interested in romance, Indian/Vedic deities/culture and spiritual truth, and they will be able to extract much wisdom from it.

I was lent this book by a friend in Danish translation. So please note that if I present any quotes from it, they are my translations from the Danish back to the English and may not quite correspond to the original English version.The book portrays the near-death-experience of a skeptical neurosurgeon who had brushed aside these same experiences as tricks of the brain when recounted to him by his patients. Then he himself is stricken with bacterial meningitis and falls into a coma.First he, Eben, experiences being in pulsating darkness with no words in his head and no awareness of time. He feels like an earthworm buried deep in the earth, surrounded by root-like objects. He doesnt feel human but not like an animal either. He is a lonely point of consciousness in a timeless reddish-brown sea. He feels imprisoned in this underworld. Grotesque animal-like faces appear, yelling and screaming and disappear again. He has no recollection of his former life. The faces appearing from the dark are ugly and threatening. The rhythmic throbbing is like the pulse of an army of troll-like underground workers carrying out some endless monotonous task.There is an unpleasant biological odour. He is close to panic and needs to escape from that place.Then a beautiful creature appears to hm. It radiates a white-golden light which shatters and dissolves the darkness. He hears the most wonderful music imaginable. As the music increases in strength, it extinguishes the monotonous, mechanical throbbing.The light comes closer and closer and within is an opening (perhaps akin to the tunnel in other reported near-death experiences). He begins to move quickly upwards, and moves through the opening to find himself in a completely strange, beautiful world.It is an ineffable experience. It feels like being born.Below him is a green, fertile landscape which reminds him of Earth. It both is the Earth and at the same time isnt. He flies over trees and fields and people. It is an unbelievable dream world.He knows that this place is completely real.Then a beautiful girl appears. They are surrounded by butterflies. The pastel colours of the girls clothing are intensely alive, as are the rest of the surroundings. Her gaze is intensely living, containing all the forms of love we know on Earth but much more exalted than these, and more real and pure.The girl talks to him wordlessly. Her message is:You are loved and highly appreciated and will be for all eternity.You have nothing to fear.You can do no wrong.We are gifted with Ebens ineffable experiences in various chapters interspersed with chapters about how his family reacts to his situation, details of his condition and so on.He sees clouds high above containing glittering, highly developed beings like birds or angels.He experiences God, whom he terms Om.Were also told of Ebens background, how he was an adopted child who eventually regains contact with his birth family.There is much more in this book than I have touched upon. He recovers and comes back to life with the help of his younger son, who calls him back from his coma.The book is divinely and eloquently expressed.The author, as befitting his doctor status and original skeptical attitude on the subject of near-death experiences, makes a point of explaining how his experiences could not possibly have neurological causes.This is a wonderful book and it is praiseworthy that this neurosurgeon was brave enough to pen it  but then again I suppose that he couldnt refrain from doing so. I advise you to read the book.P.S. I see some reviewers state that this book is badly written. I didn't read it in English so this may be so. But in that case, the Danish translation was divinely expressed.

This is by far the best book I've read on the subject. The highly intelligent  author delves much more deeply into all aspects of lucid dreams and dreaming than any of the other authors whose books I've read. I would give the book ten stars if I could.I have learnt that a valuable technique when lucid dreaming is to ask the dream itself for information/help/guidance. You can ask a dream figure to explain dream symbolism or tell what it represents.The author refers constantly to the works of Carlos Castaneda so I will be  re-reading some of these. (I read them many years ago.) Don Juan's advice of looking at our hands in the dream state will stabilize the dream and "renew the power of dreaming".Also, to maintain the lucid dream state you must modulate your emotions.You do not control your lucid dreams but merely direct their focus.There is a strong correlation between lucid dreams and out-of-body experiences. In fact I have difficulty in distinguishing between them, since it turns out that experiences in lucid dreams as in OBEs can be "real", i.e. you can meet with other "real" people in mutual dreams, both people you know and those you don't. OBEs are characterized by the experience of buzzing vibrations. But in both OBEs and lucid dreams you can fly around. I would recommend Robert Monroe's "Journeys out of the body" for a fascinating, comprehensive account of OBEs. Though not a recent book it is the best I have encountered on the subject so far.Apparently, the most common difference between a lucid dream and an OBE involves the lucid dreamer's ability to change the "internally generated" environment experienced, while those having an OBE do not report consciously changing their environment. Also the memory of a long OBE experience seems crystal clear and is easily recalled as opposed to the recalling of a long lucid dream. And those experiencing OBEs report returning to their body.In a lucid dream where the author asked a boy the right way back to a hotel, he receives valuable advice. The boy said "here, any way is the right way".The simplest method to move in lucid dreams is "concentrated focus with intent". Concentrate on the goal as your sole focus then intend yourself there.In lucid dreams you can fly into outer space, past planets. Waggoner sees a planet with rings and four moons. He speculates whether these journeys represent "a movement of inner depth with the wings of the mind".Waggoner's niece dreams of her great grandmother and receives a message for her mother which proves to be significant to the latter. So was this just a dream figure or her actual great grandmother?He finds that he is not always directing the actions of dream figures. One dream figure told him that he was a character in her dream. Some dream figures insist that they are real, and get really offended when the opposite is suggested.You do not create the particulars of your dream, just suggest a general intent.Waggoner relates a plethora of striking, significant and elucidating dreams in the book.He discovers that the unconscious is not chaotic, primitive and archaic. He knows beyond a doubt that the unconscious is "conscious, responsive and alive".The dream space contains various types of dream figures, behaving with varying degrees of awareness. Some appear to "possess the ability to reason,. rRemember, comprehend and perform purposeful actions". When the author says in a dream "All thought-forms disappear" many of the figures do so. In one case those left behind looked at him in disdain as if to say "Can't you tell the difference?"Moving consciously deeper into the unconscious we meet knowledgeable dream figures that may represent fragments of conscious awareness, and the inner Self. When we focus on dream objects and dream figures, we remain involved with the reflections of the self. We need to intentionally focus away from the presented dream environment and toward the presumed awareness behind the dream."Once the lucid dreamer directs questions or intentions to the awareness behind dreaming, he or she creates an opening from which to engage the subliminal or inner Self." The lucid dreamer can then encounter a consciously aware, much larger aspect of Self.The author learnt to ignore the objects and dream figures and simply shout out his requests to the dream, or "inner ego". Responses came.There are guides and guardians in our dreams that offer assistance or support.Staring at an object for a long time will normally "collapse" the dream, and you will wake up.In a lucid dream you can heal yourself in various ways: 1) symbolically and literally entering and manipulating the dream body 2) directing healing intent 3) directing affirmations etc. 4) creating symbolic healing imagery 5) seeking information about the cause or meaning of the illness 6) seeking a dream doctor, medicine, or healing environment. Some techniques are more effective than others.Sometimes light projects from one's hands which can be used to heal the body. In one case warts that were healed in a lucid dream turned black overnight and fell off within ten days.Dream figures may not provide answers about health problems, whereas the awareness behind the dreaming will.Others can also be healed in lucid dreams if they want to be healed. "The lucid dreamer's intent appears to engage a deep source of transpersonal healing energy with surprising effects."Important factors in lucid dream healing include 1) a positive expectation or positive belief about possible success 2) greater "surrendering" to the lucid dream and acceptance of its own intuited information 3) the use of healing techniques one can perform by one's own actions 4) a willingness to call on inner energy.There is a chapter on "forward-looking precognitive" lucid dreams and one on mutual dreaming. The author distinguishes between dual-person-lucid and one-person-lucid mutual dreams. The material presented shows that what happens in lucid dreams is or can be "real" and not just something happening within the mind as often stated. In lucid dreams the author encountered "real" people previously unknown to him who gave him information that turned out to be correct.Additionally, there is a chapter on interacting with the deceased.In Appendix B we are given tips and techniques for achieving lucidity, including Castaneda's finding-your-hands approach, Stephen Laberge's MILD technique, the NAP-TO-LUCIDITY technique and Paul Tholey's critical-mind technique.I usually don't re-read a book unless at least 20 years have passed since the first reading, but this book warrants an immediate re-read since it contains so much valuable information that one might have missed. So now I will be re-reading this one. I highly recommend that you buy this excellent, illuminating, extremely well-written book. Enjoy this wonderful read!

This long-awaited sequel to Zero Limits is an enjoyable, illuminating read, as was the latter book.Joe writes in the same clear, simple style as before, though he is perhaps even more open and honest.He tells us about all sorts of negative things that came up after writing the first book. Among other things, he was being sued for 3 million dollars. Not until he cleaned and cleaned with the four phrases Please forgive me, Im sorry, Thank you, I love you and understood the lesson he was to learn, did the problem go away. Joe had to take full responsibility for the issue. Issues are programmes that need to be deleted.We are given Mornahs Cleansing Prayer. It was she who adapted the traditional Hooponopono practice of healing in a group to healing with yourself.The prayer is as follows:Spirit, Superconscious, please locate the origin of my feelings, thoughts of (fill in the blank with your belief, feeling, or thoughts).Take each and every level, area and aspect of my being to this origin.Analyze it and resolve it perfectly with Gods truth.Come through all generations of time and eternity.Healing every incident and its appendages based on the origin.Please do it according to Gods will until I am at the present,Filled with light and truth.Gods peace and love, forgiveness of myself for my incorrect perceptions.Forgiveness of every person, place, circumstances and events which contributed to this, these feelings and thoughts.This is to be used for clearing bonds. We are to say the prayer four times whenever we want to release something. we have ties to others, and emotion makes them stronger. If we want to release them, we have to release ourselves. To release ourselves, we do Hooponopono, saying the script above.The problem is always in us, not the other person. We need to delete the data in ourselves.Joe discusses differences in the viewpoints of Mornah and Dr. Hew Len.Everything is alive, including tables, chairs, rugs and rooms. Joe himself experienced a guitar he had bought seeming to tell him a song, after which he now talks to his guitars.We are given the Hooponopono Prayer in the Foreword, but in my view there is some confusion as to whether the Hooponopono Prayer or the Cleansing Prayer is best for severing chords and releasing data. practicing Hooponopono is clearing all mental needs and inherited memories so that you hear inspiration when it calls you.Joe helped his mother survive in a critical situation and get out of hospital by means of the method, though he wasnt able to cure her.Theres a chapter on new clearing methods, e.g. the use of blue solar water and visualizing your problem and using the edge of your business card to slice it up. I dont know if it has to be a business card. Cigars can be a clearing tool. But personally I wouldnt begin to smoke them, since I believe that is bad for the lungs. Neither would I follow Hew Lens advice about licking M&Ms!? as a clearing tool. (Is he kidding us?) He also says eating sugar and chocolate can clear data. Well, perhaps, if you really believe it can. I wont use that method either.Theres also a chapter called The big fat lie questioning/discussing whether or not Hew Len really cured all those mental patients as he claimed.Theres a valuable interview with Joe in Appendix C. I found the repetitious Appendix F impossible to get through. For me the most valuable part of the book was Appendix G, Success stories. Reading about other peoples successes with Hooponopono really encourages you to believe in its efficacy and keep on doing it yourself. Personally, I now just use the phrases Thank you and I love you, Hew Len having informed us that this is sufficient. Ive also read somewhere else in quite another context than Hooponopono how beneficial it is to use these phrases. Also Dr. Emoto of water crystal fame has demonstrated the amazing effects on water of positive phrases like I love you and since our body contains such a large percentage of water (at least if we drink enough) this may actually explain how saying the phrase is of such benefit to us.Finally, I thought I had read somewhere that the book contained a chapter that would help us achieve enlightenment, Perhaps I am mistaken and it was some other book. At any rate, I have not found any such chapter, and I have not become enlightened.Nevertheless, I would recommend that you read the book. It makes enjoyable reading and is inspiring and informative.

I love Emmanuel Dagher  he is very loving and a strong healer, and he has written an enchanting little book.Emmanuels definition of a miracle is an experience a person attracts into their life as a direct result of being in alignment with the natural flow of life. He has written this book to help us attain this alignment.Alignment is not about control, nor letting go, but letting be. Emmanuel tells us that alignment entails a lot of trust and requires you to develop and maintain a demeanor of positive energy.Miracles are manifestations of our degree of alignment with the universe.The book is in part divided into five Miracle Foundations  Self-love and acceptance, Releasing attachments, Being present, Circulation and Imagination. Each foundation contains several miracle-attracting processes.I didnt feel ready to do all of the many processes, but have begun to do several. I most appreciated the Miracle Shower, the Smiling Heart, Miracle Love Drops and Cup of Faith and Miracles.The Miracle Shower Miracle Process is about imagining a beautiful golden cloud take shape in the sky above you. You then notice golden-white energy (the energy of miracles) pour out over you, drenching every cell, fibre and molecule of your being. See the golden-white drops massage your mind and completely saturate it with the energy of miracles. Notice that the golden-white energy completely melts away any energy blocks within you that might have prevented you from attracting miracles in your life.The Cup of Faith and Miracles entails finding a colourful cup or mug that makes you feel good. Write the words Faith and Miracles on your cup. For at least 30 days before you take your first drink from your cup set the intention that with each sip you take from the cup your faith in attracting miracles is magnified 1,000 fold. Miracles will surely follow.This is a wonderfully inspiring little book. You will probably need to refer to it regularly in order to remind yourself to keep on doing the processes, or at least those to which you are most attracted. Reading the book and carrying out the processes will greatly improve your mood/raise your vibration. I highly recommend that you read the book and connect with Emmanuels miracle-attracting energy.

This is the most unusual, and perhaps the oldest, book I've read about the astral plane.I found the book somewhat, in fact exceedingly, abstruse, and the author's information about the astral plane differs from that of other authors whose books I have read or dipped into. He concludes that the astral plane is not a place but seems to be one. He states that he was told by someone who should know that the "Astral Plane" is an old term for the "realm of the visual imagination". He declares that "dreams are a function of the Astral Plane".He repeats that the astral plane is a "level of the mind". Inner worlds are thought of as unreal, but this does not mean that no dangers lurk there. We are informed of several doorways we can use to enter the astral plane, something I have not encountered in other books.We are warned about the dangers of using some of these doorways.There are five elemental doorways to the astral plane. To work with these you will need to prepare cards with the various symbols of Ether/Spirit, Air, Fire, Water and Earth. You can choose one of these symbols and visualize it as a doorway in front of you. It all sounds very tricky and hazardous, not to mention unbelievable, but eventually you will be able to pass though this doorway.The author describes some attempts to pass through an Elemental doorway by some of his friends, where they became ill. This is not a procedure that I myself would consider trying out. There is also mention of Guides encountered through entering such a doorway.Also the Trumps of Tarot cards can be used as astral doorways. These doorways produce "lively visions" according to the author.There are chapters about "Qabalistic" and "Oriental" doorways, which I  found difficult.The book includes chapters on hypnosis and the astral, the "hypno-astral experience", the "objective astral", astral entities and an "astral credo".One of the author's subjects had a realistic astral experience under hypnosis where he apparently travelled to the Middle East and later found his experience to fit in with physical reality. I didn't understand how conditions on the astral plane could correspond to physical reality.He distinguishes between the etheric and the astral body, the etheric body being "something you are equipped with in the natural course of things", and which "belongs to the physical plane". In certain circumstances it can be projected out of the physical, and when this happens, "it can carry your consciousness virtually anywhere on the physical plane".For the average person, the astral body is used only on the astral plane, whereas the trained occultist can use it on the physical as well.According to the author you need to build your astral body and this is "explained" in an Appendix. This is the first time that I have heard this postulate, and am not convinced of the veracity of this information.To sum up, I found the book to be filled with sometimes conflicting and confusing information, not clearly explained, and feel inclined to say that I didn't understand a word of the book, though this would be an exaggeration. At any rate, I found it hard reading. On the front cover it is stated that the author's methods are "clear, easy-to-understand" and "safe, simple and effective". But personally I have found no other book on the subject to be as confusing, and the author himself insists that the methods are not "safe" but in fact can be dangerous.So I would not recommend that you read the book, but have given it three stars since some of the information contained is quite interesting, e.g. about the possibility of using Tarot cards etc as astral doorways.

I didnt know there were so many ways to get across the point that we need to row every day. Some good info for the beginner, but if youve been rowing at all, skip this book. Also, STAY AWAY FROM THE KINDLE VERSION which does not format charts and graphs properly on the page.

I weigh in at 300 lbs so this kind of density is pretty much a requirement. However, because I do weigh a lot, this thing pushes back a lot so its not real comfortable. I expected that. The rollers at my physical therapist are much softer but provide very little support (they squash out flat). This one barely compresses at all. Its a little more comfortable than wood; about the same a wooden round coated with memory foam. If youre lightweight you dont need this kind of density, but this will likely last the longest of all of your rollers.Hope this helps.

I use this mat on a carpeted and padded floor so I cannot speak to its comfort on a hard floor at a gym, but it is limited slip and protects me from the dust mites in the carpet. I especially like and recommend the extra size for anyone 6 tall or more. Im 62 and its perfect for me. A tall frame is also a wider frame with longer arms, so the width is appreciated too.Bottom line: very comfortable and a great size for larger people or for those who want the stranger next to them to be a little further away.

A very nicely made leash that is comfortable to use with strong dogs who pull at the leash. You slip your hand through the handle and it wraps comfortably around the back of your hand as you lightly hold the leash. No more straining to grip the leash with your fingers, and the padding makes it comfortable on the back of your wrist. Next step is to train the dog to stop pulling against the leash.The reason I gave it four instead of five stars is that I dont like the hook that attaches to the collar. It is quite heavy (heavier than it needs to be)  and the latch is a bit difficult to pull back. I like to let my dog run with the leash on, but this heavy latch whacks him as he runs.

Petsafe Current Pet FountainThis is a simple yet effective way to prevent stagnant pet water from getting nasty. I suppose its simple enough and even cheaper to buy a water dish, and then clean and refill it daily. But this is simpler as it only needs cleaning once per week. Plus circulating filtered water is fresher and more enticing.Unlike the waterfall type, this unit only circulates the water through a dual filter, but moving water is always better than stagnant so its nearly as good. Some pets like to drink from the waterfall of the other models but mine just drink from the bowl anyway, so this is a simpler, cheaper model that they are perfectly happy with. This one has a smaller pump, too, so its cheaper to run.Easy to clean, assemble and use. You can easily dump the unused portion of a water bottle into the large bowl as you walk by. All but the pump are dishwasher safe and it only needs cleaning once a week. Instructions are clear and detailed, but not always accurate. For instance, they state that the water depth should not go below 2, but there is a clear min marking in the bowl at about 1. My testing showed that it works well down to about  but you wont want to let it get that low.If you are the type of person who forgets to refill the water bowl, the pump in this bowl will remind you; it gets louder as the water gets low turbulence increases, and then it starts sucking air. If you wait too long, though, you'll need to replace the pump.The large easily holds enough water for a couple of large dogs for a day. The medium is good for a few small dogs. I did not try the small.

I wasnt impressed. The crunchy texture was nice but the flavor wasnt great; kind of like the fruit was old. Obviously, older fruit can be used in a product like this since you dont see the fruit, but if too much older fruit is used, you get this flavor (to my tastebuds at least). The ingredient list is simple and natural sounding: Fuji Apples, Raspberries, Fruit Pectin, Apple Juice concentrate, but they get these from the USA, Chile, China, and/or Mexico. What? They couldnt get enough ingredients locally? I dont trust food from China for my dog, let alone my family.
Good product and efficient. Once you get the hang of it, its pretty simple to use effectively every time. Bonus: it works on tomatoes, too!
It works well overall, but tends to loosen on its own. It seems to me that its easier for it to loosen that it is for me to re-tighten it.

As described, this Roller is definately extra firm. It gives a little more than foam lined PVC, but its close. Im 308 pounds so this is perfect for me. If you look like the models they use in exercise equipment pictures, consider something in the medium range. This would likely be too hard for you; unless of course your physical therapist recommends it.This is made in Taiwan and held together well even when I put a bit of torque on it to see if it would break in half. Im well-pleased. By the way, the US firm that has these made backs them well and promises full customer satisfaction. I did not need to call them, so I cannot verify that, but their promise is written and a telephone number is included.

Batteries are tough to buy on Amazon because of fraud and misrepresentation, but when I bought these from Mr Medical I got what I paid for: Silver Oxide batteries with 5 years of shelf life still remaining, and at a reasonable price. I will buy from them again.As for the batteries, everyone knows that real Energizer batteries are great, and these are the real thing.

My first use a bit disappointing. The toner did not stick well to the label and the heat from the laser printer made it a bit difficult to remove the backing. Ill try these in my inkjet next and provide and update, but for those with laser printers, these may not be the best. My laser printer is 13 years old yet still prints fine on standard paper.

So disappointed.Reynolds says these Hefty bags have stronger seals than ZipLock bags so I thought Id test that out.First, the drop test. I filled it half way with water, held it at 3 feet, dropped it on the cement, picked it up, and it was leaking from two places near the seal. The seal did not burst open, but nonetheless, the bag tore slightly near the ends of the seal where the seal was attached to the bag.So much for the drop test. Now for a leak test. I grabbed another bag, filled it halfway with water and turned it upside down. It leaked, this time from the end of the seal. I pulled out another bag and did the same thing and it leaked at both ends of the seal. The next bag, same thing, so I slid the slider off the bag (which is easy to do, by the way) to see if it was interfering with the seal at the end, but the seal leaked the same as the other bags.Other than that dropped bag (which I did not test for leaks first), all bags leaked at the end(s) of the seals, as far as I could tell. The seals leaked slowly (one drip every 2-5 seconds), and only at one or both ends, but enough that it would make a mess if the bag was allowed to lie flat.Their interlocking seal is indeed strong, as they say, but it doesnt matter how strong the seal is if it doesnt hold water, so I dont like these. Ill find some use for them in the garage I suppose, but I wont be using them to hold liquids or other things that need a good seal.Note that this review was of a free product provided for testing on Oct 31, 2015.

Ive never bought chocolates that were this expensive. I figured that there is no way that tiny bonbons could be worth $1.50 ea. Man, was I pleasantly surprised. Only bad part is that I will no longer be truly satisfied with Godiva. These chocolates are amazing! Im not normally a big fan of dark chocolate, but these are totally different. The flavors are balanced for a true chocolate rush and perfect texture without any negative flavors or aftertaste.I highly recommend these as a very special, occasional treat for someone you love (including yourself). They are certainly pricey, but worth every penny.Keep in mind that even though these are very well packaged, it doesnt take much heat to melt fine chocolates, so dont order during warm weather. When I received mine today, the outdoor temp was 72 and they were perfect.

My first one I had trouble with. Im a bit of a fumble-fingered guy with poor manual dexterity, plus I live in Las Vegas, an extremely dusty environment. I followed all the instructions but ended up messing it up. I emailed the company and a new one was in the mail from England the next day, for free! Now THATS a good warranty. So I tried again and this time I laid out a wet paper towel to work on to reduce static. After a few careful attempts I was able to get it on straight and had removed all of the dust particles. These are no more difficult to install than others. In fact they are easier. Im just not good at it. Most others Ive used, including well known name brands, cannot be refitted without damage and dust particles become permanent. Not so with these.The fit is perfect, as are all of their products that Ive bought. I also put two on my D7200 camera (two screens) and one on my D5300 camera. Perfect.I have yet to see a scratch in any of the shields after months of use, plus the minor scratch in the GorillaGlass on the iPhone can no longer be seen with the shield on.The only downside I found is that, like other plastic shields, they are a little more difficult to clean than glass and prints show a little quicker, too. But! These shields are of the best quality of any that Ive used to date, and even though they are more pricey, the quality and excellent warranty make it worth the price.

If you bought a Nikon D7200 then youre probably no dummy and this book will probably not be of much value. Im sorry to say that I wasnt really impressed and am looking into other authors now. It might beat reading the manual that came with the camera, but just barely. The book might work well for others, but Dummies books should probably be relegated to the lower-end models. I was stuck needing more information and this was all I could find at the time (the camera was just released). Now there are a couple of great books out (more expensive, but much more thorough) that you should look at too. Download a sample chapter to see if it reads well for you.
So far this cable is working for charging my wifes old iPad, and I used it to sync an old iPod with no issues. I highly recommend it.

This printer does a great job at what it was intended to do: print color-accurate, bright, borderless photos up to 11x17. But as Epson, HP, Canon, and others all know, the real money comes from ink sales, so they add other features (like scanning, copying, card stock printing, etc) so youll use more ink.Hence, this photo printer is hindered with unnecessary features (like a CD printer. Really?) and marketed as an everyday, all-in-one printer; but photo printers are slower, and photo inks are prohibitively expensive for anything other than what they intended: photos. If youre looking for a general-purpose printer, there are many other models which do more, are cheaper to buy, cheaper to fill, and faster at printing than this one.If you know you want/need a photo printer, this one does a very good job at anything 11x17 or less. Even goes borderless, which is great! The output is every bit as good as any Ive seen from the big machines in stores like Costco, but those precious Claria inks are expensive. Six cartridges will set you back up to $90 (up to $15 ea). Fortunately each color has its own cartridge so you dont need to replace all colors at once when you run out of one; but on average, six cartridges will last just a few months (even when not in use, inkjet ink goes away, usually through automated cleaning cycles that prevent clogging). Plus, photo prints require a lot of ink. Youll probably be happy with the print, but photo paper and ink is so expensive that you wont be saving much, if any, over equal quality store photo machines. Plus, if the store messes up your photo, you dont pay for it. Not so with a home printer; mistakes at home are expensive!Small photo printers like this one are meant for people who want convenience (and/or privacy) in a small footprint, and this one can fulfill than desire. If youre new to digital photography but are pretty sure you will continue to pursue the hobby, this is a good model to use for test prints before sending out for truly great final prints from a professional printer. Or you can use the prints as-is if they meet your quality requirements, and they certainly may in some circumstances.Some reviewers like to regurgitate all the cool features that are already listed on the Amazon site, but I wont bore you with those; but, I would like to mention that it truely printed well and connected easily to my MacBook Pro, iPhone, and iPad Air 2 without going through my network. Networking a printer can be a real pain sometimes, but this one did it all automatically.

Invicta Men's Specialty Analog Display Swiss Quartz Black WatchSuch a disappointment. The only things I like about it are that my left arm can get a daily workout without getting out the dumbbells; and, I like the cool, black finish. My wife hates it but my 27 year old daughter thinks it looks terrific.Pros:--as jewelry, it would pass as a classy watch until someone looks at it closely.--weighty enough to count towards daily exercise--really cool, black color--stainless steel shouldnt rustCons:--the face seems clear and readable in the picture but in average light its tough to see and distinguish the hands or the labels on the little dials; hard to use it as a time piece--the concept of a dial pointing at a day instead of a day showing through a window is rather goofy and difficult to see since it is so small.--same with the date.--the 24 hr clock (center bottom) is supposed to be used as an alternate time zone. It can only be set when the minute hand is between 55 and 5, maybe to prevent accidentally adjusting it with an bump of the button that sets it. That means It can only be bumped 1/6th of the time. I guess thatll keep it right on, eh?--the tachymeter is worthless, but attractive to some people.--the "swiss movement is not. It's really a "swiss parts movement". Not sure what that really means but there are no swiss markings on the watch. No indication of location of manufacturing--the crystal is cheap mineral crystal which is less fragile than sapphire, but much more easily scratched.--warranty is bogus. Requires pre-paid shipping, both ways, plus a fee thats about what it costs to exchange a Seiko movement at a watch shop. It lasts only one year unless you pay for the premium 5-year, which still charges for repair. Doesnt cover the crystal which will likely delegate your watch to the trash within the first year.--heavy, thick, and cumbersome.--the included instruction manual does not cover this model; its totally worthless, Fortunately, they were nice enough to also include a folded up instruction sheet that shows how to set this watch. Peculiar to say the least.--the watch is currently unavailable (17 Oct 15), but when it was, the list price was shown as $600 with a sell price in the low $100s. I got the watch for free for review, but I cannot recommend paying over $100 for it. If youre willing to pay $600, I have some great stock in Florida swamp land you may be interested in.I highly recommend this watch to anyone who likes the looks of it but doesnt mind the weight and bulkiness, and doesnt need an easy to use wristwatch. If you actually need a good watch, look elsewhere. You could take the battery out and the usefulness of this watch would not be diminished.

I love to have access to everything I need to get back to riding after a flat or mechanical problem, but this size might be considered a little overkill. Its amazing how much I can get inside, and its expandable, too. For some, this will just be too big, and if you are trying to save ounces, buy a smaller one. For me its great. The only challenge I have is that my seat post is remotely adjustable and I havent figured out the best way to connect to the seat post without the strap jamming.Construction is top notch with good zippers. My past experience with Topeka bags is that the emblem will likely come off (big deal) and the front strap will come off leaving all support from the seat straps. That said, it will stay in place for a long time without a front, seat post strap.

Convenient with good sound. Lightweight, too. I like using them on my bike rides because long wires from my pack or pocket are always snagging and yanking the bud out of my ear. These eliminate that problem. They hold a charge for more than one, two-hour ride, but I always charge after that. The bluetooth makes good connection regardless of where I put my phone: backpack, front or rear pocket, handlebars. The small extra drain on the phone battery seems to be pretty small.

The quality of the filter is not the same as the original Drinkwell filters Drinkwell Fountain Premium Replacement Filter 3 pack that I had been using. The attachment of the front white filter to the back black filter is not uniform and actually misses in places on these filters so that the two sides can separate. The Drinkwell filters have uniform, firm attachment points. Maybe even more important, these filters just slightly smaller than the Drinkwells so they do not fit snugly to the sides of the slot in the Drinkwell fountain. Consequently the filter floats up and water goes around the filter instead of through it. The Drinkwell filters fit perfectly (as they should!)Yes, this brand is cheaper and I like to save money too, but the more expensive Drinkwell filters are just $2.33 ea. and they work. Spoil your animal(s) with a $50 fountain then put in a cheap, ineffective filter to save 83 every 6 weeks just doesnt make sense. Im going back to the originals.

Overview:This is a review of the router without the optional modem. This router is outstanding. Even if you don't have a super high-speed connection this router could possibly improve your wifi network simply by how well it connects to each device based on its location. The only caveat is that if your network equipment is all old and slow you may not notice enough improvement to justify this kind of power. Regardless of your experience level, if you want/need a new router, I highly recommend this one.Experience levels:1. I thought a router was a woodworking tool...The router in your network takes the data from your ROKU, computer, smart phone, tablet, etc and efficiently connects them together and to the modem. The modem changes the data from your devices to a signal that will travel effectively down a coaxial cable (like Cox cable) or telephone wires (like your old telephone uses). This router could improve your network by talking faster to your devices (assuming your devices are newish and fast) as well as talking louder and listening better than an old router could. You'd be better off asking, or paying, some network guru to install it for you. Although this is a great router, ask the guru first if she/he recommends it.2. I know what a router is but I can't get it to work without my cable company router...Some companies make modem-router combinations so you only need one piece of equipment to to both jobs. That's what most ISP's provide for rental. This isn't one of those. If you want to replace your cable company modem-router, you will need another combo modem-router or a modem for your kind of system (i.e.: cable modem or ADSL modem) plus a router like this one. Even if you've never set up a router you'll probably be able to set this one up. It's fast and relatively uncomplicated. I cannot guarantee you won't have issues hooking it up, but I (and several other reviewers) found it easy and straightforward. Remember to read the instructions and understand that security is actuated by default so your devices won't communicate until you connect them securely (see instructions).3. I'm quite familiar with routers and have set up a number of them on several networks...If your router is old or you have any weak/dead spots in the house then get this router. Even if you don't have a T1 or T3 coming it, you will see improvements. But if you do have a huge data pipe, this router is even more of a boon since it can handle some pretty fast speeds. You'll probably love how quick and easy the initial set up is, then you can delve into the many deep dark secret parts that others should stay away from. The beam forming is quite effective at reducing or eliminating dead spots so you likely won't need a range extender in an average house. Just remember, if the unit comes damaged or non-functional, Amazon is pretty good at replacing it, so don't fret; just return it for a new one.4. I'm an IT expert; it's my job...Sorry. I'm not. I can't help at that level.

Nice scent (Rose, Geranium, Citrus) and it really does work well when you remember to spray before you go. Unfortunately the urge to purge may come after already seated, so it takes some getting used to.If you thought this was just a gimmick, you're wrong. It's probably a little overpriced, and it's not absolutely effective at masking odors, but it does a pretty darn good job (90-99%), and it's definitely more effective than sprays used after the room is already full of noxious fumes.I highly recommend giving it a try to see if it works out well for you, too, and this particular scent is great for the ladies.

Summary:If youre shooting 4K video (or less), or your camera is shooting JPG, not RAW, then this is a great card and I highly recommend it. Its waterproof, X-ray proof, and withstands extreme heat and cold. If, however, you have that "need for speed," I recommend that you put out the extra $14 and step up to the PRO card, or for even more, get one of the larger, 60MB/s Extreme cards.Details:I am an amateur photographer who likes taking night shots of the milky way, daytime sporting events, and shooting stills of birds in flight, using mediocre, not pro, equipment. Im not an expert, but here is my honest opinion:Depending on the the device youre using it in, this could be a 5-star product, but there are two things that must be noted. First, the number on the front is a read speed. That determines how fast the card will dump its data into your computer or other storage device. I has nothing to do with how fast you can load data on it; thats the write speed. And thats where I must caution buyers. The 64, 32, and 16 GB cards have slower write speeds (40MB/s) than the 128 and 256GB cards (60MB/s) (hence the one-star ding). If 40MB/s is fast enough for your equipment and the way you use it, then this is a magnificent card that is well worth your money. Its a great card.Heres a comparison: I have a Nikon D7200 which shoots ~30MB RAW files at up to 6 frames per seconds into the buffer. Once the buffer is full (about 2.5 seconds later), it slows to the speed at which it can write to the storage card. The Extreme PRO (the card I use all the time) will write at up to 90 MB/s but I doubt my D7200 can write to any card that fast. With a full buffer, the D7200 will write to the Extreme PRO at 3 f/s, which is still pretty good, but not 90 MB/s. However, the Extreme 64GB Im reviewing (a 40MB/s card) slows to 2 f/s, just 33% slower. Based on that non-scientific, real-world testing, Id say that the Extreme 128GB or 256GB cards, with their 60MB/s write speeds, might just match the capability of my D7200, but the smaller, slower versions clearly do not. If SanDisk sends me a 128 GB for comparison review, Ill update this to reflect what I discovered.So whats enough capacity? Thats pretty much a personal preference, but just as a comparison: when I format my 64GB card, the camera says I can shoot 1.1K 24-megapixel, 14-bit color, lossless-compressed RAW pictures. If I drop to 6 megapixel, JPEG-basic, I can fire off 32.4K shots. Anyone still remember those 36-frame film rolls?

A perfect solution. These are small... just a little bigger than the bulb inside. They hide under the cabinet and are invisible to anyone taller than 4 ft. Plenty of light for just a few watts of energy. Ive been using these for a long time but one of them failed after 10 years. Too bad theyre getting harder to find and therefore more expensive.

Cups are good and size is good, and its pretty, but something about the lace causes skin irritation. It starts as an itch, but gets worse. Whatever causes the irritation is not readily visible. Maybe its just the fact that its lace instead of a smooth material. Anyway, my wife cannot wear it for more than a short evening out; it is not an all-day bra.

Very lightweight yet it seems pretty sturdy. Ive only been using it for a few weeks, but it seems it will be ok for the long run. Unfortunately my wife likes it, too, so mine is gone and Ill need to order another for me.

The best part of the OXO version (lots of these out there) is the ratcheting handle. Very convenient! But is it worth twice the price? Not for me. But I do love how well it functions, the numbers on the side to help judge depth, and how easy it is to clean.

Im just an amateur (couple of years shooting) so I expected more information would be applicable, but I was disappointed to see that most of the articles were either shills for the advertisers or simple, beginning ideas. The prize-winning photos were less than amateurish; like the judges had little to chose from. The magazine is so thin it takes only 10-15 minutes to read/scan the whole thing. Id be embarrassed to publish this.The subscription was cheap at $5/yr so I wont be canceling on the off chance that something of value will sneak through the editor. Oddly enough they sent two issues at the same time, one of which was the outdated issue from the previous month. I wonder if that was a bonus or if it counted as my first issue. Hmmmm.If youre thinking of subscribing, drop by a library and skim through one first. If youre really new to photography, you might find it of value.
Well made and functions perfectly. No leaks. Looks nice, too. The O-ring looks like it would be easily replaced should it begin to leak. Ill be buying another one for the front yard faucet.

High quality glass and multi-coating makes this a winner. Great lens protection as well as UV light reduction. Some new cameras no longer include UV protection over the sensor, so a UV filter makes good sense. One with good coating, like this one, means internal reflections are minimizes. I only take mine off when shooting stars or the moon.

Larger and more beautiful than my wife expected. It holds in place very well, too. A pleasant surprise. She is so pleased with this one that I ordered 4 more designs yesterday.These are shipped direct from East Asia (I think) so they take a long time to get here. Be patient. They are worth the wait and eliminating a middle-man saves a bundle.

Nice looking brass and easy to install. The break-off locking screw makes the installation more permanent, but I was able to apply enough torque to hold the vacuum breaker in place without breaking off the screw head. That way I can replace it if necessary. Functions perfectly and makes your outside faucets code compliant.

If youre looking for a rather large, heavy, and attractive watch for a really decent price (currently $60) then jump on this quick before the price goes up. It even has a synthetic sapphire crystal which could last longer than that watch if you dont break it.Now for the caveats. The chronograph function is not really; it merely measures seconds and minutes on two small dials that are difficult to read... not a really useful chronograph. The third dial is a 24 hour dial that you can use to tell if ten oclock on the face is AM or PM. About as useful as looking outside. The dial under the bezel can be set to check elapsed time, but the knob that turns it can be easily bumped to make it inaccurate.So if youre thinking that this is a great watch for diving or other sports activities, think again. But if you want a styling watch that gives other the impression that you are a diver or other sportsy kind of guy, then this is a very nice looking, Chinese-made watch. I dont expect the gold ionized stainless steel to last long, so I plan to use this watch only for special occasions.I had to be fair and add the caveats, but bottom line is, I think this is a very nice looking watch, and since watches are now more jewelry than time-keepers, I love this watch. Its not Rolex, but if I had a Rolex my friends would know it was a fake. ;-)

Im pretty impressed with this apron. Its large enough to fit around my abundant girth with strap length to spare, the neck band is adjustable so the apron sets in the proper place, there is a convenient pocket in front, and the material is heavy to last a long time. There are no negatives. If you need a large apron this is an excellent choice.

I was pretty disappointed in this little tape dispenser because failures abound.The good:the color part (mine was blue) was shiny and smooththere is an effective no-slip bottom padThe bad:the weighting is wrong, with more weight in front than back, so pulling off a piece of tape causes the back to raise and the dispenser to slide forward (it kind of hops)the cutter doesn't stay in its slot in the body of the dispenser so I had to bend mine to create a tight fitthe bottom (black) half was not finished nicely like the top; it was scratched and dullthe upper section finish was marred with a black spot that was molded in with the blueA good desk tape dispenser should hold it's ground while you pull tape out, the cutter should stay in place, and it should look nice. This one fails on all three counts. I'm not sure why it was put on the market with all those issues. I won't be using it; had I paid for it, I would return it.

I'm on a no-grain diet and I like salmon so I thought this would be a good choice. I was right. My dad fed some to me one at a time (he's such a pushover!) when it arrived. I'm pretty small (8 lb toy poodle) so the chunks were a little bit big for me, but it turns out that they were not so hard to chew up. I must have eaten at least 50, but I'm not sure since I can only count to 10. I normally don't like dry dog food; I'm not a fan of cereal. I like meat and Nutrish tastes good to me. It's kinda funny though... I pretend I don't like them until my dad feeds them to me one at a time. Works for me!

They are larger than a standard earbud so I cannot recommend them for sports, but if you just want to relax and enjoy some nice tunes with nice fidelity, then these will work well for you. I tested them with rock music from the 70's through the 10's and was NOT disappointed. They fit my ear comfortably and include extra ear pieces for different sized ear canals, plus a little pouch to carry it all. The no-tangle cord really is. I highly recommend them.

I think the modem is good, but I was disappointed that it was so difficult to set up with my carrier, probably due to it being such a new product. It seems to be pretty much identical to another brand that has been selling well on Amazon but it's cheaper. That said, I cannot recommend it to a novice at this time (late Aug 2015). If you need a replacement right now, then the other name brand (Motorol_) might be better since the cable companies have that brand all tested and linked into their systems. But if you're upgrading from something else and can wait a bit, then this one offers nice savings over the other brand.Functionally I can only compare it to modem I rent from the cable company. Both work well with no problems with dropped signals, etc, but the rental is a bit more finicky when it comes to adding new users. Plus, with the TP-Link I no longer need to pay $10/month to rent the other one. If it lasts more than 6 months, I'll be saving money every month.

They sound good but they hurt my ears in less than 30 minutes of use. The plastic headband is way too tight. I tried to bend the headband a little to reduce the tension, but it only moderately improved. Overall I can't say I like them since I cannot use them for long.

I definitely recommend these to any sports shooter who wants to protect their hearing, but if you have someone with you, talk them into getting a set too. Otherwise you'll be the one yelling to talk through their earplugs/muffs that don't have amplification. Before these, I used a set of cheap Winchester amplified Earmuffs and the 3M Pelters are much better.The sound amplifiers in this set work well enough but are cheap and noisy. Not loud-noisy, just background noisy. There is a rushing sound at mid-range and above, kind of like when you turn your amp up all the way without any music on. At normal levels it's not bad, especially for less than $50, and it is functional they're just not premium Bose amplifiers, if you get my drift.They are comfortable and seal well so outside noise is significantly attenuated (rated 21db). The sound of a shotgun or rifle is too significant to be eliminated... it still comes through as loud, just not damaging. How much is 21 db? Sound seems twice as loud for every 10 db, so these will quiet everything to  the original loudness, then amplify only normal sounds when the amp is turned on.Like all earmuffs, they do get hot inside and the plastic that touches your face will likely get sweaty. You'll just need to learn how to deal with it.Even though they are low profile, they can interfere with your cheek weld in some situations, especially when using a shooting bench where you're scrunched over your rifle, but they are still much better than anything I've used before that wasn't low profile.Overall I'd recommend them as a mid-range amplified earmuffs. They are certainly good enough for me to keep in my range bag and use when I go shooting.

Im quite impressed with the quality of this snorkel-mask-fin set, especially for less than $30.The snorkel is not open at the top as were all of my previous pro dive snorkels. What is interesting is that the valve they have on the top really works, quickly and tightly sealing of water if the end is submerged! But even if you get water in the snorkel there is a clearing valve that works quite well. The only concern I have with the clearing valve is that its thin silicone membrane is not well protected from accidental damage.The mask seems to be made of a high quality silicone that molds well to seal various sized faces, from my big mug down to the small face of my 10-year-old granddaughter. The field of view is amazingnearly unobstructed. The glass seems quite strong and durable although I was unwilling to give it a scratch and break test (sorry). That said, my granddaughter used it for about six hours without breaking or scratching it and she is constantly moving and not as careful as most adults.Considering that this product is nearly the same quality as my pro dive mask and snorkel set at 1/4 the price, I do not hesitate to recommend it to anyone who wants a quality dive set at a very reasonable price. If youre going to a Caribbean vacation spot and want something temporary that performs well but you dont want to hastle taking fins, then this set is a great option. Im very pleased.

I used TurboTax for years, but they getting so expensive, charging extra for everything. So I decided to try H&R. I was not disappointed, but I was also not real thrilled that I had to pay extra for state tax software.

My daughter had to watch this for a college class (stupid instructor!). It was raunchy, with filthy language, and it was somewhat difficult to follow but with an interesting plot twist at the end. I don't recommend this movie to anyone with average or higher moral values. But if you're scummy, talk using the "F" bomb in every sentence, and enjoy depravity, you may enjoy it. Then again, you may not understand it.

I got one of these through Amazon Vine more than a year ago and it still works so well that I've replaced the other two seats in the house with the same model. The solid materials and great hinges make this product one to recommend to others.

The design of this is amazing. Water flow tends to linger at the top a little so that the sound of the garbage disposal is substantially silenced. So far the anti-microbial part is also functioning well, but I've only been using it a couple of months. I'm very happy with this as a replacement for the worn out one that came with my disposal.

Works pretty much as expected but would be better if there were some magnets or other attachment for stabilizing the iPad at different angles. The swivel function is what sold me since it makes it so I can use the iPad in portrait mode, too.

The first one I received was faulty, but Amazon took it back and reimbursed me without question. The new one is perfect. It does exactly what it says it does. Charges two batteries independently at a reasonable charge rate (not a trickle, but not so fast it damages the battery) and displays the status of the charge at the same time. I won't regurgitate their description of the product; suffice it to say I am happy with how well it works. As other reviewers have mentioned, this charger works on many batteries by simply using different inserts, and those inserts do not stay in place when removing the battery. That is the only design flaw I have found, but it's such a simple fix I'm rating it down for the inconvenience to the user.
Exactly what I needed. My pump installer made off with my cable since it wasn't needed for my setup. Now that I have the EasyTouch Panel this is necessary for controlling the pump.

Im quite impressed with the quality of this snorkel-mask-fin set, especially for the less than $90, but the fins run small.There was a plastic insert inside the boot that kept the shape of the fin during shipping. It has sharpish edges and is uncomfortable for those who didnt remove it, but once its pulled out the fins were fine, just small. As with a pro dive fin, they are more comfortable with dive booties on, but the rubber is certainly quite usable without. I rated them down a star for not having good sizing info though. I wear a size 11.5 but these (size M/L, 9-12, 41-44) were uncomfortably snug across the ball of my foot. If that info is now included on the site, consider these to be 5-star products.The snorkel is not open at the top as were all of my previous pro dive snorkels. What is interesting is that the valve they have on the top really works, quickly and tightly sealing of water if the end is submerged! But even if you get water in the snorkel there is a clearing valve that works quite well. The only concern I have with the clearing valve is that its thin silicone membrane is not well protected from accidental damage.The mask seems to be made of a high quality silicone that molds well to seal various sized faces, from my big mug down to the small face of my 10-year-old granddaughter. The field of view is amazingnearly unobstructed. The glass seems quite strong and durable although I was unwilling to give it a scratch and break test (sorry). That said, my granddaughter used it for about six hours without breaking or scratching it and she is constantly moving and not as careful as most adults.Considering that this product is nearly the same quality as my pro dive mask, fin, snorkel set at 1/3 the price, I do not hesitate to recommend it to anyone who wants a quality dive set at a very reasonable price. Going to a Caribbean vacation spot and want something temporary that performs well, then this set is a great option. Im very pleased.

I don't know why Under Armour fits different than it did before, but the legs are definitely tighter. I'm a pretty big guy at 6-2, 290, so I expect to buy larger sizes, but the ones I was replacing had more room in the legs than the new ones so I had to go up a size. The legs had a bit more room in the larger size but now the waste band is a bit loose. Bottom line, at least for me, is that this new fit causes the underwear to work down my legs, pulling the top with it, so that I'm constantly readjusting. I'm hoping that as I continue to lose weight these will fit better since I love everything else about them. The last a very long time, the material is moisture wicking, and except for what I perceive as recent changes to the design, they fit well and protect me from chafing. Better than loose-fitting boxers or tighty-whiteys.I like the 9" length, but if your shorts are hiking (short) shorts, the underwear does show at the bottom when sitting.

Review of the Silk'n Soniccleanplus Deep Cleansing DeviceI already own and use a Clairsonic Mia 2, which sells for about twice the price, so I will compare with that.Overall I find that the Silkn is a fine facial cleansing system that is easier and more efficient than a face cloth, which has helped reduce acne breakouts. Compared with the Mia 2, the Silk'n is much more affordable and cleans just as well as the Mia 2, but the Mia 2 has some important convenience factors I find important. You'll find those noted in the Cons section for the Silk'n.If cost is a factor, then the Silkn is a perfectly good alternative to the much more expensive Mia 2. Both units appear to be well made so I do not expect one to last longer that the other; however, this review does not include a test of longevity.Pros:--Battery lasts for over a week of daily use without charge--Helpful timed session (stops automatically)--All cleaning heads work well--Acne has cleared up significantly--Face feels much cleaner and smootherCons:--There is only one timer for entire session on the Silkn. The Mia 2 face brush has four timed intervals to inform user when to switch to the next area on face. It is important to NOT overdo any one area of the skin, so we find this to be more than just convenient.--The Silkn has one button that must be pressed repeatedly to cycle through to the desired speed/pattern, whereas the Mia 2 has separate buttons for speed or pattern of vibration. This makes selection quicker and easier on the Mia.--The Silkn charger stand is more cumbersome than the Mia 2 charging system. The stand is nice for convenient charging and storage of the cleaner, but it takes up quite a bit of room on the sink or in a drawer whereas the Mia 2 has a small, magnetically attached charger that takes up very little room in a drawer, leaving the sink clear.--The Silkn does not come with a travel case so the wet brush is exposed to debris when set in a drawer or cosmetic bag. The Mia 2 comes with a small, convenient case molded to the shape of the cleaner.If I had to chose between the two, it would come down to how important I find the added features of the Mia 2. If you don't mind spending the extra $$$ then the Mia 2 is the better choice. If you just want a fine cleansing system and don't mind the bulky charging stand, then the Silk'n is more economical and cleans just as well.
