Targus Versa Type Pivoting Hard Shell KeyboardThis case is an excellent choice for anyone with a need for a case with a built-in keyboard, if you don't mind the added weight and bulkiness.The fit for the iPad Air and Air 2 is virtually perfect. With a unique padding in the lid, both kinds of iPads fit firmly in place, even though they are different thicknesses.It seems well made and has a rechargeable battery for the Bluetooth keyboard. The pivot bracket holds an Air 2 firmly enough so that even at a backwards lean of 45 the unit is stable and there is not a hint of slippage. The Air, however, is a bit heavier and needs to be positioned closer to vertical to remain stable. The case is designed with cutouts at the appropriate locations so that all functions are easily accessible yet protected from accidental activation. The case will also activate the iPads automatic shut off when closed but the keyboards Bluetooth must be shut off manually.The case is made of a rigid plastic so popping the iPad in and out is possible but not practical. The surface is rubberized for a good grip, and there are built-in, non-obtrusive rubber feet in the bottom to keep things from slipping as you type. Even though it is bulky, it still has a nice look to it. The pivot hinge keeps the case closed well so a latch is not necessary. Opening is easy.The keyboard is quite a bit smaller than a standard one but I'm getting used to it.Bluetooth setup was quite easy and straightforward.I didnt do a drop test since I was unwilling to sacrifice my new iPad. However I will update this post if I have any problems with the case or keyboard within the next year.
Certainly not as good as I was led to believe, but still an informative book. Great for beginners but amateurs already know most of the material.

Easy to install and setup. Display is clear. Back-light can be set up to stay on all night so it doubles as a low-energy nightlight. Functionally, it has several options and the built-in sunrise-sunset calendar option is perfect. Even though this switch is capable of much more, it perfectly runs a low wattage LED bulb which make energy usage minimal while making night safety and convenience maximum.

If you have a gigabit ISP connection, and still use Cat5 ethernet, then you may appreciate this modem. As a wired DSL modem you can connect at 1 gigabit to one device. However, if you have are using the Wi-Fi connections for your devices, the speed goes down. That said, If you have a slower connection (like many of us still do) then this unit is fast enough for most uses. Unfortunately I was unable to test streaming from two devices, but from one it works fine.Setting up a modem with an ISP is not always straightforward and simple. In fact, this modem is incompatible with some ISPs, so its up to the consumer to find out FIRST if this will work with their ISP, and if their ISP is willing to give out the information necessary to make the connection. If you are experienced with DSL/Modem set up, and you have the information you need, then this unit could work out well for you. But since having trouble connecting-up is common (albeit not universal) I would hesitate recommending buying from a company with foreign technical support with employees who are difficult to understand. Free US tech support definitely has it's advantages, if you speak english.I had some problems setting up the router and tech support was of no value to me. Before I was finished, I deduced that I needed additional information from Century Link. Century Link provided the information and I was able to get everything up and running, no thanks to a tech support with English as a second language.

These are decent glasses, but not refined like Oakleys. Understandable considering the cost difference. If you need eye protection in the sun these are certainly a great option; especially since they are polarized. The lenses are not too dark so detail of your work is not obscured, however, some people with sensitive eyes may want more sun protection (darker lenses). Personally I prefer amber lenses for shooting since blue-blockers provide great detail. I find these to be a good addition for my range bag just in case I have a guest shooter along who forgets to bring protective eyewear.

I have a 2 yr old toy poodle and a 13 yr old shitzu, both males. The Shitzu will eat these, sometimes, when he's hungry and nothing else is available. However, my poodle likes them a lot more and will steal the Shitzu's Greenie if he has a chance. Both of these dogs are picky eaters who want something different to eat every day, so it doesn't surprise me that even the poodle tires of them in a couple of days. But, a couple of days later he likes them again.As far as dental effectiveness, I suppose they are working. My poodle has atrocious breath most of the time, but after a Greenie it's better.My wife wants me to mention that the Greenies have not stained our light-colored carpet.
Crude. Good twist ending but somewhat predictable. I cannot recommend this to anyone sensitive to foul language and gratuitous violence.

This is my first impression over a short review time of 30 days so reliability of this product cannot be assessed ATT.The Amped Wireless High Power 800mW AC1750 Wi-Fi Router is an excellent router with great range, but it is not the best for every situation. If you need to upgrade to increase your coverage, then this surely is a reasonable option, but if you want to increase speed, make sure its your router that is the bottleneck. I could be that your modem (cable or DSL) is slow or your ISP connect speed is limited. Also consider that FCC limits on power output can make it necessary to have more than one wireless router (range extender) to effectively cover a large home. In other words, a single wifi router may not be able to provide sufficient range, regardless of make or model.Also, if you have Apple products in your network, consider the Apple Airport Extreme (similar price range) before purchasing this. When compared to an Apple Airport Extreme, the Extreme is easier to set up and use with Apple products, which are designed to work with it directly, and the extreme has slightly better range (probably due to beam forming). Marketing the Amped routers 10,000 sq ft range is a bit misleading since that calculates out to a line-of-sight range, without obstructions, of less than 57 feet. (Not that 57 feet is bad, its just a lot less than 10,000.) Speed for both routers is about the same, even with gigabit Internet service, since the Amped routers advertised 1750 Mbps cannot be crammed down the throat of a 1000 Mbps (1 Gbps) ISP service. If you have 2-gigabit service, then the Amped router could be faster (not tested).If you dont have any Apple products (Mac, iPhone, iPad, Apple TV, etc), then consider the Amped router to be your prime consideration for a fast Internet connection. Most of the features are similar, with some favoring the Amped product, such as four gigabit wired connections on the Amped router vs three on the Extreme. The Extreme will still work in a non-Apple-product environment, but some of its advantages will be lost without Apple products in the network.The Amped router isnt magic, though. Just as with any wireless router, to obtain the best results you must place the router in a central location with the fewest obstructions between the router and the wireless devices you plan to use, and if you want to see the maximum speed gains of this router, you need a really fast Internet service (like 2-gigabit). It doesnt matter how fast your router is if the total load from your many devices (wireless and wired) exceeds your modem or ISPs capability.Of prime consideration for newbies, and even some amateurs, is that the tech support is superb, U.S. based, and free.Personally, Im sticking with the Airport Extreme because I have Apple products and I like their integrated ease of use, performance, and reliability over just about anything, and Im willing to pay for that. If you have no Apple products and need better performance than you have now, make sure your ISP package will support your load and consider buying this Amped router. If you dont understand any of this, consider calling your ISP or Amped tech support to help you figure out what you need before you buy.

I didn't buy this puppy on Amazon.  I got it at a state fair, but this is definitely the one I got (the box matches).We actually got a set of the full sized on and this little one, but I haven't really used the full sized one myself so I'm not going to review that one.The appeal of this, for me, was the whole milk foaming they did on the demo and that it would fit in a mug.  My milk foaming at work, thus far, has involved a lot of shaking in a bottle and then a microwave but BEHOLD!  THE ANSWER!Nope.  Yeah, it foams, but not super well and not with any staying power. So...  get this.  Do.  It's lovely.  But don't get it from this seller.I received it twice.  The first time, when it came dented, missing a cap, and clearly used I sent a very angry email to the seller who DID NOT APOLOGIZE for the disgusting shipment but just sent a matter of fact they'll send another.The second came, also dented and used (with a cap this time and the top wasnt' dirty like the first but the directions clearly say it'll make a clicking sound when you first use it and this click had obviously already happened.)I gave up and didn't bother, ran it through hot hater and spray out a bunch.I have since bought a new one at cvs.  (clicking sound happened).The product is lovely and works well if you use it at least 4 or 5 times a week. As a ninja, I have a lot of weapons that need cleaning in hard to reach places.  With the OXO Good Grips Bottle Brush, I get all those weapons clean effective, which is important, because ninjaing is more of a precision science than an art and the tinest scrap of unexpected dirt or grime and spoil an attack.I also clean my fruit infuser water bottle with it, and it works great for that too.

I really really really wish the lids has a heritage feel as well (like maybe oil rubbed bronze?) and I would have happily paid extra for this, but I'm only using the rings anyway (I've got the sippy cup straw inserts) on a regular basis and I totally intend to paint them.The bottles are wonderful.  the color is superb.  I've started using the ones I don't use as my work drinking glasses (this all started with me wanted a glass bottle for work and I didn't like the actual portable watr bottole options for those prices) as containers for soups and salads and whatever.  Eventually, I'm going to try and phase out most of my plastic stuff for these.  They look so cute in my fridge and on my shelves.  I may get the green an dpurple too an dmix it up.

It's pumping out a good amount of vapor mist andf it came with an extra filter thingy.  I do not like that it says "bottle cap humidifier" right on the bottle and I wish I could turn the light on and off.  I will fix the first issue with my old friends mod podge and glitter (or perhaps art paper, but glitter is so easy).  Nail polish works REALLY well for painting plastic like this too (I painted my mouse and it's been years with no chipping or fading_, FYI.  Also the color, in person, is was more regular light blue and not as aqua as it seems in the photo, which is also a bummer for me, but, again, I will fix that.The bottle it comes with is jut like any plastic bottle you'd buy water with.  You could put this cap on any regular water bottle, I'm pretty sure, and i would still work.  But why would you?It has to be full all or most of the way to work.  Initally, I'd only filled it half way because that's the water I had at my desk and nothing happened.Overall, it's doing what it's supposed to do, which... there you go.

TMI Warning:  This review is going to be graphic, perhaps even, at times, unnecessarily so.  So, if youre squeamish or uncomfortable with your lady parts (or your ladys lady parts), or you can't handle knowing about the purging phase of the female reproductive cycle dont read this review and, also, this product is not for you.  If you cant read about it, you are not ready to dig in, as it were.Okay, graphic time.There are lots of options for lady-time.  There are pads and tampons and non-disposable cups.  All, I suppose have their merits.  Lets discuss them first:Maxi-Pad Pros:  You dont have to put anything inside your body.  Some ladies are big about wanting this, so, if thats you, stop here.Maxi-Pas Cons:  You are basically a drain tube pointed down at all times.  When theres something coming down that tube, do you really want to feel it dripping out?  Ew.  Also, this method carries the biggest risk for accidents, so, dont wear white.  Also and this is important.  Youll attract bears.  Dont go camping.  The bears will smell that delicious pile of gore between your legs and attack.  Bears.  And mosquitos.  And vampires.  Pretty much anything that likes meat of blood will want to eat you.  FYI.  This is true science.  Google it.  Im sure you can find something to support it.  Lastly, sex will be messy.Tampon Pros:  Limited bear attacks (its not a perfect seal  its cotton).  Yay!  And there is usually a string for easy removal (unless you use OB.  I think its OB.  Then you have to go fishing for it.  Which kills the string benefit).  And then theres this plunger type applicator usually.Tampon Cons:  Toxic Shock Syndrome.  I dont even really know what this is, but I dont really want it, do you.  Also, tampons usually have this horrible perfume smell.  Its not protecting you from bears but it will probs keep the vampires at bay because theyll think its gross too.  Most importantly, applying and removing and sometimes just wearing a tampon will have the potential to feel like NAILS ON A CHALKBOARD IN YOUR VAGINA.  (Boys:  You know that feeling when the doctor grabs your tongue with a cotton pad?  Try that inside you.  OMG.  No.)  Seriously, writing about wearing tampons gives me the heebie geebies.  And you have to take it out for sex, so sex is still messy.Reusable Cup (like the Diva Cup) Pros:  ZERO PERCENT CHANCE OF MENSTRUAL PRODUCT CHOICE RELATED BEAR ATTACKS.  And you only buy it the one time.  And most of them have like this little stem for easy removal.Reusable Cup (like the Diva Cup) Cons:  You can sometimes feel that stem thingy.  And, you have to take it out for sex, so sex is still messy.Soft Cup Cons (Im doing cons first so we end on a high note):  You must be comfortable in your own skin.  You will have to stick your fingers inside yourself to place this behind your pubic bone and youll have to reach a finger in to pull it out.  When it comes out, it can be messy  especially if youre new at it; the ounces of blood and bits of gore in the cup may spill on your fingers and into the toilet.  The first few times, youll want to be near a water source.  Like every system, its not perfect; you have to know your body and your flow, and change or clean it at intervals the work with you to prevent leaks.  It is disposable after each cycle, so youll have to buy one or two boxes a year.PROS:  Okay.  Like the Diva Cup, you will be totally safe from bears.  You can camp and hike and fish to your hearts content without any fear of bear attacks.  The seal is airtight.  You can rinse and reuse during your entire cycle, which means really you only need one or maybe two each cycle (sometimes you dont have a place to rinse).  The shelf-life on these puppies in use is WAY longer than tampons and pads.  I might dump mine once a day (user experience may vary).  You will feel cleaner with that air-tight seal.  Most importantly, YOU CAN HAVE SEX WITH IT IN.  Sex.  Regular you-dont-have-your-period non-messy sex.  EVEN ORAL SEX.  Like for YOU.  You dont even have to tell him.  HE WILL NEVER KNOW.  So much sex.  Sex for everyone.  Sex. Sex. Sex. Sex. Sex.  You are welcome.Other Tips:The best way to clean change/clean this puppy out of all the ways is to pop your pants off and sit on the side of a tub with a hand-held shower.  Rinse it into the tub, rinse yourself.  Shake it dry.  Pop it back in.  I HIGHLY recommend this method, especially, before the sex, as it really does prep you best.On sex:  Empty this puppy first.  Yes, you can have sex and yes it will stay in but you know, youre jabbing at it repeatedly so, for the best case scenario, having it empty before you begin is the way to go.In a public restroom, pull it out, dump it, wipe it carefully with toilet paper, pop it back in.  OR, if you can manage a moment of semi-privacy or have a sink in the stall, wrap it in TO so it doesnt drip, go to sink to rinse (if you have to leave stall give yourself a quick TP maxi-pad for the quick-rinse), rinse it out (be nice to strangers, make sure all the gore is down the drain), shake it off, go back to the toilet and pop it back in.ADVANCED MOVE:  With the right wiggle/kegel move, I can actually get this puppy to tip and empty without pulling it out, wipe clean, and go about my business.  This take lots of practice and, ahem, fitness.Overall, I recommend this product with my WHOLE SOUL.  I mean, at least until they give me a way to just vacuum the whole affair out in minutes at home every month without compromising the inner workings of the lady machine.Enjoy your multitudes of clean feeling, sex, and safety from bears.*All facts about bears, vampires etc may or may not be fictional.  Please use your best discretion.
