I sent this back.  Opened it.  WORKED GREAT!  One time.A week later it would not start.  Now, I know I was doing everything right because I'd used it before and stored in it a covered location and and...I decided to call the company for support before just returning or exchanging.  The first person I spoke to said I need to register the warranty and they'd exchange it.  Okay.Called back and talked to a guy who said he'd send me a fedex label and I'd have to get it to Fedex.  There is no pickup option. When I explained I do not have the will, strength, or time to transport this very heavy box to fedex and I'd like to call for a pickup he got very rude.  His tone was condescending as he told me I could pay for pick up or I'd have to figure it out.  I mentioned that I purchased via Amazon and that they would have a pickup option and he snidley said "well, then you should contact amazon and I'll just cancel your warranty."  I wish I could, in this review, convey the tone of this guy.  I don't know that a transcript of his actual word choices would be that damning.I really wanted it just to work or to exchange it.  The reviews were so good.  Even if he'd been more polite in suggesting I use Amazon to exchange instead I probably would have done that.  But, based SOLELY ON THE CUSTOMER SERVICE, I am returning my useless machine instead of exchanging it.  I am now researching other brands to purchase.  Perhaps Toro, since I very much like the other yard and garden machines I have from them.Also, in retrospect, if I was going to buy a Snow Joe I'd but the 620 instead.  It's so much cheaper and exactly the same as this one minus the headlight, which is a bitch to turn on with gloves and doesn't really provide any light greater than what the street offers, so, unless you live in a completely dark rural place, I'd say you don't need the headlight and you're wasting your money if you choose to go the Snow Joe route.  Then again, if you DO live in a completely rural place, chances are your drive is too big too big for this to handle and you need a gas thrower anyway.
This thing was all win with the 9 year old that instructed me my job was to give her bubble wrap for her birthday.  ALL WIN.I am the winner.Me.I won.Thanks!
The mouth is smaller than it seems in the image but overall it's a pretty nice bottle.  Mine can dirty with dust and fingerprints which seems like it would be hard to keep clean.  I've sent it back.
Bought this for a photogrpaher (artistic, obsessed).Scored lots of points.Thisis all win.

My boyfriend's dog is in her final years and I was able to give him this keepsake pawprint as a present (I made it before giving).  I had to redo it a couple of times because the dog was all "WTF lady???," but, in the end, lovely forever keepsake that's HUGE but doesn't weigh a lot.
EVER!  Buy it.  Watch it again and again.  Denny Crane.

I bought this and "The Prestige" at the same time with the intent of a double feature.  I have yet to find time to watch The Prestige, but, I suspect, it will be the better film.  This Illusion in this film, is that is great.  It has all the making of a great movie: the cast is stellar, the cinematography is impeccable, the story is a good one; but it manages just more than mediocrity.Don't buy this movie.  Add it to your Netflix list or watch it when it hits the free section OnDemand, but don't own it.  It isn't great.

I've only had this one day but, so far so good.  It definately seems worth the money.  Additionally, a friend of mine own's an i-home clock radio (which is similar) and I like this one better.  It has two alarms (so you can set a buzzer or radio backup if you forget your ipod or just have two different times a day your alarm goes off!) which is a very nice feature.  The remote doesn't seem to work fine enough.  Also, it's nicer lookign than the i-home.My only complaint, so far, is that the nano adaptor does not fit my nano.  I do nto know if this is because I have a "new" nano, but it should fit or they shoudl offer one that does.

I will not sing my praises.... I agree with all the happy thoughts below!  However, it bothers me that the dock adaptor for the balck nano is white.  And this nano does not work with any of the nano dock adptors other prodcuts offer or those I've tried, which, so far has been three.  I do not know if this is because it's a slightly different shape than the "old" nano.  But I imagine it could be solved if when ipod gives you thier own dock adaptor they just made it black to match!!!  DAMN IT!!Okay.  I'm done.Otherwise, I love love love love my ipod.

Absolutely amazing.  A "must see."  Be prepared to laugh and to cry.  If you have a chance, watch the complete firefly serioes before watching this movie, but the movie survives well on it's own (my friend, who never watched Firefly loved it too and has since borrowed my Firefly collection).

First, this is a really nice and well made bra.  Second, I sent it back for a refund.This athletic bra is beautiful and made of luxurious material.  It is comfortable and has a "quality" feel that lets you know that it will last a long time.  Very good value for the money!  The support isn't heavy, but it is comparable to other bras of this style.  Not for aggressive, high impact exercise, but great for low impact cardio or Pilates or other gentle workouts.  I think it would also make a good swim top.So if it so wonderful, then why did I return it?  Because it is simply not proportioned right for a large busted woman.  It is a common failing of companies that offer plus sized garments that they often don't realize that as a woman;s measurements get larger, her proportions often also change and larger cup sizes are needed to accommodate large busts.  The type of proportions that would fit a woman who is a medium do not always translate to a plus size.  I wear a 42DDD bra size and am a 2X in plus size women's clothing.  I ordered the 3X, hoping that the cup section would fit my bust.  When it came, it was a bit loose on the band but far TOO SMALL in the breast area, resulting in "boob spillage" out the sides and on top.  I was so disappointed because this was such a pretty, nicely made bra, and I SO wanted it to fit well!  But it was not to be, and I ended up sending it back.Return was easy and the seller sent me a return label within minutes of my refund request.  Postage was required and it cost me almost $3.00 to mail it back, so my net refund was a bit less than I paid.  However, I figure that if I had driven into town to try on bras, I would have spent that much in gas so I don't feel out the postage and am happy with the service I received.  If the bra had been defective, I would have expected the seller to pay return shipping but as it is, I think it was a fair arrangement.So, if you are a woman who's cup size is DD or below, this might be a good choice for you.  I am a 2X and I think a 2X in this bra would have been a perfect fit if my cup size had been a C or D.  But if you cup size is large compared to your overall build, you will not be able to wear this bra.  DDD is TOO LARGE FOR THIS BRA, even if you order a size up.Just for your information, there is a bra on Amazon that fits me perfectly and so if your cup size runs DDD, you might have better luck with the FRUIT OF THE LOOM WOMEN'S 3 PACK BUILT-UP SPORTS BRA.  You can find it on Amazon here:http://amazon.com/gp/product/B005BT2TB8?psc=1&redirect=true&ref_=oh_aui_detailpage_o00_s00The Fruit of the Loom isn't as good of a bra as the NL230, AND it doesn't come in the variety of beautiful colors,  but it is still very nice, it fits well and it is about ' of the price.  I am a 2X and wear a 42 DDD and the Fruit of the Loom fits very well in a size 44.I would have loved for the NL230 to fit my body but unfortunately, a lot of bra designers and manufacturers don't understand that often plus sized women also have large busts.  For women who have an average bust size, AND YOU DON'T NEED LOTS OF SUPPORT, this is a really, REALLY good choice!

As a lifelong night-owl and insomniac, I have found that artificial light at night sets me up for sleeplessness.  So when night falls and I'm not ready to turn in, I wear these glasses until bedtime.  I find myself more relaxed when it is time to go to sleep and it has helped in my crusade to overcome insomnia.As others have pointed out, the lenses aren't top quality, nor do they fit over existing reading glasses.  Items view through these glasses are slightly distorted - not bad, but don't expect to use these for anything intricate.  That doesn't matter to me because  I only want these to block blue light in the hour or so before bedtime.  I can watch some light TV without triggering insomnia, clean my kitchen after dinner, or work a large print crossword puzzle, which is all I really need.  I cannot use these if I want to read a book unless the print is large.So for general relaxing before bedtime, these work great to tell your brain it is time for sleep.  For anything that requires high end lenses or intricate viewing, you should keep looking.  For me, they are excellent.

It is so great to have my own tool box to keep handy for little jobs around the house.  I keep this in my pantry and have filled it with "Pink" tools that signal my husband to look elsewhere for his own tools.  This way, I know that what I need will always be there when I need it.It gets 4 stars instead of 5 because I had envisioned something a bit smaller and because it has a lot of plastic components that might break if used too hard.  I guess the makers had the idea that women won't be doing any "serious" work so they cut some corners.  Frankly, I would rather have paid more and gotten a toolbox that could take whatever was thrown at is.As it is, it is great for light use and needs to be treated with care.
This is a well made and heavy hammer that isn't too large for a simple tool kit.  I keep it handy for quick jobs around the house and it fits well into my Original Pink Tool Box.

I enjoy relaxing in the sun but hate the "squint" that happens, even if my eyes are closed.  These Sunnies are perfect - protecting my eyes in such a way that I don't end up with "sunglass" tan lines.  These are handy, effective and inexpensive.  I love them!

I orderred brown because lighter shades are rare when it comes to mascara and eyebrow pencils.  This is OK, but a bit too dark for my coloring.  It is really easy to apply more than you need, so if you are lighter complected then you might be happier with a blonde shade if you can find it.The little eyebrow  brush on the lid is a bit difficult to use because the lid is pretty small and awkward when it is off  the pencil, and it swivels around when it is on.  I'd rather just have a stand-alone brush, but this will do in a pinch.For darker complexions this is fine.  If you are fair or gray, keep looking.

Let's face it. Chocolate, all by itself is bitter. And Stevia is super sweet and also bitter. So the combination of these two ingredients creates an intense DARK CHOCOLATE that is very bitter-sweet. Not a product for beginners, but very good for those who are accustomed to and appreciate the bitter notes of true chocolate and the super bittersweet flavor of stevia.Chocolate has the potential to be a healthy superfood when it is consumed correctly - meaning that sugar and milk are not a part of the mix. When chocolate candy is created, sugar and milk are added to tone down the bitterness of the chocolate. But when people struggle with health issues, sugar is sometimes not an option, and often milk is also not an option. Furthermore, milk negates the health benefits of chocolate. According to the University of Michigan Health System, "Milk binds to antioxidants in chocolate making them unavailable; therefore, milk chocolate is not a good antioxidant source. To get the benefits of antioxidants, avoid drinking milk with dark chocolate." (I would cite my source but Amazon doesn't allow links in their reviews. Just google the terms, dairy and chocolate antioxidants, and the very first article should be the one I am referring to.) In other words, to get the health benefits of chocolate, you must consume it without sugar and without dairy.I really like the simplicity of the Dante's ingredient list: Chocolate Liqueur, Stevia, Pure Vanilla. 98% Cocoa. And as a diabetic, I am in love with the fact that there is no sugar in the mix. With this kind of list, the bitter taste is impossible to avoid. So - if you hate bitter, then don't try this. But if you like a simple, healthy, exotic and sophisticated dessert, then this might just be right up your alley.You must also understand that this in not a low calorie food. Even without sugar, there are still 260 calories per 45 gram bar AND 12 grams of carbohydrate. Most of the calories in the Dante bar come from chocolate's high quality fat. Compare to a Hershey's Special Dark Chocolate bar which is 190 calories per 41 gram bar and 25 grams of carbohydrate (the carbs are mostly from sugar). This isn't about low calorie, low fat or low carb. It is about the health benefits of pure chocolate and NO dairy or sugar - which is great news for diabetics who are open to new taste sensations. I think people often lose weight when using such foods because it is intense and you cannot eat much at all.  A very little bit is satisfying and goes a long way.  This stevia sweetened chocolate is SO intense that you might not be able to eat more than one tiny square at a time. This is where you will save on calories, fat and carbs - this chocolate is so satisfying that you will eat less and your cravings will be satisfied to the extent that binging will become a thing of the past. Or if straight chocolate is too much for you, then you can grate it and sprinkle it on top of a whipped coconut cream mousse for a touch of chocolatey flavor without the dairy and sugar. There are lots of things you can do with this, but be aware that this will NEVER taste anything remotely like a Hershey's candy bar. Do not buy this thinking you will be able to make that switch because the two do not really compare. It is better to realize that the bitterness inherent in both the chocolate and the stevia is to be appreciated and not avoided. If you can come to terms with that, you might end up being one of those people who LOVE Dante's Stevia Chocolate. If not, you will hate it.So - I am giving the 5 stars because it is sugar and dairy free and the chocolate used is organic and non-GMO. For a simple, nutrient rich, sugar free chocolate rush - I think the Dante is wonderful! However I am a long time Stevia user and am used to the taste of stevia. And, my husband and I are both used to eating 100% UNSWEETENED chocolate and we weren't surprised at the bitterness. As long as you understand what it is and what it is not, I think you might like it, too!Nutrition Facts:Serving Size - 1 barServings per container - 1Calories 260Calories from fat - 210 (remember that chocolate fat (cocoa butter) is a super healthy fat)Total Fat - 24 gramsSaturated Fat - 14 gramsTrans Fat - 0 gramsCholesterol - 0 gramssodium - 0 gramsTotal Carbohydrate - 12 gramsDietary Fiber - 7 gramsSugars - 0 gramsProtein - 7 grams

In the preface of JOY, Abigail Santamaria tells of an incident that occurred during her preliminary research into Joy Davidman's life.  Most of the first hand witnesses to Joy's life were either long dead or in advanced old age, but a few remained to "set the record straight".  One of them was the former Ruth Davidman, the first wife of Howard Davidman, Joy's brother.  At first, Ruth was hesitant to be interviewed for this project and was leery to be a part of a book that was determined to "perpetuate the myth".  Santamaria assured her that she only wanted to write a true account of Joy's life and was prepared to be objective and truthful.  This author absolutely lived up to her word and has painted a portrait that is credible but not exactly what fans of CS Lewis and Joy Davidman have come to expect.The book starts with Joy's background - her parents and grandparents story of immigration, hardship and poverty in a new country and how they rose from the lowest rung of society to being involved, educated and contributing citizens of this nation.  Then there is the account of Joy's childhood, brilliance and education that prepared her to take a place among the intellectual elite of the early to mid 20th century.  All of this is played out in front of a backdrop of a painful longing and searching that kept her restless and unsatisfied - and it was this searching spirit that drove her life - causing her to start out as an idealistic extremist, only to be disappointed and ultimately disillusioned until she had an unexpected Spiritual encounter that completely altered the course of her life.  The first half of the book was a bit slow moving, but it was interesting and exactly what I expected.  As a southern, Christian, conservative woman, this was a peek into the experience of people whose lives are completely different from anything that I had known, and I enjoyed seeing the inner workings of a culture that is largely unfamiliar to me.  But, it was the last half of the book that left me breathless and my head spinning with the moral dilemmas presented by a woman who was incredibly complex.  I couldn't put it down, and I assure you that the material contained in this book will have you asking yourself, "who is God?", and did Joy really find Him?  I'm not prepared to answer that but I think I'll be pondering this for a long time to come.  I don't know if I ever completely bought into "the myth", but I did expect something more orthodox than what I found here.  As a Christian, the true story challenged many of my deepest presuppositions, and I found myself crying as it played out on the pages of this raw, painfully honest and riveting book.This is a very interesting read.  All of my adult life I have been captivated by CS Lewis's writings and wished to know more about him and his wife.  It isn't what I expected, but I appreciated the courage the author displayed when she told the story of the real Joy.  The popular perception of CS Lewis is a veritable legend in some circles and having the real story "outed" so thoroughly was a major eye opener to me.  So, I'm giving this book 4 stars, because it is well done, but I'm deducting one star because the first half of the book was a little bit tedious.  Even though the the early chapters are somewhat slow moving, I wouldn't advise you to skip them because they lay the foundation for everything that goes on in the second half.  You might have to apply some effort to get through the section covering her early years, but this is an important part of the whole story.  It really is worth making the effort to read in it's entirety.Joy's son, Douglas Gresham has written a memoir of his childhood called, "Lenten Lands: My Childhood With Joy Davidman and C.S. Lewis".  I have ordered it from Amazon to see if his account squares with the story that is told here.  If you're interested, you can get it here:http://amazon.com/gp/product/0025455702?psc=1&redirect=true&ref_=oh_aui_detailpage_o00_s00Since Douglas collaborated on Abigail Santamaria's book, my guess is that it will probably confirm this take on Joy Davidman.  I am looking forward to reading it and when I finish, I'll update this review to reflect what he has to say.If you are someone who needs to have everything neat and understandable, this is going to make you uncomfortable at best and offended at worst.  Famous people who carry a religious banner for others to follow don't always live up to the persona that people project onto them.  I don't think either Jack or Joy ever set out to make themselves into icons of 20th century Christianity - others did that to them.  However a close look will show two people with plenty of baggage, faults and failings.  If you harbor illusions that you don't want shattered, then I advise you to skip this book.  If you can handle a very bumpy and challenging ride then you just might find this to be worth your while.As for me, I intend to re-read all of my CS Lewis books and ask myself the question, "did I really understand what he was saying or was I projecting my own opinions in a way that made me hear what I wanted to hear?"  I think I'll start with A GRIEF OBSERVED.

We have two dogs, one of which eats so fast that he almost chokes during mealtime.  He is a small dog who LOVES to eat, but he doesn't get much food, and is getting fat - even though his portions are half of what our other dog gets!  I hate seeing him longing to be able to eat more, but I know it isn't good for him.  To make matters worse, our other dog is twice his size, is thin and athletic and needs a large amount of food to fuel her fast metabolism.  Her appetite isn't as voracious as his is, and she eats her large meals at a slow, luxurious pace that goes on long after he has scarfed up every morsel in his bowl.  So he has to watch her eat after his food is gone and he longs for more!  I've been thinking of getting some of these slo-bowls for a long time and last week I was browsing in a local pet supply shop and saw these.  I bought them on impulse.  I envisioned my dogs enjoying a longer meal time and was hoping that the little guy would lose weight while stretching the enjoyment of his food for a longer time.I am disappointed in the result and my dogs HATE these bowls.  It does significantly slow down food time, but in my mind I thought that a slower meal would equal extending my dogs' enjoyment of their food.  They both hate these things and when meal time comes, they stare lethargically at their food as if they are dreading the task of trying to eat.  They are completely unable to empty the bowls because the circular design causes the food to endlessly move away from their mouths!  This morning, I watched them eat and after 15 frustrating minutes of not being able to access the food, one of them heaved a big, frustrated sigh and laid down next to the bowl.  He simply gave up and opted to skip breakfast rather than struggle with this thing any more!  I was so sad for him.I think the idea is great, but this particular design is way too difficult for my dogs.  I'll give them some time to adjust and if things get better, I'll come back and change my star rating.  Meanwhile, I'm actively looking for a Slow Feeder that will force them to eat more slowly without being so difficult that they give up and go hungry.The real surprise for me is that my larger dog is a Border Collie who is extremely smart and loves a challenge.  She plays incessantly and enjoys puzzles and mental stimulation.  I really thought she would love this type of bowl, but it only makes her depressed.  I don't mind that they are challenged, but in order for a game to be fun, it at least has to be winnable.  If it isn't the dogs will give up.  Nice try, but this one is a failure in our house!

This review is for the Audible Audio Book version of ALONE WITH MR. DARCY.I am a longtime fan of Elizabeth Klett and find her reading style understandable, entertaining and always first rate. I mostly chose to listen to this story because I knew that this narrator is a wonderful reader who always delivers an enjoyable listening experience. ALONE WITH MR. DARCY is no exception and, once again, she lives up to the caliber of performance that I have come to expect. She is real pleasure to listen to! I am only sorry that this particular book wasn't the best use of her considerable talent.I was offered this audio book for free in exchange for an honest review, and chose to listen to it because I am a fan of the narrator, and also because I love Jane Austin and am on a quest to find JA Fan Fictions that live up to the originals that inspired them. There are a plethora of "spin-off" books that take their inspiration from Jane, but seldom do they live up to the beloved classics that we cannot get enough of. This one is no exception.This book is inspired by PRIDE AND PREJUDICE but doesn't try to recreate the classic story at all. I really liked that the author started the book at Charlotte Lucas's wedding and from that point on, she gives us an original story that deviates from PRIDE AND PREJUDICE so much that it plays out in a completely different way. While the roots of ALONE WITH MR. DARCY are anchored in Jane Austen, Abigail Reynolds takes the liberty of writing an original story that gives the reader a completely new and different ending to the book. I found this to be refreshing. However there were some mistakes in this story that ruined it for me.The biggest issue with ALONE WITH MR. DARCY was that it lacked that certain something that defines Jane Austen's work. There was none of the underlying passion that builds up, so that the reader stays completely engaged without the narrative ever spelling out the more explicit sexual elements that are part of the story. I do realize that there are many people who WANT these things to be spelled out, but many JA fans prefer the understated, clever writing style that results in a balance between the romance and other elements of the story. Jane Austen is not essentially a romance novelist, but a writer whose books are romantic within a context of a well rounded story that develops a number of characters and situations. This is an important distinction for me. ALONE WITH MR. DARCY is a pure, crude, bodice ripping romance novel, and the feel it captures is more correctly defined as Barbara Cartland rather than Jane Austen. If you like that kind of thing, then this is a pretty readable romance, but I prefer Jane's humor, clever dialog, understated passion, insight, satire and well rounded commentary on all elements of society and human relations. Romance enthusiasts will love this book as it is a tidal wave of unrestrained kissing, cuddling, groping and more, so that the characters are in a perpetual state of swooning over each other. True Jane Austen fans will miss the subtle elements that make Jane unique. The characters are familiar only in their names, places and general situations, but they behave in ways that leave the reader wondering where our familiar old friends are!PROCEED WITH CAUTION! SPOILERS AHEAD!This story begins on Charlotte Lucas's Wedding day. Elizabeth Bennett takes a winter day's walk during the party and happens upon a barely conscious Mr. Darcy who has been in an accident just as a winter blizzard is beginning. In order to save their lives, the two of them take shelter in a nearby deserted cottage where they are snowed in for 3 days. This particular plot device felt contrived to me - a way to get them alone in a compromised situation and let the sparks fly without Elizabeth deliberately allowing this kind of intimacy. You can imagine what transpires during these 3 days and when it is over, Elizabeth's reputation is ruined in a way that ONLY marriage can repair. I found myself rolling my eyes during this portion of the book, as it is a very unlikely situation and felt pretty manipulative. But that was just the beginning of this book's shortcomings.One particular thing that grated on me was that it is a lightweight read that tries to tackle some pretty heavyweight subject matter and fails miserably. Early in the book, one of the characters from the original PRIDE AND PREJUDICE is publicly gang raped in a tavern by a bunch of officers. This is pure GRATUITOUS sex and violence at it's worst. Darcy and Elizabeth accidentally walk into the tavern and witness this terrible scene and (even though the girl who is being destroyed is supposedly a friend of Elizabeth's), they do nothing to intervene. Instead, they avoid the situation and leave quietly because they fear that taking a stand would be dangerous to them. As they go on their merry way, they barely seem to be bothered by what they just saw and a few days later, when the terrible event is gossiped all over town, Elizabeth reacts with a vague "oh dear, poor Mariah Lucas, but ins't Darcy HOT!" In really good fiction, as in REAL LIFE, witnessing a close friend being gang raped would have devastated any normal woman. But Elizabeth doesn't seem to be too bothered, which made her come across as a kind of sociopath who I didn't really like at all.Some works of fiction are very serious, and when sensitively rendered, a story can do a lot of good by including things that are difficult to read or watch. The riveting movie, TWO WOMEN is one such work, and the subject of gang rape is treated with the gravity it deserves. When an author chooses to include such a event in a book, play or movie, they are accepting a serious responsibility on how they do it. Such a writer really needs the chops to handle this kind of subject matter and that was sorely lacking here. This particular book is pure fluff and doesn't have the depth needed for this kind of event. It has no place in the central theme of the story and serves no purpose other than a lame attempt by the author to make this book "serious" when this is absolutely lightweight fodder for folks who don't want to think too hard. (There is nothing wrong with lightweight reading, or enjoying a fun read when you want to relax, but scenes such as a gang rape have no place in this kind of sheer storytelling.) I couldn't believe the careless way this was handled and I found myself not respecting this version of Elizabeth Bennet and Fitzwilliam Darcy for leaving this poor innocent virgin to her fate and not helping her. Later on, Darcy paid some "good sport" to marry Mariah, but I couldn't help thinking that this gesture was far too little and far too late when he could have tried to rescue her and did not. The original Elizabeth and Darcy were ethical and courageous and I cannot imagine them engaging in an act of cowardice like this. And between all her swooning and trembling over Darcy, Mariah Lucas's fate seemed to make very little impression on Elizabeth. She was slightly distressed but didn't shed a single tear, didn't lose a moment's sleep over this situation and barely managed a "tsk, tsk" when she thought of it. This alone was enough to put me off of this particular tale.When an author chooses to write a book it is important for them to accurately assess what they are capable of, and from what I saw in this instance, I don't think Abigail Reynolds has the talent or depth to tackle something like this. Honestly, as much as I love Jane Austen, I don't think even she could have pulled off such an event in one of her books. P& P is expertly written, but is not constructed for heavyweight material, and when updates and alternate tales veer into such territory, they do a disservice to the type of story they are constructing. One of the things that made Jane so VERY GOOD at what she did was her understanding of what her type of stories could and couldn't handle. It is to her credit that she didn't go to into places that her stories couldn't support, and Fan Fiction writers would do themselves a favor if they refrained from charging into territory that the Original Author didn't dare to tread.I also didn't think the story had the underlying feel of Jane Austen. As I said before, this might have worked as a Barbara Cartland fan fiction, but it simply didn't live up to PRIDE AND PREJUDICE. Nothing is included about Jane Bennett and Mr. Bingley, Elizabeth loses her wit and strength, and there is a very dumb back story of Mr. Bennett that was jarring. Mr. Darcy comes across as moral but wimpy. I think it would have been preferable for the author to remove all references to Jane Austen's story and written this book as an original romance novel. And I think it would have wise to drop the rape altogether because it really, REALLY didn't belong here. So if you are an enthusiast of the Romance genre, you might like this book. If you are a fan of Jane Austen, you will may or may not finish reading it, and you will feel unsatisfied, because all the things that make Jane Austen unique are gone from ALONE WITH MR. DARCY.

Slow cookers are one of the great inventions of the 20th Century.  You wake up in the morning and spend 10 minutes assembling that night's dinner, and then you can clean the kitchen after breakfast.  5-8 hours later - DINNER is SERVED!!!  :- DThe problem with slow cookers is that the deeper notes of umami flavor that develop when foods are browned gets left out.  It is subtle but it can be the difference between a GREAT dish and a "nothing special" dish.  I have compensated for this by searing foods on a griddle or a skillet before placing them into a slow cooker, but that doubles prep time and adds significantly to clean up.  When pressed for time, I just toss ingredients into the slow cooker raw and accept that the finished product won't be quite as good.So when this Multi Cooker showed up on the Vine I hoped it might be the answer to that dilemma and this didn't disappoint me!  This is a slow cooker / roaster that has the ability to sear food in the same vessel that you cook it in - saving an extra step and seriously simplifying clean up!  It will brown food and when you are ready to switch to slow cooking mode, you just walk away and your dinner cooks itself while you clean up the supper prep area with your breakfast dishes.  Then you are free to spend your day on more rewarding pursuits and there isn't that heavy, ever present "what's for dinner" question weighing on your mind.The removable liner of the Multi Cooker is made of a non-stick metal so that it can be heated up to 450 degrees for browning.  It takes about 15 minutes to preheat the liner to the proper temp.  I like to get it hot enough for a small amount of water to bead up and dance around on the cooking surface - something you wouldn't DARE to do with a slow cooker crock.  (In fact, it isn't even possible to get a slow cooker crock this hot.)  Then you take your meat and sear the outside, sealing in the juices and creating a yummy, rich crust and a small amount of drippings that will be the base of a wonderful sauce.  I FIND THAT WHEN MEAT IS PREPPED THIS WAY, THE RESULTING UMAMI HAS SUCH A RICH, SAVORY FLAVOR THAT IT NEEDS FAR LESS SALT TO SEASON IT.  This is GREAT when you need to reduce your sodium intake.  Once the meat is seared, you can switch to the slow cook mode, season as desired and start the 5-8 hour cooking cycle (depending on the recipe you are using) adding other ingredients in a few hours so that they don't overcook.  When using the searing function, I used a spatter guard to further reduce the chore of cleaning up.I started with a beef arm roast and it turned out delicious, with just the right amount of juice to make nice sauce.  Most of the juices had been sealed in so that the meat wasn't dry and there was that savory, browned umami flavor that is so often missing in ordinary crock pot meals, but with all the tenderness of meat that has been slow cooking at low temps all day long.  About half way into the cooking cycle, I could add potatoes, carrots and onions which cooked to perfection and produced the ultimate traditional roast beef dinner.  Just add salad and you are ready to serve a meal that seems as if you worked all day.  And since the heavy-duty clean up was finished hours earlier, you just have a few dishes to wash and you're done!  The liner pan is removable and easy to clean while the base unit needs a simple wipe-down.  Clean up is easy and uncomplicated.The instruction manual has a small section at the back with several recipes to get you started.  There are soups, stews, and even instructions for cooking deep-dish lasagna!  You can roast meats, such as brisket, pot roast, and cornish game hens.  Theoretically, you could roast a chicken or a duck, but this cooker is more shallow than an average slow cooker, and in order to cook medium to large birds, you will have to cut them up into pieces.  I find that a roasting chicken is too tall for the cooker and you cannot place the lid on if you try to cook it whole.  It is fine if you cut the chicken up, though.  Large birds such as turkey or goose would be far too large, and to cook the bigger birds, you would have to move up to one of the very big roasters.The metal pan insert is coated in a non-stick material.  While this is convenient, non stick surfaces are notoriously toxic and so I called the convenient toll-free number that is included in the owner's manual to find out exactly what this is made of.  The phone was quickly answered by a REAL LIVE PERSON who was polite and helpful.  It was nice to hear that the coating is of a non-toxic ceramic that doesn't have any of the carcinogens that have given non-stick surfaces have a bad reputation.  While I would rather have stainless steel, I am more comfortable knowing that the issues of cancer causing materials have been addressed in this product. I do prefer a lead-free crock or stainless steel.  When used correctly, stainless steel can also be non-stick and I see no good reason to make cooking appliances that in the long run can add toxins that might be carcinogenic to your diet.  But the newer non stick coatings are vastly improved and when I talked to their customer service, I found out that they are addressing this issue, not only with the Multi Cooker, but with their other products as well.  Good for them.There are some negatives to this multi cooker that I think I should mention:1.  While it is an awesome appliance, it is a bit too expensive for what it is.  Even the huge Turkey Roasters sell for about half this price and slow cookers are about one third of what this costs.  If I had to pay for this, I might still buy it, because the searing function is kind of unique.  But I'd have to talk myself into it..2.  No automatic shut off.  This means that you cannot "set it and forget it".  When cooking time is over, you need to be there to prevent burning.  I get around this by using an inexpensive plug timer:http://amazon.com/Woods-50007-Indoor-Digital-Settings/dp/B005WQIDHY/ref=sr_1_4?ie=UTF8&qid=1438190167&sr=8-4&keywords=plug+timer3.  THIS IS A SMALL, SHALLOW COOKER.  IT IS NOT ONE OF THOSE HUGE ROASTERS THAT YOU CAN EXPECT TO MAKE A TURKEY IN.  If you want a very large roaster, you should consider this item instead:http://amazon.com/Oster-Pound-Roaster-Oven-Stainless/dp/B00PKOZKJW/ref=sr_1_3?s=kitchen&ie=UTF8&qid=1438187893&sr=1-3&keywords=electric+turkey+roaster&refinements=p_72%3A1248915011%2Cp_n_feature_keywords_two_browse-bin%3A7801537011While the size is larger than the average Crock Pot, the removable cooking pan itself is quite shallow.  This is because about 1/3 of the depth in the cooker is taken up by a large heating plate that goes directly under the removable cooking pan.  It is this heating plate that makes the searing function possible so it is a matter of sacrificing some depth to gain a much needed function.  This is fine, because the length and width are generous, but the pot itself is shallow.  You cannot cook anything tall in this, and although the owner's manual has a cover photo of a beautifully roasted chicken, the truth is that a normal chicken would be too tall to sit in this cooking pan with the lid on.  I don't know where they got the photo of a roasted whole chicken, but I can assure you that they didn't cook it in this appliance!  This is better suited to two very small chickens or several quail or cornish hens.  Or you could cook a larger bird if you cut it into pieces first.  But forget putting a whole chicken into this cooker - if you do, the lid will not go on top and close properly.  The shallow cooking area makes this a nice choice for casseroles, it isn't appropriate for anything that sits tall.  I took away one star from an otherwise (almost) perfect item because of how shallow the pan is.  It would be awesome if they would include a simple extender ring in the package like you find in air fryers.  Something like this - if you look closely, you will see a stainless steel extender ring between the cooker and the lid that address the problem of depth when cooking a whole bird:http://amazon.com/gp/product/B00QSL89F8?ref_=cm_cr-mr-titleIn the Amazon Vine, we get lots and lots of free products, and to be honest, a too many of them are not very good.  After evaluating and reviewing products, I find that most of the time they end up discarded because I usually don't want to keep them in the long run.  This Black & Decker is an exception to that rule and I am pleased to know that it is one of the rare Vine product that has passed muster and earned space in my busy, overcrowded kitchen.  I LOVE it, and can easily make great use of it in the long term.I highly recommend it for people who love to eat, hate to cook and hate to clean the kitchen!

I loved Alan Rickman and Kate Winslet in SENSE AND SENSIBILITY, and was delighted to find that they were in another project together.  Both of them are very talented and almost always do a great job of acting.  SENSE AND SENSIBILITY was absolutely one of my favorite all-time flicks.This movie was a bit different.  It was watchable and wasn't boring.  The plot was kind of slow moving and a bit forgettable - there was nothing about this story that got me involved with the characters or made me really care what happened.  Defiantly didn't keep me on the edge of my seat or anything.  It isn't my favorite film by a long shot, but I still enjoyed it.  The biggest problem is that the screenplay itself left a lot to be desired.  But everything else was so outstanding that, incredibly, the actual story didn't really matter so much.  It was a pretty good movie simply because of how beautiful it was and how great the acting was.  The soundtrack was nothing special, but appropriate background music for the time and place that this was set in.It wasn't the best mover ever, but as something beautiful and enjoyable to watch while doing other things, it was really nice.  The cinematography was dazzling and I loved all the scenes of gardens and architecture.  The costumes were lush and the acting was first rate.  I loved Stanley Tucci's performance as the King's brother and Alan Rickman is always first rate as an actor.  I found his portrayal of King Louis XIV to be wonderful!  The leads, Kate Winslet and Matthias Schoenaert were understated as the two lovers, and they were somehow outdone by Rickman and Tucci, even though they had the greater share of screen time.The plot is FICTIONAL but very loosely based on historical facts.  Louis X!V was a real person, and the construction of Versailles was a real event.  The Queen of France really did die during these events and the King's actual second wife was referred to in a minor and offhand way.  But the factual events contained in this story are merely a backdrop for a fictional love story.  For the plot to interest me, I would have preferred the story to be more factual and less fictional, but that is just me.  Maybe if the love story had been more compelling, I would have gotten more involved, but as it is, the fiction fell flat while the facts are actually quite intriguing.  I think more could have been made of the story.So, for a mildly enjoyable way to kill some spare time, this is pretty good but it is mostly fluff.  If you are craving some heavy duty stimulating plot to think about, I just don't think you will find it here.

I really hate wasted cabinet space and have often wished I had a "shelf within a shelf" to make use of the empty space above the cups.  The is perfect!  It is stable and strong and is the right size to stack my footed ice cream bowls, custard cups, and coffee cups.  Quite simply an item that doubles the usefulness of my cabinet space.And they come in several sizes so there is one for every situation.  Can't do without them!

I don't eat fried foods, but sometimes I miss that crispy, crunchy food that you get when you fry something to a golden-brown.  So when this showed up on my Amazon Vine queue, I was really excited to try it.Unpacking and assembly was super easy.  There is an owner's manual included and a small cookbook, too.  So you can be up and running without a lot of confusion and hassle.  Also included in the package is a small oil sprayer - although I do have my doubts about this item since my experience is that oil sprayers tend to clog up and they don't last long.  I did have a few questions about things I wasn't sure of and was pleased to find a package insert with a Toll Free number where I could call and get some personalized instruction.  The number led me to a voice mail and I left a message, which was returned by a very helpful person within an hour.I wanted to start out with something simple, so I chose the Pork Spare Ribs from the cookbook, which turned out delicious.  There are a number of tantalizing recipes included in the little book and I look forward to trying most of them.  However, the list of recipes puzzled me because most of them aren't unique to this kind of cooking and could just as easily be make in a Crock Pot.  Actually, I think a Crock Pot, electric skillet, or an oven might be even better for some of these recipes.  My Spare Ribs were yummy, but if they had been slow-cooked, I think they would have turned out more tender.The best use of this type of cooker is to make things crispy.  And that is a challenge because to use the crisping function, you must cook things in a single layer so that the hot air is able to freely circulate around the food.  Since the single-layer cooking space is quite small, you will find yourself with small portions, or you will be hovering over batch after batch until you have cooked the amount that you want.That's because the Aero Fryer is compact.  Actually it is smaller than I expected and that makes it just about right for a family of only 2-4 people.  If you are feeding more people than that, I think this could be a challenge and you will find yourself making things in batches instead of being able to cook a large meal in one batch.  For large gatherings, this will be frustrating to use, and cooking things like fries or onion rings (while they taste fine), can only be done in very small batches because the have to be spread out in a single layer, in a basket that is only 8" in diameter.  You will be lucky to be able to cook more than one potato or onion at a time.  That is a single serving.  So, remember - while you are considering this type of appliance, it doesn't produce a lot of food for the space it takes up.If you are only cooking for one or two people, I think this might work well to reheat things like frozen chicken nuggets, or frozen fries, or frozen onion rings.  The circulating air does a good job of making things hot and crispy.  But if you don't eat this type of diet, you might find this appliance to be redundant, as most of the things you can cook in the AeroFryer can actually be made with other appliances.So, the "pros" of the AeroFryer are that it is simple, and easy to use.  It makes crispy treats if you only want a little bit.  The customer service and product support is excellent.  The clean up is uncomplicated and most of the components are dishwasher safe.  You will have to wipe down the top that has the electric heating element (which is a halogen light bulb), and the base is plastic and should be hand washed.  Everything else goes into the dishwasher and it isn't hard to clean at all.But the "cons" of this device are that the capacity was surprisingly small, even though it takes up considerable counter space.  It makes only small batches of "crispy" type foods, while most of it's other functions can be better served by a crock pot or an oven.My guess is that an item like this would be useful to someone who lives alone, loves fried foods but wants to cut down on fat, and doesn't have an overlapping appliance like a slow cooker.For my purposes, I find other cooking methods to be superior and I don't like the frustration of cooking french fries in such tiny batches.  I don't think I'll get much use from this item but I can see that it would be handy for the right person.

These are awesome jeans!  They are traditional, cowboy type denims with a slightly updated and flattering silhouette that is just right for work or casual wear.  The rise is made for a long torso, so the waist hits a bit higher on the body than most cuts.Nicely made, good quality medium weight denim jeans that are pre-washed and broken in for a soft, comfortable feel.  They fit well in the waist and hips and the cut is relaxed for easy comfort.  The design is a traditional, 5 pocket styling with contrasting flat fell seams and boot cut for a long-wearing, sturdy garment that should give years of use.The labeled 32" inseam is too long right out of the package but will most likely shrink when washed and dried, so I think the length will probably be right after they are laundered.  My husband is 6' tall, and a size 36 x 32.  He has a long torso and shorter legs relative to his rise.  These jeans fit him perfectly in the 36" waist and perfectly in the long-torso rise.  However, even though he normally wears a 32" inseam, these 32" inseams are slightly too long for his legs.  I measured them and they are actually 32" in the inseam.  So I think that the loose cut must make them look and feel longer than what he is used to.There is a single flaw that I might mention just in case fabric content is  important to you.  The Amazon ad states that this garment is 98% cotton and 2% spandex.  However the jeans I received are 100% cotton - which in some people's eyes might be an upgrade.  I do think that all cotton garments wear longer than blends.  I am deducting one star because the ad page information about fabric content is not correct.Otherwise, these are great pants and I highly recommend them!  At the price of $24.99, they are a great deal for the nice quality and give a lot of bang for the buck.

These are awesome bookmarks/subject dividers for a 3 ring binder.  I love that they come in beautiful colors and designs, but think these are more suited to women than to men because the bright colors and pretty designs have a feminine vibe.They serve much the same purpose as the old-fashioned subject dividers, except this design is not a whole page-sized sheet, but a long, narrow divider that has the tab at the top instead of out the side.  I like that they are plastic instead of paper because that makes them sturdier and they won't tear as easily.Included in the package are little stick on labels for the tabs.  You can write anything you want on them OR you can access label templates online so that the tab labels are neatly printed on your inkjet printer.The three loose-leaf holes are not solid, but each of them have an opening so that you can slip the bookmarks on and off the rings without opening the binder - that is why they are called Snap-In.  It is very convenient to be able to reposition them whenever you need to change places.They won't work well with report folders because they depend on the flexibility of a 3 ring loose leaf binder.  When I ordered them, I was envisioning something I could use with a large, expandable folder but after seeing them in person, I quickly realized that the usefulness is strictly limited to the 3 ring loose leaf.  For that application, they are awesome!

I  have really, REALLY problem feet and I've tried everything in an attempt to curb the super dry, thick, cracked skin that builds up and creates a serious health hazard.  When my feet start cracking and bleeding, it is difficult to walk and being a diabetic, this is potentially a serious health threat.  These moisturizing gel toe socks are the best remedy that I have found, and the 5 toe design address all the areas where other remedies have failed.When I was young, I used to use the old "vaseline and cotton socks" treatment, which is almost useless because the cotton soaks up the vaseline and leaves the feet dry.  By morning, I felt as if nothing had been applied to my feet and the cracks and soreness was as bad as usual.There have been foot files, creams, lotions and even corn razors, but the issues with my feet have worsened every year, until at age 60 I have wondered if this might even be life threatening - and those of you with diabetes know what I mean - the threat of sores on the extremities that won't heal gives us the dread of infections, gangrene, and amputation.  This shadow hangs over people with diabetes and so what is merely dry feet to some people becomes a fearful threat to the diabetic.Expensive pedicures can help a little bit, but when my feet are exposed  to too much exfoliation, the outer layer of protective skin is gone and the delicate underlayer of skin is left exposed.  This is relieving and pretty in the short term, but in the long run, this delicate skin dries out even faster, and the ultimate result is that the dryness goes deeper and deeper into the feet.At first it was only my heels that were effected, but eventually the dryness crept up to the sides of my feet and in the past few years I have been battling cracks and bleeding in my toes.I asked my primary care physician what I could do about this, and I don't think that she understood at all how serious the issue was.  She suggested lotion, which was like putting out a forest fire with a water pistol.I went to a podiatrist who spent 5 minutes looking at my feet, wrote a prescription for an ineffective product, told me to get more pedicures and went on the the next patient.  It was a waste of $150.00.Gel socks have been great but most of them have design flaws that make me wish more thought had been put into what dry, cracked feet really need.  My first pair of gel socks were purchased on Amazon:http://amazon.com/gp/product/B001K1IYRO?psc=1&redirect=true&ref_=oh_aui_search_detailpageThe above socks are great quality, but the gel is too thick and the material is too thick.  During the night, the gel would close around my feet like shrink wrap and I would wake up in a strangling vise that gave my feet terrible cramps.  I found myself ripping them  off to relieve the pain.  Too, TOO much!Another try was the gel heel socks:http://amazon.com/Oppo-Gel-Heel-Socks-6790/dp/B0028PY27C/ref=sr_1_7?s=beauty&ie=UTF8&qid=1437536448&sr=1-7&keywords=gel+heel+socksThe gel heel socks fine for heels, but there is no protection for the toes, and the socks themselves are unstable enough that they move around in the night and I often wake up with the gel on top of my feet and my poor cracked heels are left unprotected, dry and painful.Then there are the gel toe socks:http://amazon.com/FootSmart-Gel-Lined-Compression-Separating-Socks/dp/B005CW2Y28/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1437536648&sr=8-1&keywords=gel+toe+socksThese are fine for mid-toes, but the heels are left out and the tips of the toes stay exposed.In my mind's eye, I always envisioned a soft bootie, with 5 toes - ENTIRELY COATED ON THE INSIDE WITH GEL.  But I couldn't find it until now.I must admit that the price of these booties made me pause momentarily, but I was desperate for a real solution to a very serious problem.  So I sprung for 3 pairs.  The first night, I was able to sleep all night in these soft, stretchy socks that have a complete coating of gel in every single toe as well as the whole foot.  The gel in these socks still has a tendency to "shrink wrap" my feet in the night, but because the gel coating is light, the socks are soft and stretchy and the separated toes keep the feet in an anatomically sound position, I don't wake up in excruciating pain.  My feet feel a little bit hot at night, but the relief from dry, cracked, bleeding feet is worth this minor discomfort.  The separated toes also anchor the booties in the correct position, so there is no shifting or falling off in the night.Each night, I put a heavy moisturizer in my feet - usually a Shea butter based cream.  Then I put on the gel socks and sleep in them all night.  From the very first morning, I have wakened with soft, smooth, moisturized feet, and each subsequent day the cracks, flakes and dryness had improved dramatically.  In less than a week, I have managed to reverse a terrible problem and have even been able to wear some pretty sandals during the day.  In conjunction with some mild exfoliation, I have found these gel booties to be a real lifesaver - and I do mean that literally.  The protective outer layer of skin stays intact, soft and supple and my feet have stopped cracking and bleeding.  What a relief!The  Natra Cure 5-Toe Moisturizing Gel Socks have addressed every single problem and given me a cure for an issue that threatened my health in ways that people without diabetes probably don't understand.  I really love these and they were worth every single cent I spent on them.  And I intend to add several more pairs to my collection so that I always have a clean pair to wear to bed.Very highly recommended for anyone who suffers from dry feet, but especially for those who have a serious health threatening condition of cracked, bleeding feet!  So Great!

This paper shredder is fast, quiet and easily moves from place to place on smooth rolling wheels.  I really like that it will take on 12 sheets at a time, and will also dispatch CDs, credit cards and staples.It is quite large - about 50% larger than my current, medium-duty shredder that will shred only 10 sheets at a time.  For an ordinary household, the Sentinel is probably overkill, and if your shredding needs are small to moderate, then it will probably be a good idea to pay attention to the dimensions (stated in the ad) and consider whether the extra work it will do is worth the extra space it will take up.  But if you are in a small business where a lot of paperwork is generated and shredding needs are high, the Sentinal could easily pull it's weight and earn whatever space it takes up.I was disappointed in the paper feed, which I found slightly awkward at first, but I got the hang of it quickly.  However a bigger concern for me was that the paper feed is a little bit narrower than what I am used to and will only accept standard paper that Is 9.5" wide.  So if you have occasions when you need to shred something that isn't exactly standard size, you will be out of luck.  It just so happened that the very first thing I tried to shred was somewhat wider than standard and I had a very hard time getting it to go through.  But since the vast majority of papers that people need to shred are standard 9.5 x 11 or 14 pages this might not be a problem most of the time.  However, I was surprised at this design flaw because my old shredder, which isn't nearly as fancy is very flexible in the feed chute and takes pages of many sizes.  I didn't think it was necessary to design this kind of restriction into the Sentinel, and I actually like my old one a little bit better for this reason.The final product is a fine shred, something like confetti, and from a privacy and security standpoint this will definitely do the trick.  The finely cut shreds would be impossible to read and the Sentinal outperforms my old shredder in this feature.So, if you need a shredder for ordinary household tasks, I think you might be happier with something smaller, less expensive and not quite so fancy.  But if you have a small business that generates a lot of standard sized paper to dispose of, the Sentinel might be perfect for your situation.

This little tool set is nothing special, but it is very practical, space efficient and useful for small around-the-house jobs.  They appear to be well made, but the ultimate determination of that is how well they perform in the long run.  I have written many favorable reviews for small tools of this type, only to have them fall apart within a year.  So for now, I am going to say that they are great.  In a year, I'll come back and update.I like that they are compact and that the necessary tools fold out for use and fold in for storage.  The little plier multi-tool reminds me of a Swiss Army Knife, and it actually does have a couple of different kinds of knives included in the multitude of tools folded into the handles.  The larger folding knife is just that - a folding knife and nothing else.In addition the the small, needle nosed pliers shown in the ad photo, you will also find (folded into the handles) a small pocket knife, a very VERY small flathead screwdriver and a very, VERY small phillips head screwdriver, and bottle opener.  The other handle holds a little saw (or small serrated knife - whichever you prefer to call it), a nail file, a very tiny folding knife, and a slightly larger flathead screwdriver.It would be great for a small household toolbox that you might want to keep lean and orderly, but I think most people already have these functions covered at home.  An even better place for something like this would be the glovebox of your car, because at home you probably have other tools of this type that are more suited to your tool-box.  This is best as an on-the-go emergency tool kit.  They will do a multitude of small jobs in a pinch but don't count on these if you have major work to do.The fold in components are easy to open and close and so this is a convenient device to have and use.  The biggest negative is that it comes in one of those clamshells that put you in danger of experiencing "wrap rage" when trying to open it for the first time.  Because of this, and because it is slightly overpriced compared to similar tools I have seen at Ace Hardware, I am giving this 4 stars instead of 5 stars.  To be updated at a later date depending on how it performs in the long term.....

I think that for a review to be truly helpful, it pays to know something about the person who is evaluating a product.  So (for what it's worth) here is my experience level with tea:  Novice.For years, I was a coffee drinker and didn't like tea, but after developing health issues related to coffee, I made the switch to a morning cup of tea instead of my morning cup of joe.  I am a night owl and so living on a "normal" schedule is a challenge for me.  I drink tea for it's medicinal qualities and for the caffeine boost and if it also tastes good, that is a plus.  My regular morning dose is Guayaki Greener Tea, which is a blend of Yerba Mate and Green Tea.  Unlike other people, I like my teas strong and bitter, so I use a lot and steep it long enough to develop a noticeable bitter flavor - usually 20-30 minutes.  This preference is probably because I switched from coffee and am used to something strong and hearty.  If  I drink black tea, it is usually Newman's Own Organics Royal Black Tea.  If I am traveling or in a "pinch", Lipton's will do - just for the caffeine, but I don't like Lipton Tea (because it is not organic, bland and flavorless) and so I avoid it if I can.Having said that, before reviewing this tea, I made an effort to educate myself about what a "quality" tea is supposed to be like and carefully brewed this tea according to instructions.  Here is what I found:When I first opened the package, I noticed the lovely smell - almost like flowers or fruit.  The color of the dried leaves is a deep greenish-brown; almost black.  For those of you who think it is important that dried tea leaves be a uniform size and shape, you will be disappointed to know that this Breakfast Tea has very uneven sizes - many broken leaves that are so tiny that they are almost powdery, and many full sized curled leaves, and everything in between.While heating my water, I put 2 teaspoons of tea in a small, 12 oz teapot.  As per package directions, I steeped my first cup for 3.5 minutes and then strained the liquid into a mug.  I tried my first few drinks plain with no sweeteners or milk or cream and found the taste to be pleasant - no bitterness at all - but with a strong enough flavor to be satisfying, even to someone like myself who is used to over-brewed bitter tea.  It compared well to Newman's Own and was much better than Lipton's.  The color was a beautiful dark amber with a touch of red, making it seem exotic and luxurious to drink.  After my first few sips, I then added stevia - which is my personal favorite sweetener and the result was really QUITE good!  I thoroughly enjoyed this with my breakfast.The caffeine buzz was more than my usual yerba/green gives me.  It woke me up quickly and thoroughly without making me jittery.  I usually take my morning shower after breakfast and then have a second cup of tea, making me quite alert and ready for my day before 8 AM.  So after my shower, I decided to experiment with this tea and see what it would take to get this tea to go bitter.  For my second cup, I steeped it for a full 7.5 minutes and then took it onto the front porch for a relaxing time in the morning sun.  This cup was stronger, but still not bitter.  I really enjoyed the smooth, robust flavor, but found that the second cup delivered more of a caffeine punch than I am used to.  It made me a little bit jittery and I didn't like the sensation.So (for what it's worth from a novice), I thought this tea was better than Lipton.  Way, WAY better than Lipton.  It was comparable in taste, color and smell to Newman's Own, but I think it is even better than that.  And since I drink tea for the health benefits,  I love that it is organic. The caffeine high was noticeable.  I received this as a 2 oz free sample which means that the price wasn't a factor for me, but for those of you who are paying, be aware that this is $10.41 for only 4 oz of tea while Newman's Own Organic Royal is $9.80 on Amazon Prime for 7.05 oz.  And if you order on VitaCost, Newman's Own is only $3.99.  Capital Teas is better than Newman's Own, but not THAT much better.  I am deducting one star because I think it is too expensive and I kind of doubt that this is TOP quality tea because of the uneven size and shape of the leaves.  But it is still very good.Will it do the trick for a REAL tea connoisseur?  I don't know.  But as someone who has had to make a (regretful) switch from coffee, I found it to be very pleasant and the rich flavor, while not like coffee, held it's own and opened my eyes to the value of the flavor of a good cup of tea.  In fact, this has opened a whole new world to me and now I am interested in exploring what high quality tea has to offer.Also, a friend just gave me a Kombucha scoby and I plan to make a small batch of Kombucha from this tea and see what that is like.  From the taste, I think it will be awesome!  In about 2 weeks, I'll come back and let you know how the KT comes out.4 stars from a novice!  ;-)

My order came from The Tactical USA.  The props seem ok, but they are not OEM as listed.  They also are made out of a different material and  I had a difficult time balancing each one.My Suggestion when buying these props is to ask the distributers listing them if they are manufactured and packaged by Dji.  If they don't say yes,  look somewhere else to buy from.

Not sure where the drips go, but they are no lover visible.  I got the larger one so I could cut it in half and use the other half down the road.  But so far months later the first part is still doing the job
Wish this model was still being made.  I have one from 10 years ago and just found one for my granddaughter.  They are Fantastic for all ages and weight.  Adjustable air preasure

I could not be happier with these wheels.  I had no problem installing them and the only thing I would recommend is making sure you camp them before drilling, and then use a smaller drill and predrill.  it will speed things up a lot.  They work great,  may look a bit funny,  but I will take that in return for how well they work lol

I have had my MiniDrone for sometime now and in the beginning had a few issues.  But with each update it has performed so much better.  The new batteries that are coming with it are much improved and I am enjoying it a lot.  Each of my drones has a purpose and my mini drone is used a good part of time inside.  I love how it will hover and wait on the next command.  I had it outside yesterday and had it still under control about 50ft away.  Much further and it is hard to see the direction it is flying.  But indoors it is great as you can adjust how far up it will travel which is great if you want to avoid hitting the ceiling.  For me it is great, and my grandchildren enjoy this also because it is easy to control without worrying about loosing control.  And did I mention, you can click an icon and make it do all types of flips!  I am an owner of many AR Drones, the MiniDrone and the new Bebop.  People think I am a bit crazy when they see all my multi-rotors,  but then again it does keep me out of trouble.  lol  sometimes :-)Grandpa Jake

2:20 MinsI was asked if I would be interested in testing this charger.  I accepted as I do a number of reviews and testing on many types of products.  Everyone can use a solid well built charger for the car, but what separates this from many others is its ability to have 3 devices charging at the same time.  It has 3 ports 2.1a  2a  and 1a  this should cover most any device you have.  As you will hear in my video review I had my Ipad2,  Galaxy S4 and my hands free Speaker Phone charging at the same time.I also like the blue led light that shines just enough when it is dark.  I think the price is fantastic and you will be very happy if this is what you are looking for.  It will be the one I will keep in our car.  Hope this helpsGrandpa Jake

Wont be long before we are all suspended by some type of flying contraption lolAnyhow, hope you enjoy itGrandpa Jake http://tinyurl.com/ks8psgd
